runners.name: Gincident
runners.comment: Yet another to bounce back for the switch to this yard; holds leading claims once more
runners.spotlight: Yet another to bounce back for the switch to this yard when justifying strong support off a 3lb lower mark at Leicester early in the month; had excuses at Wolverhampton over the weekend and holds leading claims once more.

runners.name: Corundum
runners.owner: Mr And Mrs A E Pakenham
runners.comment: Closing novice second on the AW (9.5f) didn't amount to much; needs more on comeback
runners.spotlight: His closing novice second on the AW (9.5f) didn't amount to much, with his market rival bombing and the winner well held since; yard has been among the winners with its jumpers of late but he'll need to improve back from six months off.

stable_tour.quote: He has started fast work and should be out on the Flat in April. He hasn't won yet but was second on his final run last year and is rated 73. He's a big gelding who'll improve for a bit of maturity. He'd be my dark horse. 19-03-25

runners.name: Shelbourne
runners.comment: 4lb better off with Gincident, which entitles him to narrow the gap on second go at 1m
runners.spotlight: Heavy-ground winner last spring who looked to have no excuses behind Gincident at Leciester early in the month; 4lb better off with that one today, which entitles him to narrow the gap on just his second crack at beyond 7f.

stable_tour.quote: He can be his own worst enemy at times and can be quite aggressive in his racing, so I'd just love to see him relax. It's a problem in that he looks like he could win a race over six furlongs but I just know he needs a mile if he'd only settle. We'll wait for the grass and look for a stiff six furlongs or easy seven furlongs, and I'm very confident he'll be able to win a couple of races. In the process, he might mature a little bit and give us that chance to go further with him. 29-03-24

runners.name: Berry Clever
runners.comment: 7lb higher than when going close over C&D this time last year but should go well again
runners.spotlight: Up in the weights following two 7f Kempton wins last October and returns to turf 7lb higher than when going close over C&D this time last year; entitled to have come on for his recent AW comeback though.

runners.name: La Fleur Petrus
runners.owner: Chris Wright & The Grand Crus Lovers
runners.comment: Needs to settle better, going without the hood this time and upped in trip; bit to prove
runners.spotlight: Pulled hard in the usual hood on her debut for new connections a fortnight ago, having joined from Charlie Johnston for 20,000gns, and that would be a concern today going without that headgear and upped from 7f; has a bit to prove now in a first-time tongue-tie.

runners.name: Zariela
runners.comment: Made just a fair comeback three weeks ago for a yard still to get rolling; may lead
runners.spotlight: Adaptable as regards tactics but stays further and made all for her sole win (1m, AW) so may be the one to take them along, switched from cheekpieces to a visor; made just a fair comeback three weeks ago for a yard still to get rolling, though.

runners.name: Divot

runners.name: Keble Spirit
runners.comment: Bred to be better than he has shown and stepping up in trip on handicap debut should suit

runners.name: Requiem

runners.name: Something Splendid

runners.name: Hamdani Cruiser

runners.name: Beachborough Girl
runners.comment: Out of frame in three starts; makes handicap debut; bred to be better than she has shown
runners.spotlight: Out of the frame in three starts (all in a tongue-tie) at around 1m on good to soft/AW; makes her handicap debut and is bred to be better than she has shown.

runners.name: Squires Treaty
runners.comment: Placed over 1m in his first three AW handicaps but has regressed
runners.spotlight: Placed over 1m in his first three AW handicaps but has regressed, including on turf debut here (1m, good) this month; plenty to prove up in trip in returning cheekpieces.

4:38.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (GoingStick: 6.1) (Watered)

runners.name: Maelstrom

runners.name: The Feminine Urge
runners.comment: Will be suited by this extra 1f if able to reproduce her latest effort off the same mark

quotes.race: Like Racing TV On Facebook Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: I wasn't sure if we got up. I thought we had a great draw in stall one but it played against us. We were a few rows back further than I'd have liked and had to wait for a gap, but The Feminine Urge showed a good attitude when she got out - Callum Rodriguez, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Cooramook
runners.comment: Looks to go handicapping off a workable mark and remains open to improvement; considered
runners.spotlight: 100,000gns yearling who showed ability on her second run last autumn before faring as well as could have been expected on her comeback; looks to go handicapping off a workable mark and remains open to improvement.

runners.name: Gorgeous Mr George
runners.comment: Again looked ready for another crack at this trip last time; has improvement in him

2:58.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (GoingStick: 6.1) (Watered)

runners.name: Bovey Belle
runners.comment: Started massive prices for two AW starts, finishing a tailed-off last on each occasion
runners.spotlight: Started massive prices for two AW starts this year, finishing a tailed-off last on each occasion; first-time blinkers will need to make a huge difference.

runners.name: Highland Midge
runners.comment: First foal of trainer's 1m2f winner The Jean Genie; yard still to get rolling for the year
runners.spotlight: First foal of the trainer's dual 1m2f winner The Jean Genie; yard still to get rolling for the year but boasts a fair record here and she's worth tracking in the market.

runners.name: Miss Wong
runners.comment: Dam was a 1m4f Listed winner for the yard; step up in trip looks sure to suit this year
runners.spotlight: Dam was a 1m4f Listed winner for the yard, out of their Group 1 1m4f winner Madame Chiang; can improve on last autumn's two efforts now upped to middle distances and looks to have Queen Of Thieves to worry about.

stable_tour.quote: She's from a family we know well given we trained her dam and she's related to Madame Chiang, who won for us on Champions Day in 2014. She's done everything right. 04-09-24"

runners.name: Queen Of Thieves
runners.comment: Sister to top-class Cracksman; entitled to improve and should appreciate the stiffer test
runners.spotlight: Sister to top-class Cracksman; ran below market expectations on her soft-ground debut last autumn; similarly, better was expected on her comeback when well off the front pair at Newbury (1m2f, good), but she's entitled to improve and should appreciate the stiffer test again.

4:08.race_name: Tips For Every Race At raceday-ready.com Handicap
4:08.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (GoingStick: 6.1) (Watered)

runners.name: Gogo Yubari

prev_owners.owner: Gee Gee's Wine Bar & Dylan Cunha

runners.comment: Won five for Dylan Cunha last year; well held again at Wolverhampton yesterday
runners.spotlight: Won five for Dylan Cunha in the early months of last year, latterly off a 2lb higher mark; finished well held for her new yard early in the month and faded quickly back down to 5f having led at one stage yesterday (both at Wolverhampton).

quotes.race: Free Digital Racecard At raceday-ready.com Fillies' Handicap
quotes.quote: We paid five grand for Gogo Yubari at the mares' sale and we've won five races and had two places from ten starts in four months; it's been unreal - Dylan Cunha, trainer.

runners.name: Cabeza De Llave
runners.comment: Hasn't shone in his two starts here; didn't offer any immediate promise on comeback
runners.spotlight: Has gained a lot of his wins later in the year and hasn't shone in his two starts here; resumed on the AW a fortnight ago weighted to his best after two wins last autumn and didn't offer any immediate promise.

runners.name: Hint Of The Jungle
runners.comment: Pulled hard when a well-beaten last for his new yard (AW) last month
runners.spotlight: Dual 2yo winner for Ed Dunlop but struggled during a limited campaign last season before being sold for 8,000gns; the handicapper's proving quick to ease off but he pulled hard when a well-beaten last for his new yard (AW) last month.

quotes.race: At The Races App Form Study EBF Restricted Novice Stakes (Bands C And D) (Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I wanted to take a lead but Hint Of The Jungle latched on with me and I didn't want to take him back. He battled on and stuck his head out towards the line and he's really professional - Morgan Cole, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: 60 Years Of Porsche 911 EBF Restricted Maiden Stakes (Bands C/D) (EBF Qualifier) (GBB Race)(Div II)
quotes.quote: He's got a real high cruising speed. I'd upgrade Hint Of The Jungle as well because I was stuck in the middle of the track for a long way. He saw a lot of daylight the whole time and was just getting a bit lonely in front, but he's got a real good attitude. I think he'll end up being a bit better than a Beverley horse - Paul Mulrennan, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Coolagh Magic
runners.owner: Lady Emma Oshea And A Carson
runners.comment: Hasn't run on turf since 2022; in fair form of late and has a 5lb lower mark on grass
runners.spotlight: Wins have all come on the AW, mainly at Lingfield, and he hasn't run on turf since 2022; has been in fair form of late, without much luck, and has a 5lb lower mark on grass, so a case could be made in a weak handicap.

quotes.race: Ladbrokes Home Of The Odds Boost Handicap
quotes.quote: Coolagh Magic jumped out well and when I asked for a change of gear, he'd gone. He's always worked quite well and is probably getting quicker, having won over five here - Tony Hamilton, rider.

stable_tour.quote: He only came to us this summer and I deliberately didn't rush him. I thought he would go well first time out at Lingfield earlier this month but it was a pleasant surprise to see him come home in front. In his younger days he had won off a loftier mark, but he has been working well and I expect him to go on from here. 15-09-21

runners.name: Its Showtime
runners.comment: Well treated back on turf; the return of the usual headgear/tongue-tie is a positive too
runners.spotlight: It's not hard to argue she's better on turf than the AW and she's well treated, being 7lb lower than when going close over C&D last summer (behind Rebel Star's half-sister Angle Land); the return of the usual headgear/tongue-tie is a positive too.

runners.name: Rebel Star
runners.comment: 2nd on last three starts; the visor has helped and she's on the shortlist up a fair 2lb
runners.spotlight: Came away with an improver at Lingfield last month and again did nothing wrong in defeat last time, making it three seconds in a row; the visor has clearly helped and she's on the shortlist upped a fair 2lb.

runners.name: Sir Rodneyredblood
runners.comment: Doesn't run often on turf but likes it here and is better treated than on the AW; chance
runners.spotlight: Doesn't run often on turf but goes well here and is far better treated than on the AW; pestered in front when last of five behind Rebel Star last time and is capable of better on much more favourable terms.

runners.name: Banana

prev_owners.owner: Scott Dixon Racing , M Mahony , L Bond

runners.comment: Longstanding, low-level maiden who hasn't run on turf in almost three years; hard to fancy
runners.spotlight: Longstanding, low-level maiden who hasn't run on turf in almost three years; has been doing her racing of late over 6f and is again some way down the pecking order.

runners.name: In The Sunshine
runners.comment: Improvement needed on handicap debut after six months off
runners.spotlight: Beaten a long way at big prices in three starts over 7f/1m on soft/good to firm ground in the autumn; improvement needed on handicap debut after six months off.

runners.spotlight: Well beaten at triple-figure prices in three starts over 5f-1m on heavy/AW; tongue tied on handicap debut and probably of interest only if attracting support.

runners.name: Tiana Rose

runners.owner: The Ten Fools & A Horse Partnership

runners.spotlight: Improved plenty on previous efforts when third of eight on nursery debut at Brighton (6f, soft) last September, but well held in three subsequent starts over the same trip on AW; enough to prove for now, not least stamina; stable also runs Late Star.

runners.name: Zappata
runners.comment: The longer trip should suit on handicap debut and worth a market check; cheekpieces on
runners.spotlight: Wastes no time in switching to a handicap on turf debut having been well held in three starts over 6f/7f on AW last month; the longer trip should suit and cheekpieces are added to the tongue-tie; watch the market.

runners.name: No Gain
runners.comment: Close fourth on handicap debut at Wolverhampton in February but not so good last time
runners.spotlight: Greatly improved when beaten less than a length into fourth of nine on handicap debut at Wolverhampton (8.6f, AW; 80-1) in February, but didn't back it up at Chelmsford (7f, AW) this month; needs to bounce back.

runners.name: Runnindown A Dream
runners.comment: Has beaten just one rival in four starts over 5f-7f on the AW; best to look elsewhere
runners.spotlight: Big prices when beating just one rival in four starts over 5f-7f on the AW; best to look elsewhere.

runners.name: Late Star
runners.comment: Beat a total of one rival in three starts over 7f last year; major improvement required
runners.spotlight: Big prices and beat a total of one rival in three starts over 7f on good to firm/AW last year; major improvement required on handicap debut.

runners.name: Alkuwarrior

runners.name: Greek Gold
runners.comment: Stable has few go in first time and being such a late foal he may be one for later on
runners.spotlight: May foal by Magna Grecia; first foal; dam 7f 2yo winner (RPR 83), half-sister to 1m2f Group 1 winner Arabian Queen, out of dual Lancashire Oaks winner; nice pedigree, but stable has few go in first time and being such a late foal he may be one for later on.

runners.name: Moretons
runners.comment: Something to like on breeding; stable does have 2yo winners first time out; watch market
runners.spotlight: March foal by Cotai Glory; 100,000gns yearling; dam unraced half-sister to winners Doctor Brown (smart 6f-1m), Priceless (5f Group 2) and Brazen (useful 6f-1m including 2yo) out of 5f 2yo/6f winner; something to like on breeding and stable does have 2yo winners first time out; watch the market.

runners.name: Justice Twice
runners.comment: Midfield in the Brocklesby at Doncaster last month; open to improvement but needs it
runners.spotlight: March foal by Inns Of Court; 20-1 when midfield in the Brocklesby at Doncaster (5f, good to soft) last month; open to improvement but probably needs it.

runners.name: Magic Box

runners.spotlight: April foal by Showcasing; £34,000 yearling; half-sister to 6f 2yo winner Boy Browning (RPR 81); dam unplaced 7f/1m AW 2yo (57), sister to useful 6f/7f winner Samoot, out of 7f Group 3 winner Muthabara; top stable has a good record with 2yo newcomers; market will be revealing.

2:45.race_name: Lilley Plummer Risks City & Suburban Handicap (GBBPlus Race)
2:45.going_detailed: GOOD (Good to firm in places; watered; Sprint 7.0, Round 6.7)

runners.name: Sean
runners.comment: A messy Lincoln at Doncaster did not work out for him last time but he needs a second look
runners.spotlight: Ran respectably sole start here; 0-15 for this yard (multiple winner on the continent) but he ran well in defeat off higher marks at 1m/1m2f in Britain last summer and was the only one to threaten the odds-on Godolphin favourite when second of 16 in 1m1f handicap at Meydan in February; a messy Lincoln at Doncaster did not work out for him last month but he needs a second look.

stable_tour.quote: He's a tough one. He did very well in Dubai without winning last winter. He took some time to get over it and I think he was below par in the Diomed at Epsom and certainly below par in the Royal Hunt Cup. He came back and ran a good race at Ascot and was then just off it at Sandown the other day. He wants fast ground and some of those 1m1f races in Meydan are perfect for him. 11-09-24

runners.name: Kings Code
runners.comment: Never better than for Pontefract win (1m2f, good) eight days ago by 7l; has a 5lb penalty
runners.spotlight: Won twice at Wolverhampton (9.4f, AW) late last year and never better than when winning at Pontefract (1m2f, good) eight days ago, seeing as he did it by 7l after leading in the final 1f; below form sole start here (last May) and carries a 5lb penalty but he has to be in calculations.

quotes.race: Mitchell & Co. Building Services Handicap
quotes.quote: King's Code is a big lad and, with the ground as quick as it was, I thought he might struggle a bit, which he did early doors. The cheekpieces helped him concentrate, the penny dropped late and he closed really well - Sean Levey, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Stressfree
runners.comment: In the thick of it against three of these at Doncaster last time; needs to get the breaks
runners.spotlight: Unraced here, won sole start at Chester; extremely solid sequence at about 1m2f last July-October and, having won a maiden hurdle in February, he was as good as ever when close fourth of 16 off this mark to City Of Delight and Magico at Doncaster (1m2f, good; unraced on firmer) last month; comes from off the pace and that latest start was far from the first time he's met trouble in running; well capable of a bold show if he gets the breaks.

quotes.race: Agriculture And Equine Courses At SRUC Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Stressfree is a very talented horse on the Flat. It's only his second go today and Brian (Hughes) was pulling it up in front, and I knew we were going to quicken up the straight, so I was just hoping that his jumping was going to hold up, which it has done. There'll be a bigger picture for this horse I'm sure - Henry Brooke, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

stable_tour.quote: He should have won at Doncaster last time - he was all dressed up with nowhere to go. I ran him over hurdles over the winter to toughen him up a bit as he's a horse with a lot of ability who can be a bit soft. He could go for the City and Suburban next and might be one for the John Smith's Cup. 14-04-25

runners.name: Magico
runners.comment: Close at 1m2f twice this term, with fine burst at Doncaster latest against City Of Delight
runners.spotlight: Third in a maiden here early in career; gelded in November and improved form when beaten a neck over 1m2f at Chelmsford (AW) and Doncaster (good) in his two starts this season; wore first-time cheekpieces in the latter, unleashing a fine burst to hit the front in the final 1f before he was himself cut down by City Of Delight; bit more to prove on good to firm; up 2lb but can defy that if things fall right for him.

runners.name: Warda Jamila
runners.comment: 1m2f wins last May and September; further improvement is possible for in-form stable
runners.spotlight: Had 1m2f wins last May and September, latterly having to bide her time when she scored in last-gasp fashion at Haydock (good to soft; acts on good to firm); needs to improve but that's possible in this second season handicapping and the form of her stable is no disincentive.

quotes.race: British EBF Fillies' Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Warda Jamila has done nothing wrong there and was professional on her second start. She has a great mind and it will be interesting to see where she ends up distance-wise as she is related to Coltrane and by Calyx. She's a nice type - Jason Watson, jockey.

runners.name: Rathgar
runners.comment: Creditable fifth of 16 at Doncaster last month when just behind three of today's rivals
runners.spotlight: Versatile regarding ground and trip; had a solid season overall (1m6f and 1m2f winner) last year and reappeared with a creditable fifth of 16 at Doncaster last month when three of today's rivals had his measure but not by much; can make the running if necessary and he too is in the mix if he adapts to this track.

quotes.race: Weekly Rewards With tote Stayers Club Racing League Race 7 Handicap (Trainers Reg' To Racing League)
quotes.quote: It took us a while to really figure Rathgar out. I think his future lies over this kind of trip. He was relentless really, he jumped a lot better and he was able to keep the revs up from a long way out and responded well for pressure - David Probert, jockey, speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: City Of Delight
runners.owner: All For One Racing Iii & I Bandres
runners.comment: 5-6 record over 1m2f, most recently with three of these rivals close up at Doncaster
runners.spotlight: Won last summer on his first four starts once stepped up to 1m2f, on a range of ground, and he reappeared with another significantly improved effort when mowing down three of today's rivals to grab a 16-runner race at Doncaster (1m2f, good); can be ridden more prominently than he was that day and, although up another 4lb, it's hard to rule out further progress.

quotes.race: William Hill Top Price Guarantee Races Handicap
quotes.quote: City Of Delight stays this trip really well and has a big heart. What stuck out to me was his will to win, he is admirable really - Kieran Shoemark, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

2:10.going_detailed: GOOD (Good to firm in places; watered; Sprint 7.0, Round 6.7)

runners.name: Devils Advocate
runners.comment: Form of Chelmsford win has worked out nicely; stable has a great record in this race
runners.spotlight: Cost 350,000gns as a yearling; stayed on strongly for an emphatic success at Chelmsford (1m2f, AW) in his second autumn start and that form has worked out nicely; looks a very useful prospect and his stable has a great record in this race; strong credentials.

runners.name: Mirabeau
runners.owner: The Ffrench Revolution & Mrs T Hamilton
runners.comment: Progressive but chance depends on what the weather does; seems suited by soft/heavy
runners.spotlight: Progressive but his chance may depend on what the weather does, having gained his two wins on soft going then performed well in a heavy-ground Horris Hill; dam's side suggests he'll stay the new trip.

quotes.race: British EBF £100,000 Final (Colts And Geldings)
quotes.quote: That was a good performance and we've always liked Mirabeau. We thought he'd win first time at Newbury and he was the last off the bridle. He scoped badly afterwards and took a long time to come 100 per cent. He came on for his win at Brighton, he likes to get his toe in and he stays well. We'll probably put him away now and we hope he can make his mark in black type company next year - Dominic Ffench Davis, trainer.

quotes.race: Download The At The Races App EBF Restricted Maiden Stakes (Bands C/D) (EBF Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Funnily enough he [James Park Woods; winner of the preceding race] and Mirabeau did a cracking piece of work together last week. We knew if he ran well then Mirabeau would likewise and he bolted up. We always thought a lot of this horse and were a bit disappointed with his first run at Newbury. We scoped him and found mucus in his lungs and it took a while to get it right, but we came here full of confidence - Dominic Ffrench Davis, trainer.

runners.name: Prince Of The Seas
runners.comment: Form of Sandown success received a strong boost at Newmarket last week; promising
runners.spotlight: Sea The Stars colt who justified favouritism in Sandown maiden (1m, good) when last seen and that form received a strong boost at Newmarket last week; looks an interesting middle-distance prospect.

runners.name: Sea Scout
runners.comment: Plenty to find on bare figures but may build on his Lingfield win and improve further
runners.spotlight: Similar type to Prince Of The Seas, being a twice-raced son of Sea The Stars; has plenty to find on bare figures but may build on his Lingfield win (1m2f, AW) and show further progress.

quotes.race: Betfred Blue Riband Trial (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Sea Scout is a sleeper at home - he only does enough in his work - but has a fantastic Derby pedigree and we know he's going to stay a mile and a half. We were pretty confident he would handle the track and ground and we were quietly hopeful of a promising run. We didn't expect him to be such a big outsider of the field. It would be good to get him some more experience before the Derby if he comes out of this well and the Vase at Chester or the Dante at York could come under consideration before coming back here - Simon Crisford, joint-trainer, speaking on Racing TV.

runners.name: The Cursor
runners.comment: Frankel colt; showed plenty of promise at Doncaster last time; should do better still
runners.spotlight: The only maiden in this field but has raced just twice and showed plenty of promise, going down by only a neck, at Doncaster (1m2f, good to soft) latest; this Frankel colt should do better still and his trainer knows what it takes to land this prize, having won it three times.

runners.name: Tiberius Thunder
runners.owner: Amo Racing Limited & Giselle De Aguiar
runners.comment: Seemed to run very well in the Ballysax on second start; major player on that form
runners.spotlight: Twice-raced Irish colt who justified favouritism in Dundalk maiden (1m, AW) then appeared to run very well in the Ballysax at Leopardstown (1m2f, good to yielding); latter effort gives him major claims.

quotes.race: Put The Fun In Fundraising At Dundalk Maiden
quotes.quote: Tiberius Thunder was greener than I thought he would be but he hit the line nice. He will improve plenty and he will stay further - Wayne Lordan, rider.

runners.name: Trinity College

prev_owners.owner: M Matsushima & Mrs J Magnier & M Tabor & D Smith

runners.comment: Ballydoyle colt who made all at Naas on seasonal debut; leading chance on the figures
runners.spotlight: Seems versatile as regards ground; useful colt who made all for 2l success at Naas (1m) on seasonal debut, taking record to 2-6; likely to stay this new trip; seems well down the pecking order at Ballydoyle, and his trainer's underwhelming record in this contest features just one win (in 2019); however, holds a leading chance on form.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Maiden
quotes.quote: Trinity College is very genuine but we thought the blinkers would make him travel better. He will stay very well and is a middle-distance horse for next year. We will see after the weekend where he fits in - Chris Armstrong, assistant trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He made a winning start over a mile at Naas last month and had also had a few very good runs last season. I'd imagine he'll have no problem going a mile and a quarter. He could be a French Derby horse. 07-04-25

3:20.race_name: Weatherbys Global Stallions App Great Metropolitan Handicap (GBBPlus Race)
3:20.going_detailed: GOOD (Good to firm in places; watered; Sprint 7.0, Round 6.7)

runners.name: Miller Spirit
runners.comment: Tremendously progressive 2024 on the Flat included two wins over C&D in the mud
runners.spotlight: Had five wins in a tremendously progressive 2024 campaign on the Flat, with two of those wins over C&D in the mud; first and second in two hurdle races late in the year; needs to resume improvement and a move back from testing ground poses a big question; stable runs three.

quotes.race: Betfred Apprentices' Derby Handicap
quotes.quote: The ground is key to Miller Spirit and he loves that bit of give in it. We knew after he went well there last time that we had to come back for this. He's a nice horse but is very big, so was always going to improve from what he did last year - Gary Moore, trainer.

quotes.race: No Hurdles With Emplas Jump Jockeys Derby Handicap (For Professional Jump Jockeys)
quotes.quote: It went smoothly. Tom Queally has ridden the horse and he gave me plenty of helpful tips. The plan was to get a lead, Miller Spirit kept responding well for pressure and he hit the line well - David Noonan, rider, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Master Builder
runners.comment: Third of 16 in the Melrose at York (good to firm) and won at Haydock (good), both at 1m6f
runners.spotlight: Largely dodged fast ground last season but third of 16 in the Melrose at York (good to firm) and won at Haydock (good) next time; both of those (his best efforts) were at 1m6f with waiting tactics and there is a question over whether 1m4f is ideal, but he starts this campaign with potential.

quotes.race: Betfair Plays Different Handicap
quotes.quote: Master Builder did something really nice in the Melrose and we were quite confident that with a bit of cut in the ground, he would improve again. He switches off easily and quickly and they went very fast early on, so I wasn't too worried. You could see he was picking up the bridle and travelling better than anything else - David Menuisier, trainer.

runners.name: Roberto Escobarr
runners.comment: Last season went poorly; 13lb below peak mark but this short a trip asks a big question
runners.spotlight: Dual Group 3 winner (2m/1m7f) for other yards in 2023; he didn't beat many last February-October, including in four races for current yard, and although he's not been sent to the Middle East to start this campaign and is now 13lb below his peak mark, this short a trip asks a big question.

quotes.race: Racehorse Lotto Henry II Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: Roberto Escobarr was off for a lot of last year. We brought him back this year hoping he would qualify for All-Weather Finals Day but he was just a little bit rusty in that race and he finished third. We have just been waiting for this quicker ground. He wants good, good to firm ground and he is slightly unexposed over the two miles. It is lovely for him to win his Group race. His brother Pablo Escobarr won his Group race as well. We are delighted. He is as genuine as anything and Richard (Kingscote) said he was relaxed in front and was very comfortable travelling around there and he has stuck his head down and fought to the line which is fantastic. We hadn't really discussed any further than today. We are slightly ground dependent. We will get him out of this and I will have a chat with William (Haggas, trainer) and Mr Lootah and we will make a plan - Richard Knight, representing the winning owner Hussain Alabbas Lootah.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Race To The Ebor Grand Cup Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Roberto Escobarr did well. It was hard for him as he's still very raw and they were all spread out. He didn't really have anything to race with, but he stays well and just does enough. He's going the right way, he didn't like the ground last time at Ascot, he likes fast ground. I hope he'll go on improving as he's still quite a baby - Maureen Haggas, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: williamhill.com Best Odds Guaranteed Novice Stakes
quotes.quote: Roberto Escobarr is a grand horse. He has a good temperament and he'll stay well - Maureen Haggas, trainer's wife.

runners.name: Arqoob
runners.comment: Back up another 3lb but return to turf should be fine; respected as an in-form contender
runners.spotlight: Well beaten in 2022 on his only race at Epsom; move back to Flat this year has seen a resurgence in fortunes over 1m4f on Kempton AW last two starts, in which he was first beaten a nose and then made no mistake; back up another 3lb but return to turf should be fine and he's respected as an in-form contender.

quotes.race: Sri Lanka - The Jewel Of Asia Handicap Hurdle (Challenger Two Mile Hurdle Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: I was a bit surprised Arqoob went off favourite. We thought he had an each-way shout, but it is tough out there as the ground is testing. He was probably not in love with it, but he does like that hill. Bryony just waited a bit longer than normal and I think that was pretty key. He winged the last and that really sealed it. He is so consistent that you could set your watch by him. We will go home and look what there is for him, but I suppose we might be thinking about the Imperial Cup later in the season if we get his rating high enough - Lucy Wadham, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He was second last time at Kempton in a photo-finish, but we're still arguing about that and have asked them to look at the photograph again. They've agreed to do that. He has enjoyed being back on the Flat. We haven't ruled out running him over hurdles again when the spring ground arrives, so he's probably going to mix and match a bit. He's been running consistently in quite high-class Flat races, but he's been hard to win with and so it was slightly difficult what happened last time, even though I was pleased he ran so well. 19-03-25

runners.name: Asgards Captain
runners.comment: Came up a bit short in turf handicaps last April-June, including a C&D third off this mark
runners.spotlight: His five wins in 2024 were all on AW but he came up only a little short in turf handicaps last April-June, including with a C&D third off this mark on Derby day; did better on AW this winter than at Doncaster on last month's return to turf, but he is considered for a place.

runners.name: Kotari
runners.comment: Respectable fifth over C&D last June followed three wins (two on good ground) that spring
runners.spotlight: Respectable fifth over C&D last June on his only visit here; that followed three wins (two on good ground) in the spring and he's now just 1lb above his last winning mark; still no joy over hurdles this winter and absent since December but a case can be made; stable runs three.

runners.name: Small Fry
runners.comment: Flourished in July-October with three wins (two C&D) and three 2nds in space of six races
runners.spotlight: Flourished last July-October with three wins and three seconds in the space of six races, with the second of those wins over C&D; two modest runs over hurdles late in the year; more to prove on good or good to firm but he's respected for last season's progress; with 7lb claimer recruited and the stable running three, he needs a market check.

quotes.race: Get The Inside Track With raceday-ready.com Handicap
quotes.quote: It was a slow pace and I was held hostage to that slow running of the race. At halfway I was locked away and I had a look up and Callum was getting a freebie. It's always worrying when you see that but luckily I was able to get myself out of that position. Small Fry seemed more comfortable today and the step up in trip seemed to help - Tom Queally, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Sugar Road
runners.comment: Weakened into ninth of ten to Arqoob on handicap debut at Kempton (1m4f, AW; 11-2)
runners.spotlight: Three starts last summer, the clear pick when third at Southwell (1m3f, AW); put in his place by the winner in another novice there (1m4f; beat the rest) after a six-month break and he weakened into ninth of ten to Arqoob on handicap debut at Kempton (1m4f, AW; 11-2) latest, so he has plenty to prove as well as being the most lightly raced.

runners.name: Carnival Day
runners.comment: Respectable reappearance ten days ago failed to prove stamina for 1m4f at third attempt
runners.spotlight: 1m2f winner at Brighton (soft) and Sandown (good) last September; made a respectable reappearance at Brighton (good to firm) ten days ago but that failed to prove his stamina for 1m4f at the third attempt.

runners.name: Tryfan
runners.comment: Left Brian Ellison for 65,000gns in October; gelded; peak AW efforts give him a good shout
runners.spotlight: Some issues at the stalls but he was first and a close second in two 1m4f handicaps on the Newcastle AW, clearly his two best efforts; first run since leaving Brian Ellison for 65,000gns last October and gelded; those peak efforts give him a good shout.

stable_tour.quote: He's probably the best three-year-old we've got in the yard. He's really good and works very well and I'll be disappointed if he doesn't get rated in the 90s. He ran once last year when he finished third at Newcastle. We've had issues with the stalls with him as he's a big horse and he gave away six lengths at the start at Newcastle but was only beaten three lengths. The winner won again, so the form is all right. He's improved loads since last year. He's ready to go. 03-04-24

runners.name: Dashinwhitesargent
runners.comment: Got up close home in an Epsom handicap (1m2f, good; unraced on firmer) last August
runners.spotlight: Off the mark in AW novice (8.6f) last July and got up close home in an Epsom handicap (1m2f, good; unraced on firmer) in August; creditable fourth at Wolverhampton (AW) in October probably showed that he stays 1m4f; gelded since and he may well have more to offer at this trip; interesting.

stable_tour.quote: He ran well first time out in a handicap at Epsom, where he finished second but came back with a dirty scope, so it was probably better than it looked. It's taken a while to get him spot on but he's a fun three-year-old. 06-06-24

1:35.going_detailed: GOOD (Good to firm in places; watered; Sprint 7.0, Round 6.7)

runners.name: Spartan Arrow
runners.owner: Hambleton Racing Ltd Xxxi And Partner
runners.comment: Didn't live up to expectations last time but has possibilities if taking well to headgear
runners.spotlight: Record is 3-10, the most recent win on AW in March when narrowly beating Almaty Star; didn't live up to expectations at Musselburgh since but has possibilities if taking well to first-time headgear.

runners.name: Michaelas Boy
runners.comment: Has a better strike-rate on AW than on grass; three years since sole turf win
runners.spotlight: Ran creditably behind Spartan Arrow and Almaty Star in latest AW start; however, has a better strike-rate in that sphere than on grass and it's three years since his sole turf success.

quotes.race: British Stallion Studs EBF Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Shane rode Michaela's Boy two weeks ago and said he might need it, but he was professional and I knew he wasn't going to run a bad race. He's a straightforward horse. He went to post really good and has been cantering on that ground at home. We might go to Chester for the Lily Agnes - Richard Hughes, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's a lovely chestnut we bought from Richard Hughes's yard and he has done nothing but please us. He's won his last two races for us at Newcastle and Chelmsford and, having arrived with a mark of 78, will be starting this season on 94. Although that's 16lb higher I think he's definitely capable of improving again. He was quite quirky when he came but we've ironed out his problems and I think we can go even further with him now as he's a much stronger individual. He finished down the field in a 5½f race at Chantilly on Tuesday, but hopefully he'll improve on that and he may go to all-weather finals day at Newcastle. The only problem is that the sprint there is over 6f and he didn't get that trip last year. That's not to say he won't now that he has bulked up, but I would prefer it if the race were over 5f. 22-03-23

runners.name: Almaty Star
runners.comment: In good form on AW this year; Goodwood win last term suggests he'll take well to Epsom
runners.spotlight: In good form on AW this year and was beaten only a whisker by Spartan Arrow on penultimate outing; Goodwood success last September suggests he'll take well to Epsom; solid claims.

quotes.race: Esprit Couture 1er Cru Handicap
quotes.quote: Almaty Star has been a bit of a revelation since dropping him back to five and using those forcing tactics. Ray has given him quite an intelligent ride. He stacked them up and got them all caught on heels - Robert Cowell, trainer, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Jumbeau
runners.comment: Only 1-15 in handicaps but a 2022 novice win at Brighton suggests Epsom will suit
runners.spotlight: Couple of respectable efforts on AW this year; only 1-15 in handicaps but a 2022 novice success at Brighton suggests she'll take well to this venue; not dismissed.

stable_tour.quote: She was a first-time-out winner for us last year at Brighton, but despite running well on several subsequent occasions has yet to add to that. Her run in the Marygate, when third to Pillow Talk next time out, is probably the best run she has had. In fact, three of her last four runs have seen her finish second, so hopefully if we can get another two or three pounds off her mark then she can get back on the winning trail. She had been running over 7f which I thought looked to be stretching her so we dropped her back to 6f last weekend at Newmarket where she ran a lovely race, but unfortunately we came up against a progressive Charlie Appleby runner - Star Guest - but that was a very encouraging run as she had the rest of her opponents well beaten and you feel she is not far off winning again. 06-07-23

runners.name: Twilight Fun
runners.comment: Record of 3-5 (on AW) since wearing headgear; has won on turf; warrants respect
runners.spotlight: Record of 3-5 (on AW) since wearing headgear, making all at Chelmsford switched to blinkers (from cheekpieces) most recently; has won on turf; respected in the retained blinds, with further progress plausible.

runners.name: Fidelius
runners.comment: Made all in AW event on seasonal debut; has a consistent turf record; likely player
runners.spotlight: Made all under Tom Marquand at Chelmsford on seasonal debut, comfortably beating Existent and registering a third AW win; has a consistent turf record (33422) and looks a likely player returned to this sphere.

runners.name: One Night Stand
runners.comment: Ran well in the 2023 Dash; had an excuse in this race last year; on an attractive mark
runners.spotlight: Has a much better strike-rate on turf than on AW; however, ran well (close fifth) in the Dash here in 2023 and had an excuse (raced in unfavourable position) in this race last year; on an attractive mark.

quotes.race: Build Your Acca With BetUK Handicap
quotes.quote: One Night Stand is a horse who, when you get him to the front, can get a breather from the three to the two and slingshot off the bend, and I probably nicked it there - Kieran O'Neill, jockey.

runners.name: Existent
runners.comment: In a consistent vein of form but brings a portion of frustration (no win since 2022)
runners.spotlight: Consistent on AW since December and ties in with some of these rivals; capable of being involved and has each-way possibilities but brings a portion of frustration, having failed to win since 2022.

quotes.race: Betfair Palace House Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: Existent is a nice straightforward horse to deal with and hopefully he will now go on to the King's Stand Stakes. Tom (Morley, owner) and his mum have won the race twice before and we entered him for it last week. It is a bit of an ask, being rated 101, but we think he definitely warranted an entry and I think it should suit him. I think five is his best trip for us - Stuart Williams, trainer.

quotes.race: Prestige Agri Maiden Stakes (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: The race didn't go right at Ascot and Existent didn't come out of the race the way we would have liked. He's a strong horse now and as long as he's in good order then we'll look to go to the Horris Hill with him - John Gosden, trainer.

runners.name: Faustus
runners.comment: Likely to handle Epsom, having won at Brighton in 2023; could go well
runners.spotlight: Well exposed but was a profitable sprinter to follow last summer, having won at 12-1 and 16-1; likely to handle Epsom, having scored at Brighton in 2023; could go well.

runners.name: El Bufalo
runners.comment: Has failed to build on February win and faces a stiffer assignment back on turf
runners.spotlight: Campaigned mostly on AW; took well to first-time blinkers in February but has failed to build on that success and this return to turf presents a stiffer assignment; headgear retained.

runners.name: The Coffee Pod
runners.comment: Both wins at York; never dangerous in last year's 3yo Dash in sole Epsom run
runners.spotlight: Has gained both wins at York and may be more interesting when returned to that venue; never dangerous in last year's 3yo Dash in sole Epsom attempt; gelded over the winter.

quotes.race: Ire Incentive, It Pays To Buy Irish EBF Novice Stakes (GBB/IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: The Coffee Pod was third in the Hornblower last time to a couple of good horses, but we thought this would suit him. Richard says he wants 7f, maybe a mile eventually, so we might step him up next time. We've got the job done and hopefully go on from there - Tim Palin, racing director of Middleham Park Racing, owners.

5:00.going_detailed: GOOD (Good to firm in places; watered; Sprint 7.0, Round 6.7)

runners.name: Revich
runners.comment: No win since 2023; showed clear signs of decline last year; debut for new stable
runners.spotlight: Seven wins for Richard Spencer, the most recent win in 2023; showed clear signs of decline last year and was sold for 6,500gns after final start; best watched unless the market speaks favourably.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Daily Price Boosts Handicap
quotes.quote: I didn't really plan to be that far back, but I couldn't have gone much quicker. Revich clearly thrives on this track and this is his type of ground. He's a little terrier when he's under pressure and I got a really nice lead into it from Jason (Hart, jockey Titan Rock) and he took me to the winning line. I suppose they raced up the inside yesterday and it might be a bit chopped up on that rail. It's drying ground, it's fine - Hollie Doyle, jockey.

quotes.race: CAA Stellar Earl Grosvenor Handicap
quotes.quote: Revich doesn't know how to run a bad race but there's something about coming to Chester. He loves a bend, he likes it when it's soft and he was off his last winning mark so there were a lot of boxes ticked today. You need luck here and they did go plenty hard enough up front, to negate the fact that he didn't quite ping the lids as we'd have hoped. He got the gap at the right time but you still need the horse to go through it and he showed such a tenacious attitude to go through. Jim gave him a great ride, he didn't panic, he kept his head and the horse went through with it. We might look at a 70,000GBP handicap at Newbury next week to run in under a penalty because daylight was second and we may need to do something sharpish - Tim Palin, owner's racing manager.

quotes.race: #chestertogether Handicap
quotes.quote: The first-time visor has helped his confidence and he's quickened up nicely close home. We plotted this race up and he could potentially run back here in the 7.5f handicap on Thursday - Richard Spencer, trainer.

runners.name: Mafnood
runners.comment: Only 1-14 but needs a close look switched to this venue on first run for an Epsom yard
runners.spotlight: Only 1-14 for Richard Hannon and raced over longer trips last term (subsequently sold for 36,000gns) but needs a close look switched to this venue on first run for an Epsom yard; heed the market signals.

runners.name: Hodler
runners.comment: All wins at 7f but gives the impression this return to further is worth exploring
runners.spotlight: Has done all his winning over 7f but gives the impression this return to further is worth exploring; suited by Epsom (dual course scorer) and has defied higher marks; possibilities back here.

quotes.race: Everyone's Turf Handicap
quotes.quote: We were delighted when it kept raining as Hodler is a different horse on this sort of ground, he quickens on it and picks up well. He could go to Epsom on Oaks or Derby day, there are races over seven furlongs and a mile and half a furlong. I just hope it keeps raining! - Jim Boyle, trainer.

quotes.race: Choose Dutemann Handicap
quotes.quote: Hodler is a nice horse and I've only sat on him three times and on all occasions he has won. He just got the ground he loves - Ryan Sexton, jockey.

runners.name: Mostawaa
runners.comment: The only C&D winner in the field; interesting, assuming he retains ability aged nine
runners.spotlight: The only C&D winner in this field and gained that success on penultimate appearance (last September); fairly interesting back at Epsom, assuming he retains the same level of ability aged nine.

quotes.race: Stablemate By Agma Carlisle Bell Handicap
quotes.quote: Mostawaa has turned a corner in his old age. He won at Brighton two starts ago and then he went to York and toughed it out. I got a very easy lead that day and things fell right whereas today there was plenty of pace on paper, so you just never know. He stuck to it well on soft ground and I think we can investigate going up to ten furlongs now. Between the three and the two I didn't get much of a breather into him and we were going a good gallop. Myself and Pierre were kind of taking each other on but to be fair they both fought on well - Hollie Doyle, jockey.

quotes.race: Ice Co Supporting Macmillan Handicap
quotes.quote: I was a bit worried because Mostawaa didn't have his headgear on today but he jumped well, settled, and got into a nice rhythm. The further he went the better, and he loved the ground - Hollie Doyle, jockey.

runners.name: Tribal Rhythm
runners.comment: Five-race maiden; the booking of Tom Marquand catches the eye; check the betting
runners.spotlight: Five-race maiden who failed to improve in two handicaps last season for new stable; however, the booking of Tom Marquand catches the eye and market support should be heeded.

runners.name: Port Road
runners.comment: Maiden whose last two AW efforts suggest his turn is near; shortlisted on turf debut
runners.spotlight: Nine-race maiden whose turn looks near, having finished second off this mark in last two AW runs (7f/1m); represents an Epsom trainer and looks shortlist material switched to this venue on turf debut.

runners.name: Orbaan

prev_owners.owner: J C G Chua & C K Ong

runners.comment: Inconsistent since winning last year's Carlisle Bell; not sure what to expect
runners.spotlight: Defied a higher mark in last year's Carlisle Bell but that's his only success since 2022 and subsequent form is inconsistent; not entirely sure what to expect from this veteran.

quotes.race: Stablemate By AGMA Carlisle Bell Handicap
quotes.quote: Orbaan is nine years old now and dropping in class, and deserves to win a race like this - Danny Tudhope, jockey.

quotes.race: Dubai Duty Free Full Of Surprises Classified Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I checked with the track and they said they put a lot of water on and that the ground wasn't too fast. It was perfect for Orbaan and I wouldn't risk him on quick ground. He's better on softer ground and could go to York for the Ebor meeting - Jimmy Chua, owner.

quotes.race: Coral Golden Mile Handicap
quotes.quote: It's been a long time since Orbaan last won. The last time he won he did it like a Group horse in a handicap and hasn't won since. He's dropped down a bit but he got a good run through and the longer this horse travels, the better. He got the draw and it was the type of race that would suit him - David O'Meara, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He was a revelation last year, winning the Golden Mile at Goodwood and at the Shergar Cup. He really seemed to enjoy his racing again. He ran over the sharp seven at Haydock last weekend, but the Victoria Cup will suit him better. His season will be built around the heritage handicaps, particularly Goodwood. 04-05-23

runners.name: Uncle Dick
runners.comment: Has bits of Epsom form but all turf wins remain at Brighton
runners.spotlight: Should in theory be well suited by Epsom but two attempts have resulted in defeats; may be of greater interest when back at Brighton, having gained all seven turf wins there.

quotes.race: Carlsberg Danish Pilsner Brighton Mile Challenge Handicap (For the Brighton Mile Challenge Trophy)
quotes.quote: Uncle Dick is an absolute legend. He's won for all my apprentices either this year or last and just loves it at Brighton, he's just a different horse there. He'll have to go again on Thursday. If I don't run him in that there's not another race he can run in at Brighton this year so we might as well give it a go. He's such a good horse to have and the Brighton Mile is an amazing race to win. He's usually winning 2,500GBP races so it's nice to win one worth four times more - Eve Johnson Houghton, trainer.

runners.name: The Bitter Moose
runners.comment: 0-11 on turf but ran well in sole Epsom attempt; second start for new yard
runners.spotlight: Dual 7f AW winner for previous yard (stays 1m); blew the start on stable/seasonal debut; 0-11 on turf but looks equipped for this assignment, having performed well in sole Epsom attempt.

runners.name: Kracking
runners.comment: Clearcut win at Brighton ten days ago; should take well to Epsom; highly respected
runners.spotlight: Unraced on ground softer than good; registered a clearcut win under Warren Fentiman at Brighton (1m) returned to turf ten days ago, taking record in this sphere to 3-12; should take well to Epsom; highly respected.

quotes.race: Al Basti Equiworld, Dubai Apprentice Handicap (Whips To Be Carried, But Not Used) (RE Series)
quotes.quote: Kracking jumped well and travelled along really well. He was always doing enough and I never really felt any pressure from another horse. Mr [Stuart] Williams was confident so I just let him bowl along. I'm happy to be back with Mr Hannon doing what I love. I could do with an agent to keep the ball rolling into the winter and get a few more rides - Tyrese Cameron, jockey.

4:25.going_detailed: GOOD (Good to firm in places; watered; Sprint 7.0, Round 6.7)

runners.name: Celeborn
runners.comment: Solid 2yo campaign comprised a debut win and two placed efforts; warrants respect
runners.spotlight: Solid 2yo campaign (on soft/good to soft) comprised a debut win and two placed efforts, runner-up in Newmarket handicap (1m) latest; still open to further progress and warrants respect.

stable_tour.quote: He's pretty unexposed and was a winner on his debut in June, and I don't think many juveniles by Postponed tend to win at that time of year. He's wintered well and he'll be on the track pretty soon. He's going the right way and can certainly win races. 07-04-25

runners.name: Sir William
runners.comment: Bred to do better still, being the first foal of a useful performer for his connections
runners.spotlight: Best 2yo effort when close second at Haydock (1m, soft) on penultimate start; gelded over the winter; bred to do better still, being the first foal of a useful performer for his connections.

runners.name: Your Lordship
runners.comment: Thrice-raced colt who has clear possibilities, provided his progress is sustained
runners.spotlight: Thrice-raced colt whose form figures (532) reflect his steady progress, beaten only a whisker at Southwell (1m, AW) most recently; clear possibilities, provided the improvement is sustained.

runners.name: Excellent Echo
runners.owner: P J & Mrs J P Haycock
runners.comment: Related to a few winners for his owners; not dismissed on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Made the frame at Newbury (6.5f, heavy; gelded since) in final 2yo start and may well build on that effort as he's related to a few winners for his owners; upped in trip for handicap debut.

runners.name: Bulletin
runners.comment: Likely player provided the solidity he has shown on AW is transferred to turf
runners.spotlight: Gelded prior to 1m handicap win at Southwell (beat a subsequent scorer) on reappearance, taking his form figures (all on AW) to 4231; likely player provided he transfers the solidity to turf.

runners.name: Geo
runners.comment: May do better still when the ground is right; possibly unsuited by soft
runners.spotlight: Possibly unsuited by soft surface in final 2yo outing and is better judged on her Newbury success (7f, good to firm; handicap debut) the time before; may do better still when the ground is right.

runners.name: Mayday Malone
runners.comment: Chance of winning depends on how well he responds to gelding operation
runners.spotlight: Five-race maiden who has a fair level of ability but hasn't improved since handicapping; chance of winning depends on how well he responds to a physical tweak (gelded over the winter).

runners.name: Louie The Legend
runners.comment: Progressive in maidens but has regressed in two handicaps; gelded since latest
runners.spotlight: Progressive in maidens, winning at Chepstow (7f) the final time, but has regressed in two handicaps; gelded since latest and that could help turn things around.

runners.name: Best Adventure
runners.comment: Consistent on turf last term and holds a solid chance returned to this sphere
runners.spotlight: Consistent in defeat on turf last term and was hindered by coming from a difficult position on Tapeta at Southwell (behind Bulletin) on reappearance; solid claims returned to this sphere.

runners.name: Soy Loco
runners.comment: Represents an Epsom trainer; interesting switched to this venue on turf debut
runners.spotlight: Has shown ability, having been placed in two of his four AW runs; represents an Epsom trainer and looks interesting switched to this venue for turf/handicap debut, with improvement possible.

runners.name: Connie Moon
runners.comment: Yard's most recent handicap newcomer was successful; one to consider
runners.spotlight: Made the frame at Kempton (1m, AW) in final 2yo start and could take another step forward now qualified for a mark; her yard's most recent handicap newcomer was successful (SP 100-30).

runners.name: Play Me
runners.comment: Disappointing favourite on debut for new stable but can't be written off
runners.spotlight: Disappointing favourite at Nottingham (1m) this month on handicap/stable debut but is evidently thought capable of better still and can't be written off; one of two runners for his Epsom trainer.

runners.name: Turpin
runners.comment: Bred to do better still but isn't certain to stay this extended 1m
runners.spotlight: Ran encouragingly at Kempton (7f, AW) on seasonal debut and is bred to do better still, being out of a six-time winner (6f-7.6f) for his connections; not certain to stay this extended 1m, however.

3:55.race_name: Weatherbys Digital Solutions Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
3:55.going_detailed: GOOD (Good to firm in places; watered; Sprint 7.0, Round 6.7)

runners.name: Landing Board
runners.comment: Sole 4yo runner; seemed to be outstayed over 1m2f in only start for Jane Chapple-Hyam
runners.spotlight: Sole 4yo in the field; seemed to be outstayed over 1m2f at Chelmsford in only start for Jane Chapple-Hyam; subsequently sold for 15,000gns; drop in distance looks a plus.

runners.name: Jackknife
runners.comment: Kameko half-brother to Group 1 winner Defoe; notable connections; interesting debutant
runners.spotlight: Kameko half-brother to winners Defoe (1m-1m5f including Group 1; RPR 121) and Kareema (Qatar 1m1f), out of 1m2f winner (89); notable connections; interesting debutant, especially if the market speaks positively.

runners.name: Jet Packer
runners.comment: Good chance on best form but is the most exposed contender, being 0-7; new trip
runners.spotlight: Good chance on best 2yo form (6f/7f) for previous yard; however, he's the most exposed contender, being 0-7, and reappearance effort didn't suggest he's crying out for this new trip.

runners.name: Jonnie
runners.breeder: Culworth Grounds Farm & Make A Stand Ltd
runners.comment: 44,000gns yearling; by Nathaniel; less interesting than the other newcomer in this field
runners.spotlight: 44,000gns yearling; Nathaniel half-brother to French 1m/8.5f winner Monna Vanna, out of German 7f winner; less interesting than the other newcomer in this field.

runners.name: Middelton
runners.breeder: W H R John And Partners
runners.comment: Plenty to find on his AW efforts; gelded since last run
runners.spotlight: Judged on AW efforts he needs major improvement for the switch to turf and physical tweak (gelded since last run).

runners.name: Spirit Of Albion
runners.comment: Steady progress in autumn maidens culminated in narrow defeat at Kempton; in the mix
runners.spotlight: Steady progress in autumn maidens (7f) culminated in a narrow defeat on the Polytrack at Kempton; gives the impression this longer distance will suit; one of the main form contenders.

runners.name: The Kings Falcon
runners.owner: Hm The King & Hm The Queen
runners.comment: Clear second, despite still seeming green, at Kempton when last seen; leading contender
runners.spotlight: Royal runner whose autumn promise comprised a solid fourth at Newbury (winner followed up in Group 3) and clear second, despite still seeming green, at Kempton (1m, AW); gelded since; respected with further progress plausible.

runners.name: Too Don Juan
runners.comment: Rather disappointing at Newmarket but may yet confirm his Salisbury promise
runners.spotlight: Similar type to The King's Falcon, having been gelded since his two autumn starts; rather disappointing at Newmarket but is in excellent hands and may yet confirm his Salisbury promise (1m, heavy).

runners.name: Topteam
runners.comment: Needs to improve a good deal on his AW efforts
runners.spotlight: Similar type to Middleton, being a turf debutant who needs to improve a good deal on his two AW efforts.

6:13.race_name: R & A Mason Heating & Electrical Novices' Handicap Chase (GBB Race)

runners.name: Karuma Grey
runners.comment: 100-1 winner in December but hasn't built on that at all and now tries new headgear
runners.spotlight: 100-1 winner at Ffos Las in December (2m6f, heavy) when making his stable debut; hasn't built on that at all and tries new headgear here.

quotes.race: Adept GRP Cabinets Novices' Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We put a few quid on Karuma Grey, not a lot. The bookmakers got the price wrong - he loves wet ground. I reckon he is a Saturday horse if we can get him right. Shane came back and said he could be a Welsh National horse for next year - Aled Evans, owner, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: Goresbridge Maiden Hurdle (Div II)
quotes.quote: Karuma Grey is quirky and he doesn't like to get bullied and I just tried to keep things simple. He's a grand horse for the future - Diarmuid Moloney, rider.

runners.name: Camino Rocio
runners.comment: Left clear at Huntingdon but might have won anyway and he's on a roll; up 10lb
runners.spotlight: Has won all five completed starts for this yard but he went up 10lb for Huntingdon last time (2m7f, good) where he was left clear on the home bend; however, he might have won anyway and he's on a roll.

quotes.race: weatherbysshop.co.uk Novices' Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Camino Rocio likes to get on with things and he jumped well out front. He could even get further and this good ground is important to him - Sean Bowen, jockey.

quotes.race: Alan And Judy Speechley Memorial Novices' Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Camino Rocio doesn't need to make the running but he stays so well that it makes sense. He toughed it out from the last when the second came to him - Sean Bowen, rider.

runners.name: A Definite Getaway
runners.comment: Made all in a weak race last time but handicapper didn't overreact with just a 3lb rise
runners.spotlight: Now 3-7 over fences after making all over 3m at Exeter three weeks ago (on good ground that's ideal); he was odds-on for a weak race there but the handicapper didn't overreact with just a 3lb rise.

stable_tour.quote: His form has actually turned out quite well and he's been a proper, consistent horse. He won at Exeter in October and was second at Doncaster last time out behind The Kniphand. He doesn't like it soft but I'm sure he'll win his fair share later this year. 26-03-25

runners.name: Atlanta Brave
runners.comment: Dangerously well handicapped if he can turn a corner after wind surgery
runners.spotlight: Has become bitterly disappointing after starting out so well over fences, on one occasion pushing the subsequent Scottish National runner-up close over 3m2f at Newbury; dangerously well handicapped if he can turn a corner after wind surgery.

runners.name: Face Dmusic
runners.comment: C&D winner in November and wind surgery could enable him to get back on track
runners.spotlight: Beat an in-form opponent over C&D (good to soft) in November but was in trouble a long way out when a remote fourth on his return visit; wind surgery could enable him to get back on track.

quotes.race: Alpha Aggregates Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Face D'Music was very good today and we're very happy. He'd been schooling very well at home and jumped brilliantly today. It was a much-needed confidence booster for Shane [Quinlan, jockey]. It's horses for courses as he won over hurdles at Hereford in May too, even though he looks like he wants a more galloping track. He's only five and a few things went wrong earlier this season, but they're going right now - Katy Price, trainer.

runners.name: Climbing

prev_owners.owner: HM The Queen & The Late Sir Chips Keswick

runners.comment: Big shout on the form of his Kempton win; didn't enjoy the soft ground last time
runners.spotlight: Won at Kempton (2m4f, good) in November despite a serious blunder and it was his first time on soft ground when tailed off at Wincanton; well-bred gelding who should stay this far and could easily bounce back provided it doesn't get too wet.

7:13.race_name: Happy Birthday Malcolm & Danielle Handicap Hurdle

runners.name: Tapley
runners.breeder: Stephen Kemble Bloodstock Ltd & G Peck
runners.comment: Defied a higher mark earlier this season and he's been highly tried the last twice
runners.spotlight: Elizabeth Gale's claim eases his big weight and this is easier than very tough assignments the last twice; won off a slightly higher mark at Plumpton earlier this season.

runners.name: Moveit Like Minnie
runners.owner: F J Mills & W R Mills
runners.comment: Chequered record over fences continues last time but generally reliable over hurdles
runners.spotlight: Risky proposition over fences (twice ran out) but was running well when jinking and unseating his rider last time at Kempton; that was after three solid runs in handicap hurdles at Ascot and he's generally better behaved in this discipline.

quotes.race: Jason Salleh Memorial Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Maybe it was because Moveit Like Minnie was in front, but he just ran out. He didn't give me much warning. I was down the inner and he ran out on the outside, so he's gone the whole way across the fence. I felt I had the winner covered, but I'm not going to say I definitely would have won because nobody knows. For the horse to do what he did probably means he had plenty left in the tank - Tom Bellamy, jockey.

quotes.race: RhinoBet Michaelmas Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: We learnt Moveit Like Minnie needs two miles. He was always fading at the last over further and he doesn't anymore. That was brilliant and we are chuffed to bits. He does need better ground and the Betfair Hurdle is usually on softer ground, but we will look at a better handicap now - Nigel Twiston-Davies, trainer.

runners.name: Black Hawk Eagle
runners.comment: C&D winner on a useful mark and it was a good handicap he ran in last time at Taunton
runners.spotlight: Won over C&D in early 2024 off just 2lb lower, following up a win at Wincanton; some of this season's efforts read well and it was a good handicap he ran in last time at Taunton.

quotes.race: Boyle Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Black Hawk Eagle did it well enough in the end. I got left in front plenty early enough but he jumped well. I was very happy with him - Simon Torrens, rider.

runners.name: Prolific Profile
runners.comment: Three wins earlier this season and better again in defeat last time at Kempton
runners.spotlight: Won three on the bounce earlier this season and probably produced even better form in defeat at Kempton recently behind one in form; solid chance.

runners.name: Magic Seven
runners.comment: 4lb above last winning mark so needs to return from a break in top order
runners.spotlight: Won off a much reduced mark at Exeter (2m, good) in November but wasn't as good when third at Huntingdon and then finished tailed off at Cheltenham; will need to return from his break in top order, being 4lb above that last winning mark.

quotes.race: Get Emma's Offers At planetsportbet.com Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Magic Seven loves it around here, that's his third win at Hereford. I think he likes that good ground as well. He won well but it wasn't a great race. His jumping is getting a little bit better and he seems to be going the right way. We'll look for something stronger next - Jonjo O'Neill, trainer.

quotes.race: Cazoo Open National Hunt Flat Race (Category 1 Elimination) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Magic Seven looked good there, he's come on a lot from his first run and I think he learnt a lot. How good the race was remains to be seen but he couldn't have done it any nicer. We're very happy with him and he looks a horse for the future. We'll have a look at the Listed bumper at Ascot and then we'll see how good we are - Jonjo O'Neill, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He won his bumper at Hereford last season and made a winning return over hurdles back at the same track this month. It wasn't a deep race but he couldn't have done it much easier and stepping up in trip did him no harm. We'll probably run under a penalty next time and go from there. 14-11-23

runners.name: Cornish Storm
runners.comment: Maiden winner who returns to an easier track after finishing third at Exeter
runners.spotlight: Won a Taunton maiden hurdle in February but beaten nearly 20l in his first handicap at Exeter, where perhaps the stiff track found him out; this place could be more suitable and he's since run okay on the Flat.

runners.name: Goblet Of Fire
runners.comment: Good effort in a higher grade last time; fair shout provided he doesn't need the run
runners.spotlight: A length winner at Southwell in October (2m, good) and ran quite well off this 6lb higher mark at Wetherby; that was in a higher grade so likely to feature provided he doesn't need the run.

stable_tour.quote: He hasn't missed a beat all summer and just got beaten at Wolverhampton this month when going for his fourth win on the Flat since he last ran over hurdles in May. He still looks fantastic and we'll see which way to go as he continues his summer/autumn campaign. 22-10-24

runners.name: Clearance

prev_owners.owner: Kildonan Gold Racing 2 & I J Jardine

runners.comment: A Newton Abbot specialist who was tailed off at Taunton after a lengthy break
runners.spotlight: A Newton Abbot specialist (all seven hurdle wins there) who was tailed off at Taunton after a lengthy break; an 11yo now and others are readily preferred.

quotes.race: Don't Miss The Newton Abbot Country Show Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Clearance is absolutely incredible here. He's got so much speed, and Tom [Cannon] rides him with such confidence because of that. He beat a fresh four-year-old as well. I'm not sure when the next race here is but he'll be back - Michael Blake, trainer.

quotes.race: Betway Live Casino Handicap
quotes.quote: They got racing quite early which helped Clearance, as they were slowing up in the last furlong - Hector Crouch, jockey.

runners.name: Zhang Fei
runners.breeder: E A R L Haras De Mandore

prev_owners.owner: Hurun Racing, C S Norman, S Magnier

runners.comment: This looks tougher after 5lb rise and record after a break isn't overly encouraging
runners.spotlight: Goes well for Fern O'Brien, under whom he made all for a comfortable success at Fakenham just before Christmas (2m, good to soft); this looks tougher off a 5lb higher mark and record after a break isn't overly encouraging.

runners.name: Plantaroma
runners.breeder: E A R L Haras Du Grand Courgeon
runners.comment: Mostly consistent but remains a maiden and only three ran when second at Ludlow
runners.spotlight: Mostly consistent but remains a maiden and only three ran when second at Ludlow; can run well again but others are more convincing.

runners.name: Virtual Hug
runners.owner: Sas Logistics Contracts Ltd Nikki Evans
runners.comment: Long time since he won over hurdles; has been running just okay on the Flat
runners.spotlight: Capable at a modest level on the Flat and has won over hurdles, albeit a long time ago when trained in Ireland; the odd decent show on the AW this year but others appeal more on this belated return to jumping.

quotes.race: gowranpark.ie 3-Y-O Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Virtual Hug had two lovely runs and he's after learning a lot. His jumping stood to him today. He's not a winter horse and he'll get a good break now. He might come back to Dundalk in February or March - Conor O'Dwyer, trainer.

5:43.race_name: Silvershine Turf Services Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)

runners.name: Doctor Love
runners.comment: Went off a bit hot when beaten under 4l in a 2m novice at Ludlow (soft) the last time
runners.spotlight: Hooded the last twice; went off a bit hot when beaten under 4l in a 2m novice at Ludlow (soft) the last time; needs to settle down and perhaps best watched for now.

stable_tour.quote: A very talented horse who ran very keen in his bumper at Uttoxeter when they went no gallop. He tried to make all over hurdles at Ludlow when finishing third behind the Ben Pauling-trained winner [Meetmebythesea] with The Kemble Brewery in second. If we can get him to settle, he could be a very nice horse in the future. 19-02-25

runners.name: God Of Fire
runners.comment: Given Flat ability his second in a modest Plumpton maiden was underwhelming
runners.spotlight: Four-time Flat winner and quite useful, so his second in a modest maiden hurdle at Plumpton was rather underwhelming (2m, good); could build on that but needs to.

quotes.race: Unibet - Proudly Supporting Women In Racing Apprentice Handicap (Racing Excellence) (Qualifier)
quotes.quote: Since God Of Fire joined the stable he's progressed nicely and grown in confidence. He did that really nicely and, subject to how he comes out of this, we'll likely target Monday (at Windsor) - Claire Kubler, winning trainer speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Golden De Coeur
runners.breeder: O Burlot, N Burlot & M Burlot
runners.comment: Has threatened in bumpers, hurdles and fences; should nick a race sooner or later
runners.spotlight: The winner of two points; 15 defeats under rules split evenly between bumpers, hurdles and chases; has threatened in all those disciplines and should nick a race sooner or later, for all that he's twice been below par since a good run over fences here in January.

stable_tour.quote: Every time bar one he's been in the first four for us. We didn't pay a lot when we bought him. He's not the most unsound horse, but he's quite awkward looking. I think he just struggles jumping fences, so the plan is probably to go back over hurdles and see if that reaps any rewards. He was second to The Jukebox Man over hurdles and showed some good form. I think he was unlucky when third at Wetherby last time. The first two were very well handicapped, but he's just so consistent. He's a dream to train. 05-03-25

runners.name: Jackstell
runners.comment: Another fair run last time at Ascot behind one who was gifted an easy lead
runners.spotlight: Irish bumper winner; has hit the frame in all three runs over hurdles and the winner at Ascot last time made the most of a gifted lead (2m3f, good); this 6yo was noticeably strong in the market that day after wind surgery; respected.

runners.name: Military Alliance
runners.comment: Showed ability in a Flat maiden in Ireland where also fifth over hurdles; joined good yard
runners.spotlight: Went close in a 1m1f Leopardstown maiden (heavy) on debut but a well-held fifth over hurdles next time and didn't offer much in two runs back on the Flat; however, he has joined Harry Derham and that heightens interest.

runners.name: Monteria

prev_owners.owner: The Late Reg Gifford And Bernice Walter

runners.comment: Dual Flat winner but will need to run better than on his hurdling debut at Taunton
runners.spotlight: Had plenty of racing on the Flat and won twice over 1m2f on soft ground; will need to run better than on his hurdling debut at Taunton (2m, good; 40-1).

runners.name: Pillar The Poet
runners.comment: Never threatened to take a hand on hurdling debut at Southwell (2m, good to soft; 28-1)
runners.spotlight: Fifth of eight in a bumper and never threatened to take a hand on hurdling debut at Southwell (2m, good to soft; 28-1).

runners.name: Scintillante
runners.comment: Exposed as modest over hurdles and tailed off in a handicap here in November
runners.spotlight: Dual Flat winner but exposed as modest over hurdles and tailed off in a handicap here in November; up against it.

runners.name: Urblereagh
runners.comment: Finished well behind in two maidens some 714 days apart; hood added
runners.spotlight: Finished well behind in two maidens some 714 days apart; hood added to the tongue-tie fitted last time; opposable.

runners.name: You Moved On
runners.comment: Well beaten in a bumper for Olly Murphy and was pulled up at 300-1 on stable/hurdle debut
runners.spotlight: Well beaten in a bumper for Olly Murphy and was pulled up at 300-1 on stable/hurdle debut.

runners.name: Jubilee Girl
runners.comment: Flat winner; didn't look a natural jumper when tailed off on hurdling debut
runners.spotlight: Flat ability respected but didn't look a natural jumper when tailed off on hurdling debut at Sedgefield (2m4f, soft) and that was over a year ago.

runners.name: Al Mootamarid

prev_owners.owner: Sheikh Mohammed Bin Khalifa Al Maktoum

runners.comment: Regressed for Marco Botti and no sign of turning things around at Stratford
runners.spotlight: Useful 1m2f winner but regressed for Marco Botti and no sign of turning things around at Stratford.

runners.name: Sneaky Blinder
runners.breeder: Al Shaqab Racing & S C E A Des Prairies
runners.comment: 3-22 at a modest level on the Flat and stayed 1m4f, so could have a future over hurdles
runners.spotlight: Record of 3-22 at a modest level on the Flat and stayed 1m4f, so could have a future over hurdles.

runners.name: Chestnut Pete
runners.breeder: Messrs M E & A D I Harris
runners.comment: Up 7lb for latest win here but he does have competitive form off his new mark
runners.spotlight: Had a few places but was winning for a first time when coming clear in a 2m handicap here last month (good); up 7lb but has competitive form off his new mark and probably stays this far.

runners.name: Russian Ruler
runners.comment: Three non-completions in four starts for current yard and reservations remain
runners.spotlight: Ex-Nicky Henderson 8yo whose form hit the buffers last season under both codes; three non-completions in four starts for current yard and reservations remain.

stable_tour.quote: We've long held this lad in high regard, but there have been disappointments on the way. That said, he won his last two over hurdles and is a magnificent prospect for chasing - he could go a long way over fences. 30-10-23

runners.name: Greenrock Abbey
runners.comment: Should be well handicapped but this season hasn't got going at all
runners.spotlight: Both wins have been here at 2m; should be well handicapped but this season hasn't got going at all and can only be watched until hinting at a revival.
