stable_tour.quote: He's a big, scopey horse who won an Irish point-to-point before we bought him at the Cheltenham sale in March. I've been very happy with him and he'll go straight over hurdles, probably at two and a half miles with a view to stepping up in trip. 09-11-20

runners.name: Jimmyjeroo
runners.comment: Pulled up on only previous chase start; ran moderately back over hurdles last time
runners.spotlight: Hasn't had a lot of racing but was pulled up on chase debut in January and didn't pull up any trees back over hurdles 22 days ago; has a good bit to prove despite some help from the handicapper.

runners.name: Everyonesacritic
runners.comment: Beaten in his hat-trick bid but still has clear claims off same mark; goes well here
runners.spotlight: Followed back-to-back wins over C&D (good to soft) and at Leicester (2m4f, heavy) with a solid second back here on good ground; clear claims off an unaltered mark and any rain would be no problem.

stable_tour.quote: A naughty little horse. He won a hurdle race at Musselburgh in February and he'll win over fences - he was second last time at Leicester in a novice handicap chase behind Catch Catchfire. He's better than his current mark but would want everything to fall right for him because he's a little monkey. But he's a little monkey in a nice way - he'll definitely go and win somewhere when everything is perfect for him. 24-12-24

runners.name: Annie Nail
runners.comment: Has won over fences but modest runs the last twice and sold on for £3,000
runners.spotlight: Has won over fences and was mostly consistent for Alexendra Dunn, but was well beaten in two runs for Michael Wigham and then sold on for £3,000; bit to prove now.

runners.name: Clashmore Banter
runners.comment: Limited hurdler who goes chasing from 7lb out of the weights and she's hard to recommend
runners.spotlight: Limited hurdler who goes chasing from 7lb out of the weights and she's hard to recommend.

5:10.race_name: Cheltenham And Three Counties Racing Club Conditional Jockeys' Novices' Limited Handicap Hurdle

runners.name: Zarhanya
runners.comment: Had wind surgery ahead of this handicap debut and there's ability lurking
runners.spotlight: Her first two runs were promising when hooded and that aid is now left off, along with the tongue-tie tried when tailed off at Taunton last time; had wind surgery ahead of this handicap debut and there's ability lurking.

runners.name: Mr Zee
runners.comment: Didn't win by far at Taunton but only 4lb higher here; should give his running once more
runners.spotlight: Multiple Flat winner who got off the mark over hurdles at the 13th attempt at Taunton (2m, good) and that had been coming; didn't win by far but only 4lb higher here.

runners.name: Pooleys Promise
runners.comment: Well held in her completed starts, the latest a handicap over C&D when 40-1
runners.spotlight: Well held in her completed starts, the latest a handicap over C&D when 40-1; hard to warm to.

runners.name: Golden Moonshake
runners.comment: Went off 50-1 when pulled up on handicap debut in September
runners.spotlight: Third in a Stratford novice (2m2f, good) but even then he was well held and went off 50-1 when pulled up on handicap debut in September (in this first-time headgear combination); not crying out to be backed.

runners.name: Bradman
runners.comment: Easily his best run over hurdles was when under 6l away on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Won twice over 1m4f on the AW in early 2024; easily his best run over hurdles was when under 6l away on handicap debut a month ago (2m4f, good); that run offers hope.

runners.name: Fan Magnet
runners.breeder: E A R L Haras De La Haie Neuve
runners.comment: Nothing so far over hurdles, including handicap debut here in December
runners.spotlight: Showed a bit in a bumper but nothing so far over hurdles, including handicap debut here in December (2m; 50-1).

runners.name: Pooroldmackley
runners.comment: Apparently enjoyed the heavy ground when winning over fences at Newton Abbot on Saturday
runners.spotlight: Apparently appreciated the heavy ground when winning over fences at Newton Abbot on Saturday (2m5f); weighted to go well again despite being 3lb out of the weights and there's rain forecast.

7:43.race_name: Spa Motors Hereford Open Maiden National Hunt Flat Race (GBB Race)

runners.name: Bourding Pass
runners.comment: Two forms of headgear fitted from the outset and yard is 0-12 in bumpers recent seasons
runners.spotlight: Second foal out of a 2m2f hurdle runner-up and sister to bumper winner Mozo; it's not overly encouraging to see two forms of headgear fitted from the outset and yard is 0-12 in bumpers recent seasons.

runners.name: Captain Hugo
runners.comment: Half-brother to 2m4f/2m7f hurdle winner Thecornerhouse; dam 2m4f/3m hurdle winner
runners.spotlight: Fifth foal; half-brother to 2m4f/2m7f hurdle winner Thecornerhouse; dam 2m4f/3m hurdle winner, sister to 2m4f-3m1f chase winner Killard Point; stable's bumper horses have been going well all season and had a rules debutant win only recently at Newton Abbot when sent off favourite; any market confidence could be highly significant.

runners.name: Le Docteur
runners.comment: Dam French 2m-2m3f hurdle/chase winner, half-sister to smart jumper Chaninbar
runners.spotlight: Fifth foal; dam French 2m-2m3f hurdle/chase winner, half-sister to 2m hurdle/smart chase winner Chaninbar; Flat-geared yard 0-6 in bumpers.

runners.name: No Panic
runners.comment: Flat-bred 5yo; tongue tied for debut; stable has occasional success in bumpers
runners.spotlight: £20,000 3yo; third foal; half-brother to Japanese 4.5f-7f dirt winner Freesia Tesoro; dam unplaced 7f-1m4f (RPR 57), half-sister to US 1m2f Grade 2 winner Redding Colliery; tongue tied for debut; stable has occasional success in bumpers.

runners.name: Our Bobby Dazzler
runners.comment: Played his part in a contested lead before dropping away at Warwick a month ago
runners.spotlight: Played his part in a contested lead before dropping away at Warwick a month ago (good; 13-2); didn't appear to be unfancied and could be seen in a better light second time out.

runners.name: Pay Dirt
runners.comment: Newcomer from a yard that's 0-14 in these races the last five seasons
runners.spotlight: Second foal out of an unraced half-sister to winners Reign Suepreme (3m3f chase) and Sue Be It (2m/2m2f hurdle); trainer 0-14 in these races the last five seasons.

runners.name: Race To Base
runners.comment: Has the best form and the benefit of course experience, so clear claims
runners.spotlight: Irish point winner; beaten about 7l at Aintree and then only a length here (good to soft) behind his market rival who had shown ability in points; has the best form and the benefit of course experience, so clear claims.

runners.name: Miss Barfad
runners.comment: Dam a winning pointer and related to three successful jumpers; stable wins bumpers
runners.spotlight: First foal; dam a winning pointer and half-sister to winners Will O'The West (2m/2m3f hurdle), Miss Estela (bumper/2m-2m3f hurdle) and Be My Present (bumper/2m hurdle); stable had two bumper winners this campaign and 7-72 in the last five seasons; the only mare in this field.

runners.name: Emerald Time
runners.comment: Raced freely and didn't quite get home at Catterick, though was beaten under 8l
runners.spotlight: Beaten just under 8l on good to soft at Catterick in January, not quite getting home after racing freely; entitled to build on that initial effort.

runners.name: Josh Central
runners.comment: Will need more than at Newton Abbot last time and he's bred to stay much further
runners.spotlight: Finished fifth in two starts for Tom Weston, getting closer the second time when 4l off the winner at Newton Abbot (good); likely that he needs to find something on that form (perhaps flattered off a steady pace) and he's bred to stay much further.

4:12.race_name: Church House Investment Management Handicap Hurdle

runners.name: Fingals Hill
runners.comment: Made all at Newcastle three weeks ago; probably still on workable mark after 5lb rise
runners.spotlight: Made all to score by 6l at Newcastle (2m4f, good) three weeks ago and is now 6-20 over hurdles; also suited by this C&D and probably still on a workable mark after recent 5lb rise; likely contender.

quotes.race: Castletown Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I only have two horses so how could I be confident but Fingal's Hill is a good trier - we'll get to the bottom of him eventually but he keeps trying - Peter Atkinson, trainer.

runners.name: Imperial Data
runners.comment: Back in the groove with creditable second in C&D series final last month; good chance
runners.spotlight: Returned from layoff with two quiet runs this year but got back in the groove with creditable second of 16 behind Starlyte in competitive series final over C&D (good to soft) last month; also suited by good ground; must be considered.

quotes.race: Best Odds Guaranteed Daily With Vickers.Bet Handicap Hurdle (Go North Cab On Target Qualifier)
quotes.quote: It (the win) was too late for my liking! It was a learning curve and Imperial Data was getting into the bottom of them a bit when jumping. The track rode beautifully - Ross Chapman, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: We've given him a winter holiday as he needs decent ground and he's just coming back now, with a view to probably going novice chasing through the spring and summer. He was progressive after his wind op, which has made a big difference. He was quite an anxious horse before his races, but all that has stopped as I'd imagine he was thinking about his wind before. He's related to Dorans Pride and is a lovely staying chase prospect for John Wade. 24-01-24

runners.name: Fostersisland
runners.comment: On the downgrade now and was just a respectable fifth in first-time cheekpieces last month
runners.spotlight: Good servant to connections over the years (six hurdle wins); on the downgrade now, though, and was just a respectable fifth in first-time cheekpieces (retained) at regular haunt Wetherby (2m5f, good) last month.

runners.name: Starlyte
runners.comment: Resurgent mare who won a competitive series final over C&D last month; in the mix again
runners.spotlight: Resurgent mare who arguably posted career-best performance when coming from off the pace in competitive series final over C&D (good to soft) last month, beating Imperial Data by over 4l; 7lb higher today but the faster ground will also suit; ought to be right in the thick of things again.

quotes.race: Ladbrokes Go North Cab On Target Handicap Hurdle (Series Final) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I love racing because of the horses and Starlyte is the sort of horse I love. She's only tiny but she's so brave. You have to drop her in and let her pass horses and I'm delighted for the owners Allan and Anne Grant who've just got married - Lucinda Russell, trainer.

quotes.race: Follow Thehawkponteland On Instagram Mares' Handicap Hurdle (Go North Lady Buttons Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: Starlyte needs a fast-run two-and-a-half miles and she's the most game horse. It's her attitude that wins her races - Lucinda Russell, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: She came to us from the Flat and made a flying start by winning a 2m4½f Newcastle handicap hurdle. We'll keep her to that trip with a view to going up to 3m later. She desperately needs good ground and is ready to go as soon as things dry out. 25-01-23

runners.name: Magic Wave
runners.comment: Returned from layoff with encouraging run in February but well beaten since
runners.spotlight: Low-mileage 9yo with 1-7 strike-rate over hurdles; returned from layoff with very encouraging sixth of 17 at Wetherby (2m3f, soft) in February but month's run there (2m5f, good) was very disappointing and it's hard to know what to expect from him here.

runners.name: Sauce Of Life
runners.owner: Mrs I C Sellars And Miss D C Sellars

prev_owners.owner: Mrs I C Sellars & Major Philip Arkwright

runners.comment: Lightly raced 10yo; rallied for narrow win in December; may still have potential
runners.spotlight: Dual bumper winner; very lightly raced since launching hurdling career with two promising runs in autumn 2021 but rallied well for narrow win in five-runner Doncaster handicap (2m3f, good to soft) in December and may still have a bigger run him.

quotes.race: 2025 Annual Membership Novices' Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Sauce Of Life has had his issues over the years but his owners have given him plenty of time and now they're starting to get the rewards. He just took his time to get into top gear but, once he did, he was away and gone - Danny McMenamin, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

stable_tour.quote: The slow gallop didn't help him at all on his first run over hurdles at Wetherby. He jumped well, travelled strongly, but it turned into a sprint and it caught him out for a furlong until he got himself gathered up and realised he had to change a couple of gears. The race was over then, but he's come back all right and should be winning plenty of races. 22-11-21

He won both his bumper starts and then finished placed twice over hurdles, the form of which has worked out well. We'll get him back over hurdles in about a month's time. He has plenty of ability if we can keep the wheels on him. 25-10-23

4:45.race_name: Watch On Racing TV Handicap Chase (GBB Race)

runners.name: Achille Des Rocs
runners.comment: Dual hurdle winner in late 2024; looks a good prospect for chasing
runners.spotlight: Low-mileage 6yo who was placed in Irish points in early 2024 and ended last year with two good-ground hurdle wins (2m/2m3f); not seen to same effect on heavy ground in January but is back on a sound surface for this chasing debut and looks a good prospect for fences; cheekpieces on.

runners.name: Destiny Is All
runners.comment: Suffered dip in form after winning seasonal debut and fell when last in action
runners.spotlight: Five-time chase winner (once over C&D); back on a good mark now but suffered dip in form after his winning seasonal debut at Ayr (3m, good to soft) in October and fell when last in action.

stable_tour.quote: He has been quietly improving with three wins in his last five races. The last of those came two starts ago at Kelso off a mark of 107. The handicapper put this very genuine horse up 3lb and we still have some wiggle room to add more wins. I love the way he travels in his races and courses like Ayr and Newcastle are ideal for him. 25-01-23

runners.name: Roger Rarebit
runners.comment: Ran well from the front on both outings this season but may need significant rain here
runners.spotlight: Ran quite well from the front on both starts this season (3m/2m4f) and might be boosted by the refitted visor today but both wins were gained on slow ground and it's questionable whether there'll be enough rain for him.

stable_tour.quote: He made his debut last December when third in a junior bumper at Hereford. He had to run him at the time for the benefit of his mental state. In fairness he is a big individual who was very precocious, but he'll start back over hurdles. 19-10-21

runners.name: Heroique De Maulde
runners.breeder: S C E A De Maulde
runners.comment: Flopped badly last time but was back in good form two runs ago; remains well handicapped
runners.spotlight: Bounced back to form on fourth start for current stable, chasing home a rejuvenated rival at Newcastle (2m7f, good) last month; flopped badly when favourite for next run but remains well handicapped and is impossible to rule out.

runners.name: Super Citizen
runners.comment: Reeled in Whosmaydaddy at Carlisle this month; player if in right mood again here
runners.spotlight: No longer the force of old but capitalised upon some help from the handicapper at Carlisle (3m, good) this month, keeping on well to reel in Whosmydaddy; can cope with recent 2lb nudge if in the right mood again.

quotes.race: John Thomas McNamara Series (Q.R.) Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Super Citizen loves this place and the race suited him, it obviously suited him last year and suited him this year. He's not a horse that usually pulls out a lot and I'd rather have seen him two lengths clear at the last. He's honest, jumps well and stays - Eugene O'Sullivan, trainer.

runners.name: Whosmydaddy

prev_owners.owner: C Myers, Mrs S Westrope, S Andrew & T Ellis

runners.comment: Has mixed record over last year but ran well behind Super Citizen this month
runners.spotlight: Has rather mixed record since winning twice (2m7f/3m) for Sandy Thomson towards end of last season but ran big race before succumbing to Super Citizen at Carlisle (3m, good) a fortnight ago; a possible.

stable_tour.quote: He was a very impressive winner of his point-to-point before joining us. He's a smashing looker who moves well, and not the type to want winter ground. We may start him off in a bumper at the Scottish National meeting, as he's owned by Jimmy Fire. He's such a nice prospect and we won't be rushing him. 06-04-23

runners.name: Jamesieconn
runners.comment: Won on chase/handicap debut in February; held twice since but may still have potential
runners.spotlight: Rewarded market support when battling well to win on chase/handicap debut at Doncaster (3m2f, good) in February; safely held twice since but was found to be coughing on first occasion and his latest run came in a competitive series final; may still have potential and can be given another chance.

runners.name: Wotsmyname

prev_owners.owner: K Jardine R Griffiths S Greig

runners.comment: Placed twice in early part of this year but form has slumped since; 9lb wrong today
runners.spotlight: 22-race maiden; placed off lowly marks in consecutive chases in January/February (2m4f/3m, good to soft) but was pulled up on two of his three subsequent starts and is 9lb out of the weights here.

3:40.race_name: Racing TV Profits Returned To Racing Handicap Chase

runners.name: Topofthecotswolds
runners.comment: Patently not the force of old but positives can be drawn from his latest run; new headgear
runners.spotlight: Useful over several seasons when trained by Nigel Twiston-Davies; signed off for him with some below-par runs in the autumn and made low-key start for new stable this year but significant positives can be drawn from his run in refitted cheekpieces at Sedgefield (3m2f, good) last month and he has possibilities here if combination of drop back in trip and first-time visor pays dividends.

runners.name: Cracking Destiny

prev_owners.owner: Mrs Louise Whillans & King for a Day
Mrs Louise Whillans & King for a Day

runners.comment: Regressive 12yo who is having a disappointing campaign; needs to turn a corner
runners.spotlight: Useful in his prime but long in the tooth now and this season has been disappointing; travelled well to a point in first-time cheekpieces at Ludlow (2m4f, good to soft) in December but didn't find much when the chips were down; no headgear today; needs four-month break to have done him good.

quotes.race: Prince Philip Perpetual Challenge Trophy Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I thought Cracking Destiny would run well but I didn't think he had that in him. Craig said they went quick early on and it played to his strengths, as he sits off the pace and needs them to go fast over two miles - Ewan Whillans, trainer, speaking on Racing TV.

quotes.race: Healthy Pets Chase (A Novices' Limited Handicap)
quotes.quote: Cracking Destiny's come to life in handicaps and jumps fences really well. He's a horse we'll try to win a couple more with and will probably go to a dispersal sale at the end of the season, but that's because the owners want top, top horses and Gold Cup winners. Cracking Destiny won't be that, but he'll do a good job and will have a great time until May - Ryan Tongue, racing manager to Mike Grech and Stuart Pakin, owners.

runners.name: Instinct Dainay
runners.comment: Only minor promise in three novice/maiden hurdles; now chasing on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Showed nothing more than minor promise when beaten 30l+ in three maiden/novice hurdles (2m-2m4f) during the winter and seems rather harshly treated for this handicap debut but, nevetheless, he's open to significant improvement if he takes well to fences.

runners.name: Friary Rock
runners.comment: Out of form when last seen last spring but resumes on workable mark; market may guide
runners.spotlight: Four-time chaser winner; out of form when last in action last spring but resumes on a workable mark and with trip/ground suitable; market may guide.

runners.name: Duty Calls
runners.comment: Runs this track well but has been out of form this season and is best on soft ground
runners.spotlight: Ended last season with a course win (2m1f, soft) and will be fine over today's longer trip but has been badly out of form this term and seems best suited by soft ground.

quotes.race: Lengthen The Odds At BetVictor Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: We've got his confidence back. Duty Calls needs further than two miles but doesn't quite get two and a half so the strong pace worked out well for him; Sandy Forster, trainer.

runners.name: Low Mileage
runners.comment: 0-16 over fences; went close two starts ago but didn't fire at Hexham last month
runners.spotlight: 0-16 over fences; went close off much reduced mark at Musselburgh (2m4f, good to soft) in February and has claims here if judged on that form but didn't fire at Hexham last month.

runners.name: The Jad Factor
runners.comment: Won in January but two very poor runs have followed; has a lot to prove all of a sudden
runners.spotlight: Stayed on well to win in today's headgear combination at Newcastle (2m4f, good to soft) in January, his second run after a long layoff, but two very poor performances have followed and he has a lot to prove all of a sudden.

stable_tour.quote: He'd been off a long time and we were delighted with his first start for us at Wetherby and then he won at Newcastle last week. We'll find something in his grade and he probably needs 3m. Where he's rated now, you'd hope he could run up a sequence. 22-01-25

runners.name: Pure Surf

prev_owners.owner: Mrs C Brown & Exors Of M Wares

runners.comment: Held on well for small-field win at Newcastle this month and ran well in defeat soon after
runners.spotlight: Held on well to beat three rivals under Pippa Brown at Newcastle (2m4f, good) this month, her eighth start over fences, and ran at least as well when close second at Sedgefield (2m3f, good) six days later; evidently in very good nick; might be the answer.

runners.name: Toombridge
runners.breeder: Little Lodge Farm & Lucky Bin Racing
runners.comment: Has posted a couple of fairly good efforts this year but latest run was a backward step
runners.spotlight: Gave good account before weakening into fourth of 15 at Carlisle (3m, soft; first-time cheekpieces) in February and was again running well before penultimate-fence fall at Newcastle (2m4f, good) last month but his latest run was a backward step and he's 3lb wrong here.

2:30.race_name: Every Race Live On Racing TV Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)

runners.name: Double Digits
runners.comment: Much improved form on last two outings, latterly when winning at Carlisle this month
runners.spotlight: Displayed major improvement when very close second to short-odds favourite at Newcastle (2m1f, good) last month and did not need to make any further progress to justify short odds himself at Carlisle (2m1f, good) a fortnight ago; has another big role to play today.

runners.name: Evaluation
runners.comment: Easily won uncompetitive race on hurdling debut but two lesser efforts have followed
runners.spotlight: Useful Flat racer who easily won uncompetitive Ayr novice (2m, good) on hurdling debut in November; two disappointing efforts have followed, though, and he now has a point to prove.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Sunday Series Stayers Handicap
quotes.quote: It depends what mark Evaluation ends up with but there's a staying race at the Sunday Series at Musselburgh in two weeks and as long as he's okay from a handicapping point of view he'll go there - Keith Dalgleish, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He was a very good second in the Northumberland Plate this year and we'll get a move on with hurdling now. He's very exciting. 30-10-24

runners.name: Clan Chieftain
runners.comment: Fairly useful on the Flat but safely held on both hurdling starts
runners.spotlight: Fairly useful stayer on the Flat for Ralph Beckett but safely held in two maiden hurdles for new stable towards end of last year and needs to take a big step forward here.

runners.name: Fiver Friday
runners.comment: Useful Flat racer who won 20-runner Navan maiden on recent hurdling debut; good chance
runners.spotlight: Developed into a useful Flat racer last year and made very good start to hurdling career this month, winning 20-runner Navan maiden (2m, good to yielding); will be a very tough nut to crack if she's in similar form here, and she has very obvious scope to build on that performance.

quotes.race: TRM Speedxcell Multi Vitamin And Mineral Tonic Handicap
quotes.quote: Fiver Friday handled the course here from her maiden form  and for her to get her head in front in Ireland is brilliant. They went plenty hard early on and set it up for her - Paul Traynor, trainer.

runners.name: Nae Bother At A
runners.comment: Well beaten at triple-digit odds on all three hurdling starts last year; had wind op since
runners.spotlight: Well beaten at triple-digit odds on all three hurdling starts last year (2m-2m6f); needs subsequent wind op to have made a huge difference.

runners.name: Thunder Gap
runners.comment: 0-14 under all codes and faces another tough task today
runners.spotlight: Not disgraced when sixth in 2m2f novice hurdle here a fortnight ago but is now 0-14 under all codes and faces another tough task today.

runners.name: Delayed Charm
runners.comment: Showed very little on the Flat and has struggled on both hurdling starts
runners.spotlight: Showed very little on the Flat for Anthony Carson and has struggled on both hurdling starts for Maurice Barnes.

runners.name: Keady Town
runners.comment: Fair on the Flat at his best but last summer's stable debut was very disappointing
runners.spotlight: Showed fair form (albeit without winning) at up to 1m2f on the Flat for Richard Hughes but last summer's stable debut was very disappointing and this hurdling debut comes after a 248-day layoff; had wind op in February.

runners.name: Top Flight Century
runners.comment: Lowly rated Flat maiden; soundly beaten here on recent stable/hurdle debut
runners.spotlight: Lowly rated Flat maiden who was soundly beaten here (2m2f, good) when 66-1 for stable/hurdle debut a fortnight ago.

3:05.race_name: Visit racingtv.com Mares' Novices' Limited Handicap Hurdle

runners.name: Isabel De Clare
runners.comment: Safely held on handicap debut in February and well beaten in maiden since; cheekpieces on
runners.spotlight: Showed some hurdling promise during the winter but was safely held on handicap debut at Wetherby (2m3f, soft) in February, and her run in a good-ground maiden over that C&D last month was even more disappointing; moves up in trip and sports first-time cheekpieces.

runners.name: Park Hind
runners.comment: Recently won a five-runner maiden point; has a lot more on her plate here
runners.spotlight: 0-18 under rules when trained in Ireland; won a five-runner maiden point for new connections last week but has a lot more on her plate here.

runners.name: Rose Of Kalanisi
runners.comment: Didn't run badly in a soft-ground chase in January; reverts to hurdling for new stable
runners.spotlight: Irish raider with 0-14 strike-rate under rules; didn't run badly in a soft-ground handicap chase (3m) on latest outing in January but is quite tricky to weigh up on her return to hurdling for a new stable.

runners.name: Tread Softly Now
runners.comment: Scored over 2m2f here a fortnight ago and is now 2-4 in handicaps; resepected
runners.spotlight: 2-4 since switched to handicaps and fitted with cheekpieces, the latter win gained here (2m2f, good; Winds Of Winter second) this month; not yet proven over this far but still makes more appeal than most of these.

runners.name: Anamanda

prev_owners.owner: Paul Moroney, Whitehaven Investments Pty Ltd Et Al

runners.comment: Placed off today's mark in competitive series final last month; high on the list
runners.spotlight: 0-11 over hurdles but has been knocking on the door since autumn; placed off this mark in competitive series final at Musselburgh (3m, good to soft) last month and can cope with today's drop back in trip; high on the list.

stable_tour.quote: She's come off the Flat in France, where she has won this year at Longchamp and Chantilly. She's a very nice filly who jumps hurdles really well and loves soft ground. She's ready to run and should be one to follow this winter in mares' novice hurdles. 22-11-23

runners.name: Our Girl Sal
runners.comment: Well handicapped on old rules form and won Irish point by 6l last month
runners.spotlight: 0-10 over hurdles in Ireland but won Irish point by 6l last month (yielding ground); well handicapped on some of her old rules form and well worth a glance in the betting before this stable debut.

runners.name: Winds Of Winter
runners.comment: Placed several times since last summer, including a close second here (2m2f) this month
runners.spotlight: 0-13 over hurdles overall but placed several times for current stable since last summer, most recently when close second to Tread Softly Now here (2m2f, good) two weeks ago; today's trip will also suit; respected.

runners.name: Bleu Lagune
runners.comment: Showed no significant promise in four maiden/novice hurdles; may do better in handicaps
runners.spotlight: Showed no significant promise in four maiden/novice hurdles at around 2m4f but has lowly mark for handicap debut and is open to improvement.

runners.name: Time Was
runners.comment: Ran poorly in first-time cheekpieces recently but has claims if judged on previous effort
runners.spotlight: Ran poorly in first-time cheekpieces (now removed) 17 days ago and is now 0-8 over hurdles but her second at Southwell (2m4f, good to soft) two starts ago was a pretty good effort and she has claims if judged on that.

runners.name: She Wont Mind
runners.owner: Paul Davies John Raglan Beswick Brothers
runners.comment: Pulled up on handicap debut (2m7f); drops back in trip with hood refitted here
runners.spotlight: Unable to justify prominence in the betting when pulled up on handicap debut at Fakenham (2m7f, good to soft) in December and not seen again since; remains unexposed and might benefit from combination of drop back in trip and refitted hood here, but it takes a leap of faith to support her.

runners.name: Far Away West
runners.comment: Ran well to a point at Sedgefield recently but ultimately well held; now 0-16 over hurdles
runners.spotlight: Ran well to a point when fourth at Sedgefield (2m4f, good) this month, her third start for Hugh Burns, but was beaten about 30l in the end and is now 0-16 over hurdles.

runners.name: Florita
runners.comment: Showed a glimmer of promise last time; well worth keeping close eye on in betting
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in two of her three Irish points; soundly beaten on all four subsequent hurdling starts but showed a glimmer of promise at Catterick (1m7f, good to soft) last time and is one to keep a close eye on in the betting before this handicap debut; tongue-tie fitted.

runners.name: Fairland

prev_owners.owner: John P Bowe & Michael J Bowe

runners.comment: Began season with two respectable runs; back from ten-month absence today
runners.spotlight: 0-11 over hurdles; seemingly aided by addition of tongue-tie when twice running respectably at start of this season (2m4f, good) but has fitness to prove after ten-month absence.

runners.name: So Ladylike
runners.comment: Hexham winner last spring but not in same form on her three outings this year
runners.spotlight: Ex-Irish veteran mare who came good for Nick Alexander at second attempt, under Natasha Cookson at Hexham (2m7f, soft) last spring; not in same form on any of three starts this year, though, and 1lb wrong today.

5:20.race_name: Let's Celebrate Davie Open National Hunt Flat Race (Category 2 Elimination) (GBB Race)

runners.name: Abbey Scope
runners.comment: Does not have an exciting pedigree but yard does well in bumpers
runners.spotlight: Seventh foal; half-brother to two low-grade jumps winners; dam well beaten in a bumper, half-sister to bumper/2m4f hurdle winner Miss Abbey; does not have an exciting pedigree but yard does well in bumpers.

runners.name: Chanonry Point
runners.comment: Comfortable winner of Musselburgh mares' race on rules debut; commands respect here
runners.spotlight: Joined Lucinda Russell after clearcut win on Irish point debut (soft ground) in January and maintained unbeaten record with fairly comfortable success in mares' race at Musselburgh (good to soft) last month; carries a penalty and takes on males here but still commands respect.

runners.name: Jimmy Hurdstrom
runners.comment: Left disappointing rules debut behind when clear second at Wetherby last month; big player
runners.spotlight: Point winner who left his disappointing rules debut a long way behind when clear second at Wetherby (good) last month; features very prominently in calculations.

runners.name: Am I Bovvered
runners.comment: Fourth foal from an unraced dam; probably best watched on debut
runners.spotlight: Fourth foal; unraced dam out of bumper winning half-sister to useful 2m5f-3m2f chase winner Pete The Feat; probably best watched on debut.

runners.name: Char Du Berlais
runners.comment: Failed to complete two Irish points towards end of last year; makes rules debut today
runners.spotlight: Half-sister to Irish bumper/useful hurdle winner Kish Bank; dam a useful hurdler; failed to complete two Irish points towards end of last year and considered only if lively in the betting here.

runners.name: Just Edith
runners.owner: Mrs Elaine Holmes & J R Norton Ltd
runners.comment: Well beaten when a big-priced outsider at Wetherby last month
runners.spotlight: Struggled to get seriously competitive and finished a long way behind Jimmy Hurdstrom when a big-priced outsider at Wetherby last month.

runners.name: Borders Eagle
runners.owner: J D Wright & Mrs S Wright
runners.comment: Half-brother to stable's low-grade hurdle winner Blakey Boy; others appeal more
runners.spotlight: 3,000euros 3yo; fifth foal; half-brother to stable's low-grade hurdle winner Blakey Boy; dam unraced half-sister to hurdle winner Foxtrot Juliet; stable wins occasional bumpers; others have more pressing claims.

7:30.race_name: Every Race Live On Racing TV Handicap
7:30.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (GoingStick: 9.2) (Watered)
7:30.stalls: Straight - Centre; 1m4f - Stands' side; Remainder - Inside

runners.name: Convo
runners.comment: 2yo campaign concluded with two below-par runs but she was a Listed runner-up last June
runners.spotlight: He's unproven on the forecast fast ground and last season concluded with two below-par runs; however, she was a Listed runner-up in France last June and is not ruled out in first-time cheekpieces on her handicap/seasonal debut.

runners.name: Fuji Mountain
runners.comment: In good form in soft-going nurseries last autumn; in the mix if resuming where he left off
runners.spotlight: Won on nursery debut at Chester (5f, soft) last September and good third at York (5f, soft) next time; likely to be on different ground for this reappearance but can be in the mix if resuming where he left off.

runners.name: Balzarini
runners.comment: The drop back in trip could be a plus on his stable and seasonal debut; check betting
runners.spotlight: Won a maiden at Windsor (5f, good to firm) last July for Stuart Williams and handed tough tasks in 7f Group 3s on final two 2yo runs; sold for 40,000gns last October; the drop back in trip could be a plus on his stable and seasonal debut and he's one to watch in the betting.

runners.name: Against The Wind
runners.comment: Speedy 2yo who returns having been gelded and could go well on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Showed good pace when close fifth of 20 in sales race at York (6f, good to firm) last August and didn't run badly in 5f Listed race at Ayr next time; returns having been gelded and he could go well on handicap debut.

quotes.race: Winners Wear Skopes Menswear EBF Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We thought the world of Against The Wind into the spring. I was very confident he'd go and win at York first time as he was so professional at home but he got beat. First run you can always forgive with a little bit of greenness but he then got beaten again on his second start. I felt just dropping back to five [furlongs] and taking a lead would suit and he showed his quality today - Kevin Ryan, trainer.

runners.name: Desert Champion
runners.comment: Won in first-time visor last month; disappointing since; could bounce back now blinkered
runners.spotlight: Easily made all in a first-time visor on handicap debut at Chelmsford (5f, AW) last month; failed to back that up when 10lb higher at Wolverhampton (5f, AW) last time but he now goes in blinkers and it will be no surprise if he bounces back with a bold show on his first turf start.

runners.name: Naanas Sparkle
runners.comment: He's shaped as though he could be suited by the drop to 5f and is one to consider
runners.spotlight: Built upon previous turf promise to win Chelmsford novice (6f, AW) last October and again ran well when fourth in Wolverhampton novice (6f, AW) in November; he's shaped as though he could be suited by the drop to 5f and is one to consider on his handicap and seasonal debut.

runners.name: Do It Now
runners.comment: Below-par end to last season but he reappears with his yard going well; chance
runners.spotlight: Below par on final four runs last August-October but a break may have helped and he reappears with his yard going well; creditable fifth in the Super Sprint last July and he's of interest on that form; chance.

runners.name: Educating Rita
runners.comment: Went close in nursery at Beverley last August; could be involved on her reappearance
runners.spotlight: Progressive last year across her first five starts, going close in a nursery at Beverley (5f, good to firm) in August; respectable Listed efforts the next twice; could be involved back in a handicap on reappearance.

stable_tour.quote: She's a nice filly. She ran at Redcar first time when she was second, and then won at Catterick despite not handling the track.  Both those runs were over 5f and she then went to Hamilton, stepping up to 6f, and put up a good display there, winning again. With racing she's sharpened up a bit and two starts ago at Haydock, when she was third, she ran well in quite a decent race won by Qaseem. I felt that she's speeded up, so I dropped her back to 5f on Sunday at Beverley and she ran a cracker to finish second, beaten only a neck by Mission Command. She was unlucky as she just didn't get the gap when she needed it. I'm not sure where she'll go next, but it'll probably be a stiff 5f or 6f. 28-08-24

runners.name: Nad Alshiba Green
runners.comment: Did well after moving into nurseries in second half of last year, winning twice; contender
runners.spotlight: Did well after moving into nurseries in second half of last year, winning twice (5f, good); a contender if fully tuned up on reappearance.

quotes.race: DragonBet Proud Sponsors Of Bath Racing Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: Nad Alshiba Green found six furlongs on slow ground a little bit tiring but she was in the right race there - Oisin Murphy, rider.

runners.name: Farandaway
runners.comment: Returns on a competitive mark and with his yard among the winners; not discounted
runners.spotlight: Runner-up on first four starts (AW/slow turf; including handicap debut) before lesser run in Southwell novice in December when last seen; returns on a competitive mark and with his yard among the winners; not discounted.

runners.name: Neytiri Te Tskaha
runners.comment: Won C&D novice last August; fair efforts this year in first two handicaps; not ruled out
runners.spotlight: Won C&D novice (good to firm) last August for Stuart Williams; fair efforts at Wolverhampton (5f/6f, AW) this year on first two stable and handicap starts; she needs something extra today but the drop back in trip could be a plus (pulled hard last time) and she's not ruled out.

7:00.race_name: Download The Raceday Ready App Handicap (GBBPlus Race)
7:00.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (GoingStick: 9.2) (Watered)
7:00.stalls: Straight - Centre; 1m4f - Stands' side; Remainder - Inside

runners.name: Perfectly Timed
runners.comment: There's hope for this return to turf and this first crack at 1m4f; needs a second look
runners.spotlight: Both wins on AW, including when well on top at Newcastle (1m2f) in September with first-time blinkers, which have been kept since; a novice second on good ground last May gives some hope for this return to turf and a respectable AW reappearance three weeks ago suggests he's worth this first crack at 1m4f; needs a second look.

runners.name: Path To Dubai
runners.comment: His only run on turf (last of nine in a good-ground handicap) is the main worry
runners.spotlight: His two wins were in January 2024 and January 2025, the latter when awarded a 1m4f AW handicap after interference; below-form second favourite over that same C&D on latest outing when trying a Class 2, but he's back down in class for this; it's his only run on turf (last of nine in a good-ground handicap) which is the main worry.

runners.name: Ludos Landing
runners.comment: Well held on last two outings but he stays 1m4f and has a shout if returning refreshed
runners.spotlight: His largely consistent 2024 campaign had three wins, including two on good to firm at Beverley (1m2f) in the summer; the most recent was at Kempton (1m3f) in September; well held on last two outings but he stays 1m4f and has a shout if returning refreshed.

runners.name: Cavern Club
runners.comment: Scored last month for the second time over hurdles and has to be in serious calculations
runners.spotlight: 1m4f winner off 1lb lower at Chester (good to soft) last May on first run for James Owen; he's had an uneven time of it since but scored last month for the second time over hurdles and firmer ground today should be okay; has to be in serious calculations.

quotes.race: Beck's Handicap
quotes.quote: I was tasked with finding the owners a fun dual-purpose horse and I hope Cavern Club can keep going forward and win a few more races. He will definitely go hurdling at some point; he's already done lots of schooling. The Northumberland Plate could definitely be a target, but there's a few more runs to go before then - James Owen, trainer.

quotes.race: Ladbrokes Christmas Festival December 26th & 27th Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: We put cheekpieces on because although Cavern Club has ability, he definitely needs something to keep him focussed on the job. I was pleased with him and he seems like a horse who will progress into a nice stayer next year - Marco Botti, trainer.

runners.name: Letsbefrank
runners.owner: J S Morrison & Ms Carol Morrison
runners.comment: Even if on best behaviour (virtually refused to race on return), 1m4f is a nagging worry
runners.spotlight: Landed a £100,000 bonus for winning three Sunday Series races (1m3f, 1m6f and 2m1f) last term; 3-6 once handicapping in that campaign and second favourite at Musselburgh nine days ago, despite the drop back to 1m4f, but he had no chance after virtually refusing to leave the stalls; even if on his best behaviour, 1m4f is a nagging worry.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Build A Bet Handicap
quotes.quote: Letsbefrank is getting very lethargic in his races and he was never on the bridle. He's tough and game, but the Johnston horse got a soft lead and you know they'll always keep going. But this horse keeps digging, he's tough. I'm lucky I'm the one pointing him, but this has been the plan for Jim and his team since the winter. He's had all the races mapped out, credit to him. To win one race is hard but to win three takes some doing - Paul Mulrennan, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: We targeted the Sunday series and he just managed to win the £100k bonus with a short-head success at Pontefract in August. He's a wee bit sore now after a couple of runs on fast ground. It's nothing major but that'll be it for the year. He was in the Cesarewitch but I've scratched him from that. Hopefully he'll progress again next year into some top races. 02-10-24

runners.name: Pergamon
runners.breeder: Haras De Saint Pair & White Birch Farm
runners.comment: British debut in March makes him hard to fancy, notwithstanding today's trip; cheekpieces
runners.spotlight: Form figures of 321 in France for Andre Fabre, the success at Dieppe last July when upped to 1m7f; sold for 22,000gns and had wind surgery, but dropping out so badly in handicap at Southwell (2m, AW; 11-1) in March makes him hard to fancy, notwithstanding today's trip; cheekpieces are called on.

stable_tour.quote: He's a Frankel three-year-old who'll go on the Flat and then go juvenile hurdling. He was purchased at the horses in training sale from Andre Fabre's yard. He was gelded on arrival to the yard and you won't see him until the back end of January. He's a good staying prospect and is worth looking out for. 05-12-24

runners.name: The Crafty Mole
runners.comment: Five wins last April-August, all 1m6f; competitive mark if ready on first run for 199 days
runners.spotlight: Five wins last April-August, all 1m6f and the last in first-time visor, which was kept for two modest runs in the mud last autumn but is absent today; competitive mark if ready to roll on this first run for 199 days.

runners.name: Titainium
runners.comment: Progressive 2024 and creditable return but pedigree says he's not a certainty to get 1m4f
runners.spotlight: Progressed well in handicaps last term when he did not have soft ground and he reappeared with a creditable front-running second at Redcar (1m2f, good) 15 days ago; another bold show looks on its way but, although he stuck on well last time, pedigree says he's not a certainty to get 1m4f.

runners.name: Kitsune Power
runners.comment: Has a form chance if he's on song for this reappearance, which he wasn't last year
runners.spotlight: His 2023 and 2024 campaigns contained just one win (1m6f here last June) but he was pretty consistent off higher marks last term and has a form chance if he's on song for this reappearance, which he wasn't last year.

quotes.race: William Hill Silver Cup Handicap
quotes.quote: We travelled really well around there, but didn't go as quickly as I thought they would do. It turned into a bit of a sprint, which we didn't really want, but I got Kitsune Power rolling 3f down. I'd say he'd easily get 1m4f in time. He was knocking on the door previously - Kevin Stott, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He's one we bought at the Newmarket sale and he's been training well. He's come down in the weights and looks reasonably handicapped, although he couldn't go on the heavy ground at Ripon last week. We think his trip will be a mile and a quarter. 23-04-24

He has progressed with each run this year and after two wins and as many seconds he is now on an 18lb higher mark than he started. Last time out at Goodwood he was a little unlucky, getting stopped at a crucial time, yet still finished a running-on second of 16 over 1m1f. He has a couple of options later this month, and he can add to the brace he won earlier in the year. 17-08-22

runners.name: Masekela
runners.comment: Never-nearer 6th of nine to impressive winner over C&D ten days ago; all hope is not lost
runners.spotlight: 2021 Listed winner, form which is long gone but he continues down the weights and his never-nearer sixth of nine to an impressive winner over C&D ten days ago suggested that all hope is not lost.

quotes.race: Denford Stakes (Listed Race) (formerly The Washington Singer Stakes)
quotes.quote: Masekela has a couple of entries in the Champagne Stakes and the Royal Lodge and I need to talk to Andrew, but my view is that a mile is the right distance. William said he's a nice horse and there would be more to come. He said he'd make a nice 3yo, which we always felt as he's a big horse - Mick Mariscotti, owner.

stable_tour.quote: He won't run until later in the season, I gave him a good break when I got him from the sales last autumn. He'll be out from midsummer and I'm looking forward to him, we like him a lot. We bought him to run him at the big meetings and we gave him the winter off as he needed a break. He looks well handicapped and a mile and a half seems to be his trip. 23-04-24

5:30.race_name: racingtv.com Restricted Novice Stakes (Bands B, C And D) (GBB Race)
5:30.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (GoingStick: 9.2) (Watered)
5:30.stalls: Straight - Centre; 1m4f - Stands' side; Remainder - Inside

runners.name: Parole Doro
runners.comment: Won at Epsom on second start; useful prospect who is firmly in calculations
runners.spotlight: Runner-up on debut at Ascot (7f, good) last July and won at Epsom (7f, good to firm) in August; there's substance to his form and he's a useful prospect; firmly in calculations despite conceding weight all round.

runners.name: Teroomm
runners.comment: Won on his return at Bath this month and he could have plenty more to offer; key player
runners.spotlight: Promising fourth on debut at Kempton (7f, AW) last November and won cosily on his return at Bath (1m, good to firm) this month; he could have plenty more to offer for his top yard and is a key player.

stable_tour.quote: His only run last year was promising and I liked the way he won at Bath on his return from a potentially tricky draw. We'll probably run him under a penalty and go from there but he could develop into a horse for something like the Britannia. 11-04-25

runners.name: Four Fifty
runners.comment: Won on recent debut at Newcastle and pedigree suggests this step up in trip will suit
runners.spotlight: Belied his 16-1 odds to win on debut at Newcastle (7f, AW) 12 days ago; he did it in good style from some fairly useful yardsticks and his pedigree suggests this step up in trip will suit; he's one to consider.

runners.name: Drumcondra
runners.comment: Showed ability last October on his second start but others have achieved a fair bit more
runners.spotlight: Showed ability when front-running fourth of six at 125-1 at Haydock (1m, heavy) last October on his second start; can win races but a good chunk of improvement is needed if he's to land this one.

runners.name: Very Muddy Waters
runners.comment: Runner-up over 7f on sole 2yo start and open to improvement now up in trip on reappearance
runners.spotlight: His dam was a useful 1m2f-1m4f winner and, after being outpaced, he kept on for second at 28-1 on debut at Redcar (7f, soft) last October; open to improvement now up in trip on reappearance and he's not ruled out.

runners.name: Taylormade Lad
runners.comment: Potential in his pedigree but he was always behind when 200-1 for last November's debut
runners.spotlight: There's potential in his pedigree but he was always behind when 200-1 for last November's debut at Redcar (7f, soft); probably best watched.

6:00.race_name: Live Streams On Racing TV Extra Handicap (Div I)
6:00.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (GoingStick: 9.2) (Watered)
6:00.stalls: Straight - Centre; 1m4f - Stands' side; Remainder - Inside

runners.name: Temper Trap
runners.comment: Last five wins have come on soft or heavy ground and he has a poor reappearance record
runners.spotlight: Runner-up on final two starts last season (1m/7f, soft) but his last five wins have come on soft or heavy ground; quicker conditions are expected today and he has a poor reappearance record.

runners.name: Wilde And Dandy

prev_owners.owner: D Fravigar, S Jones And Partner

runners.comment: Two AW wins towards the end of last year but below par on AW the last twice
runners.spotlight: Turf winner who scored at Chelmsford (7f, AW) last October and at Southwell (7f, AW) in December; however, he's been below par on Southwell AW the last twice and needs to bounce back now reverting to grass.

runners.name: Highland Olly
runners.comment: Stayed on for second over 7f at Redcar recently and 1m is well worth a go; respected
runners.spotlight: Won at Musselburgh (7f, good) last August and he reappeared with a good second at Redcar (7f, good) a fortnight ago; untested at 1m but it's well worth a go in view of how he stayed on last time; respected.

runners.name: Power Of Zeus
runners.comment: No revival since joining this yard; a major turnaround is required in first-time headgear
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 4yo who failed to build on his early promise for Brian Ellison and has finished last on his first two outings for this yard; a major turnaround is required in first-time headgear.

quotes.race: British Stallion Studs EBF Restricted Maiden Stakes (Bands B-D) (EBF Restricted Qualifier)(GBB Race)
quotes.quote: You don't know what to expect but I knew Power Of Zeus was a good athlete and in his first race he didn't know his backside from his elbow. He was tailed off then he improved and improved so I knew that there was a chance he'd do something but I'm shocked - in an extremely nice way. He might have a good future - Keith Brown, owner.

stable_tour.quote: He won at Ripon on his second start last year and then went to Pontefract and ran all right, but he'd probably had enough. He's done tremendously over the winter - putting on weight and growing - and could be a really nice horse this year. He's working away and won't be far off running. 03-04-24

runners.name: Makalu
runners.comment: Three wins on turf last May-July and back on the scoresheet on AW last month; solid claims
runners.spotlight: Reappeared with a win at Southwell (1m, AW) last month; this course winner scored three times on turf last May-July and holds solid claims.

quotes.race: Ayr Racecourse Sunday Market Handicap
quotes.quote: Makalu has turned around this year and he seems to be enjoying his racing now. I think he likes dropping in and staying on from the back and it gives him confidence. He's very gutsy when he does get there, he puts his head down and tries - James Sullivan, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: British Stallion Studs EBF Restricted Novice Stakes (For Horses In Bands C & D) (GBB Race) (Div II)
quotes.quote: Makalu has been a work in progress, I'd imagine he wants seven furlongs really - Kevin Ryan, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He had aeat 2024, winning four times, and returned from a long wintereak to score on his reappearance last month over a mile at Southwell. He's usually dropped out the back by Jack Sullivan, who knows exactly how to ride him. I'm lining him up for a race at Thirsk's evening fixture on April 22. 09-04-25

runners.name: Jez Bomb
runners.comment: 4 wins in the second half of last year; returned to form when second at Southwell latest
runners.spotlight: Won at Redcar (1m1f, good) last July and added three AW wins in the autumn; returned to form when runner-up at Southwell (1m, AW) last month behind one who has followed up and he's one to consider.

runners.name: Coolree
runners.comment: Below best this year but he's below his last winning mark and is not written off
runners.spotlight: He hasn't been at his best this year, particularly on Lingfield AW last time, but he's now 4lb lower than when winning at Beverley (8.4f, good to firm) last May and is not written off.

runners.name: Mount King
runners.comment: Ran well over C&D last May and now 10lb lower but disappointing more often than not since
runners.spotlight: Ran well when fourth of 16 over C&D (good to firm) last May and he's now 10lb lower; however, since then he's been disappointing more often than not and has been absent since December.

quotes.race: Leslie Burton (Fisher) Handicap
quotes.quote: We bought Mount King second hand at the Horses In Training Sale from Joseph O'Brien and he's been a lovely horse for the owners - Tim Easterby, trainer.

runners.name: Straya
runners.owner: Ursa Major Racing Ltd And Partner
runners.comment: 0-14 but has dropped down the weights and might not be far away now back down in trip
runners.spotlight: Has raced 14 times and is yet to finish in the first three; faded over 1m2f at Doncaster on last month's reappearance but she's on a fair mark on last October's 1m form and might not be far away now back down in trip.

4:20.race_name: Ruby Lodge Care Home In Thirsk Apprentice Handicap
4:20.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (GoingStick: 9.2) (Watered)
4:20.stalls: Straight - Centre; 1m4f - Stands' side; Remainder - Inside

runners.name: Abate

prev_owners.owner: The Never Say No Racing Club
Thirty Three To One Racing Club
The Never Say No Racing Club

runners.comment: 0-13 last season but went close on reappearance and can be bang there once more
runners.spotlight: 9yo who was 0-13 last season but he dropped down the weights and reappeared with a close second of 17 at Doncaster (5f, good) last month; has won here and he should be fine now back up to 6f; can be bang there once more.

stable_tour.quote: A yard favourite who's called “the champ” for a reason. He's been nothing but a superstar, winning ten races. He loves the big tracks, like Newmarket and York, and never seems to run a bad race. Since Mia has been riding him for the last couple of seasons, he's been very consistent as she gets a good tune out of him. I've pitched him into some big handicaps this season and he's run creditably. There's a nice handicap in him and he deserves a big one. He's won on every ground but is probably best on good to firm. I'll probably target him at Newmarket in the next few weeks and then there's the Great St Wilfrid at Ripon. We're in the Racing League this year, and so is Mia, so there could be something there. 26-07-24

runners.name: Late Arrival

prev_owners.owner: A Pollock, S Windle & G Routledge
A Pollock, S Windle & B Padgett

runners.comment: Has a mixed reappearance record; won twice last summer; not ruled out
runners.spotlight: 8yo who has a mixed reappearance record and it remains to be seen if he's at the top of his game on this comeback outing; however, he won twice last summer (6f, good to firm/AW) and is not ruled out.

runners.name: Kats Bob
runners.comment: 3-3 for current yard (all 6f on Tapeta) and has to be respected now back on turf
runners.spotlight: Made it 3-3 for this yard (all over 6f on Tapeta) when scoring at Southwell last month; last season's turf performances left something to be desired but he's a five-time winner on grass who has to be respected.

stable_tour.quote: He arrived here in February in good nick from Iain Jardine's stable looking for a change of scenery having been in the same yard since he was a yearling. He proceeded to rattle off three on the spin at Newcastle twice and then at Southwell by two lengths. His trip is 6f and he likes some give in theound. I'm looking at Thirsk in May next, but things will be more difficult for him off an all-time high mark. Also entered at Newcastle and Thirsk this week. 09-04-25

runners.name: Lord Abama
runners.owner: Mrs K S Pratt, P R Blackett, M Dods
runners.comment: Underwhelming over C&D recently but this two-time C&D winner is not written off
runners.spotlight: Won at Newcastle (6f, AW) last November and belated followed up there in March; underwhelming fifth over this C&D just ten days ago but he won two in a row over C&D last May/June and is not written off.

runners.name: Patontheback
runners.comment: Reappears on a competitive mark but his last three wins have all come over 7f
runners.spotlight: Won two in a row last June (7f, good/good to firm) and he's on a competitive mark on the pick of last season's form; however, he drops back to 6f for this reappearance and may be of greater interest when back up to 7f.

quotes.race: Congratulations Erin On Getting Married Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: Patontheback had a lovely run round. I thought if he doesn't win today he's never going to as everything went perfect for him. He slid down to a handy mark, things haven't worked out his way but he hasn't done much wrong - Gemma Tutty, trainer, speaking to Racing TV.

stable_tour.quote: He's been waiting for some quick ground, which he got last time out at Catterick, where things didn't go his way from a wide draw. Hopefully he'll get his head back in front soon. He goes very well on the all-weather but we're really keen to get him a turf success this year. He mainly runs around 7f now. 23-05-24

runners.name: Runninwild
runners.comment: Won two in a row at Carlisle last July but may improve for today's reappearance run
runners.spotlight: Front-runner who won two in a row at Carlisle (6f, good to firm/good) last July; however, he's 5lb above his last winning mark on this first outing since August, and may improve for today's reappearance run.

quotes.race: Join Racing TV Now Handicap
quotes.quote: Runninwild can usually be a bit buzzy so he's settled well here despite being in the stalls for a long time. I never intended to make the running but in fairness when every horse came to challenge him he just kept finding and he's toughed it out well - Shane Gray, jockey.

runners.name: Profiteer
runners.comment: Three wins last season and this 4yo could still have more to offer; makes reappearance
runners.spotlight: Made handicap debut last May and enjoyed a progressive campaign with three wins, over 7f here (good to firm) in June and twice over 5f at Pontefract (soft) in October; this 4yo could still have more to offer and is capable of playing a leading role if fully tuned up on his reappearance.

runners.name: Happier
runners.comment: Down the field at Doncaster on reappearance but may have needed the run; not discounted
runners.spotlight: Down the field on reappearance at Doncaster (5f, good) last month but may have needed the run and she won at Southwell (5f, AW) on her final outing last year; also effective at 6f and she's not discounted.

runners.name: Inanna
runners.comment: A return to form is needed but getting back on turf could help; on a handy mark
runners.spotlight: Twice had issues in the stalls in the winter and soundly beaten at Newcastle in February when last seen; however, the return to turf could help (provided the forecast fast ground isn't a problem) and she's on a handy mark on last season's best performances; not ruled out.

quotes.race: Culcheth Fillies' Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Inanna is a very nice filly. It was a nice fair track and we decided to send her up there because she had time to organiser herself. She could drop back, she is pretty versatile, but they didn't go much of a gallop. We like her at home and we will see how she comes out of the race. We have a nice bunch of horses, we have kept the numbers down, but hopefully the two-year-olds will be nice - Sean Woods, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: She was very keen when we got her- she was trying to do it all in one breath. But she's done well, winning two of her last four races, ridden by Paul Mulrennan at Carlisle and then at Hamilton by Amie Waugh. She'll probably be kept going for a while as she goes on any ground. She normally runs over 5f or 6f and might stay 7f if she relaxes. She ran over 7f at Musselburgh last month but was a bit too keen and finished second. But she's going the right way and is starting to relax and enjoy her racing. 02-10-24

4:55.race_name: Visit racingtv.com Maiden Stakes (GBB/IRE Incentive Race)
4:55.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (GoingStick: 9.2) (Watered)
4:55.stalls: Straight - Centre; 1m4f - Stands' side; Remainder - Inside

runners.name: Ameeq
runners.comment: £50,000 yearling; by Mehmas; yard has a respectable record with 2yos
runners.spotlight: April foal; £50,000 yearling; by Mehmas and sibling to three winners, notably Tell William (1m/8.5f; 83); dam 1m AW winner (79), from useful sprinting family; yard has respectable record with 2yos.

runners.name: Bring It On
runners.comment: £40,000 yearling; by Dandy Man; others have stronger-looking claims
runners.spotlight: March foal; £40,000 yearling; by Dandy Man out of a 7f 2yo winner (RPR 94); may win races in due course but some of these rivals have stronger-looking claims.

runners.name: Jan Steen
runners.comment: 100,000gns yearling; suitably bred; notable connections; strong credentials
runners.spotlight: March foal; 30,000gns foal, 100,000gns yearling; Sergei Prokofiev half-brother to 5f 2yo winner Do It Now (RPR 89), out of 5f 2yo winner (87); notable connections; brings strong credentials.

runners.name: Sailor Batt
runners.comment: 60,000gns yearling; siblings include a useful 5f performer for his connections
runners.spotlight: February foal; 14,000euros foal, 60,000gns yearling; Coulsty half-brother to two winners, notably his connections' useful 5f performer Jer Batt (RPR 102); looks one with potential; interesting.

runners.name: Hellcat
runners.comment: Mayson filly; stable has a modest strike-rate with 2yo runners
runners.spotlight: April foal; by Mayson and first foal of a 7f/1m winner (RPR 78); stable has a modest strike-rate with 2yo runners; best watched unless the betting suggests otherwise.

8:00.race_name: Next Meeting Saturday 3rd May Book Now Handicap
8:00.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (GoingStick: 9.2) (Watered)
8:00.stalls: Straight - Centre; 1m4f - Stands' side; Remainder - Inside

runners.name: Ribble Radiant
runners.comment: 0-9 since debut win in June 2023 but good second on recent reappearance at Catterick
runners.spotlight: 0-9 and unable to threaten in the main since debut win in June 2023; however, off this reduced mark she dead-heated with Dandy Lichious for second of 14 on recent reappearance at Catterick (7f, good; albeit no match for winner) and she's on the shortlist.

runners.name: Heroism
runners.breeder: Airlie Stud & Mrs S M Rogers
runners.comment: His mark continues to fall but he's dropped down the weights for good reason
runners.spotlight: His mark continues to fall and he could improve for his reappearance outing at Southwell three weeks ago, but he's dropped down the weights for good reason and is 0-16 since his debut win in August 2022; unproven at 7f.

stable_tour.quote: He's another one who physically has done very well over the winter and, while he wasn't quite up to the task in Group company last year, I'm hopeful he can grow in confidence in handicaps to start with this season. He definitely needs a firmer surface. 02-05-23

runners.name: Captain Vallo
runners.comment: Good second over 6f here recently; a contender if seeing out this longer trip
runners.spotlight: Faded over 7f two starts ago so there's a doubt about tonight's trip, but he won twice at Newcastle (6f, AW) in the winter and kept on for a good second here (6f, good) ten days ago; he's a contender if seeing it out.

runners.name: Falcon Nine
runners.comment: 19-race maiden who comes with risk attached but he might not be far away if breaking okay
runners.spotlight: 19-race maiden who isn't straightforward and comes with risk attached having blown the start at Musselburgh (7f, good) three weeks ago; however, in the circumstances he did pretty well to be beaten about only 6l in eighth of ten and he might not be far away if breaking on terms.

runners.name: Without Delay
runners.comment: Three wins last year and reappeared with an encouraging fifth; could have a part to play
runners.spotlight: Three wins last year (1m/7f, good/good to firm) and she reappeared with an encouraging fifth at Musselburgh (7f, good) three weeks ago; ran well last June on her sole visit here and she could have a part to play.

stable_tour.quote: She's done well for us this season, winning twice, over a mile at Musselburgh in May and then over 7f at Catterick in June. She's also been third at Thirsk and fourth last time out at Catterick, not beaten far, behind Swinging Eddie. She's had more luck this year than last season when she was placed a lot but had a lot of bad draws. At Catterick on Monday she led but then got squeezed. She did come again but she'd had enough by that stage and finished seventh behind Vince Le Prince. 22-08-24

runners.name: Lumenbourg
runners.comment: Disappointing last month but won in February and could bounce back with a bold bid
runners.spotlight: Front-runner; disappointing at Newcastle (7f, AW) last month but won at Southwell (7f, AW) in February and he scored on turf at Doncaster (7f, good to firm) last August; no surprise if he bounces back with a bold bid.

runners.name: Emerald Army
runners.comment: Won in a big field here on his reappearance and could take modest 3lb raise in his stride
runners.spotlight: Progressive form over 7f at the end of last season and continued the good work with big-field win here (6f, good) on recent reappearance; he could take a modest 3lb raise in his stride now back up in trip.

runners.name: Desert Dream
runners.comment: May have needed reappearance run but needs to be an entirely different proposition today
runners.spotlight: Won two in a row at Catterick (7f, good/soft) last season; ran well on last visit here and he may have needed his reappearance run at Catterick a fortnight ago, but this 11yo was beaten a long way and needs to be an entirely different proposition this evening.

quotes.race: totequadpot Insure Your Last Four Maiden Stakes
quotes.quote: Pat gave Desert Dream a good ride. We'll run him over further in handicaps now. The ground was perfect. Absolutely perfect - Sir Evelyn De Rothschild, owner-breeder.

runners.name: Kalganov
runners.owner: Ursa Major Racing Ltd And M Dods

prev_owners.owner: Alain Jathiere, Ecurie Vivaldi Et Al

runners.comment: He's tumbled down the weights but has struggled in the last 12 months
runners.spotlight: He's tumbled down the weights but has finished no better than seventh across his seven starts in the last 12 months; the reapplied tongue-tie and first-time visor (replacing cheekpieces) need to have a dramatic effect.

stable_tour.quote: A solid handicapper who won on his third start for us at Newcastle in December. After running in February, he had a 72-day break and came back on turf, but it's been too deep for him. He was dropped back to 6f at Pontefract on Monday and was below par, but he scoped dirty afterwards. We'll get him better and then make a plan. 14-06-24

runners.name: Juryman
runners.comment: Very well handicapped on 2023 form but unable to get competitive last year
runners.spotlight: Very well handicapped on 2023 form but unable to get competitive during a truncated campaign last year; may be best watched back from an absence.

runners.name: Odd Socks Havana
runners.comment: Went close on AW recently; it remains to be seen if he's still fully effective on turf
runners.spotlight: Went close off this mark at Newcastle (1m, AW) recently on second stable start and he should be fine now back at 7f; major player if backing up his latest performance but he ran below par last May/June on his last two grass starts so the switch of the surface is a big question mark.

runners.name: Dumfries
runners.owner: Buist, Shields, Thompson And Mrs R Carr
runners.comment: Encouraging signs last autumn but he's now back to having something to prove
runners.spotlight: Appeared to have halted the slide when twice finishing third last autumn off higher marks than today's; however, he's failed to threaten on his two runs this spring and is back to having something to prove.

stable_tour.quote: He was a winner of a Southwell maiden for Marcus Tregoning and he ran well back there for us first time this season, where he wasn't beaten too far. He's a miler. I can't find anything for him back at Southwell, so I'm hoping the ground has dried up a bit for him at Pontefract on April 22. 17-04-24

runners.name: Dandy Lichious
runners.comment: Just one win from his 23 starts but fair second last time and each-way claims once more
runners.spotlight: Just one win from his 23 starts and beaten about 5l by the winner when second of 14 at 40-1 at Catterick (7f, good; dead-heated with Ribble Radiant) a fortnight ago, but has each-way claims once more.

6:30.race_name: Live Streams On Racing TV Extra Handicap (Div II)
6:30.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (GoingStick: 9.2) (Watered)
6:30.stalls: Straight - Centre; 1m4f - Stands' side; Remainder - Inside

runners.name: Harlem Nights
runners.owner: R Teatum And Steel A Win
runners.comment: On a reduced mark and he was a fair fourth on AW last time; could be in the mix
runners.spotlight: Beaten 11 times since his last win in August 2023 but he's dropped down the weights and was a fair fourth at Wolverhampton (8.6f, AW) three weeks ago on his first run since wind surgery; could be in the mix.

quotes.race: Follow At The Races On Twitter Handicap
quotes.quote: Harlem Nights is going the right way. The only time he hasn't been in the frame this year was when the ground was very fast at York and he didn't enjoy it. He's thriving on his racing and he's a lovely, straightforward horse. I put him in at Newmarket on Friday this morning and we'll see how he is and what the handicapper does - James Horton, trainer.

runners.name: Super Hit
runners.comment: Won off this mark on AW last October but below that level on his four starts since
runners.spotlight: Won off this mark at Chelmsford (7f, AW) last October on final outing for Marco Botti; however, he's been below that level on AW on his four starts since and arrives with something to prove.

runners.name: Swift Salian
runners.comment: Modest strike-rate but ran well on recent reappearance and he's high on the list
runners.spotlight: Just one win from his 16 starts but some fair efforts last year and he ran well when fourth of 13 on his recent reappearance at Musselburgh (1m, good); that latest performance puts him high on the list today.

runners.name: Tees George
runners.comment: Won comfortably at Beverley last September on his sole previous run in these cheekpieces
runners.spotlight: Well beaten last October when last seen but that was over 1m3f; prior to that he won comfortably at Beverley (8.4f, good) on his sole previous run in these cheekpieces and he could play a leading role on his comeback.

stable_tour.quote: A lovely, big horse who hasn't run a bad race all year. He's no superstar but at his level he's very consistent. The only issue I have with him is he's a massive horse who's vlight-framed and it's hard to keep condition on him. His last two runs have been very good and he'll be winning sooner rather than later. 26-07-24

runners.name: Crownthorpe
runners.owner: Mrs M Doherty & A D Brown

prev_owners.owner: Richard Fahey Ebor Racing Club Ltd

runners.comment: Regressive 10yo who was well beaten at Doncaster last month when back from an absence
runners.spotlight: His mark continues to fall but this 10yo struggled to get competitive in the first half of last year and was well beaten at Doncaster last month when back from an absence.

quotes.race: Ripon "Cock O' The North" Handicap
quotes.quote: That was a good run in Ireland last time. Crownthorpe is a work in progress, but has got potential and is going the right way - Robin O'Ryan, assistant trainer.

runners.name: Ravishing Beauty
runners.comment: 0-7 but ran okay last October when last seen and continues to drop down the weights
runners.spotlight: Seven-race maiden who didn't really shine in handicaps last autumn, but she ran okay when sixth of 11 at Newcastle (1m, AW) last October when last seen and continues to drop down the weights; might not be far away.

runners.name: Bellasio
runners.comment: Absent since handicap debut flop last June but interesting to see if his backers return
runners.spotlight: Beaten a long way on handicap debut at Ripon (1m, good) last June and absent since; however, he was sent off at just 13-2 and had shown some promise previously; it will be interesting to see if his backers return.

runners.name: Copper And Five
runners.owner: Mrs Sally Doyle And Mrs Ruth Carr
runners.comment: Mixed form on final few outings last season but he won off 5lb higher last May
runners.spotlight: Mixed form on his final few runs last season and this 9yo makes his reappearance today; however, he's a C&D winner who is 5lb lower than when scoring at Redcar last May, and is not ruled out.

quotes.race: Supporting Weston Park Cancer Charity Handicap
quotes.quote: Copper and Five has been running quite keen in behind so we decided to just let him stride over a bit shorter and it suited him down to the ground, he's battled right to the line. My saddle slipped on the way to the start and we just re-saddled him at the start - Joanna Mason, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He's a good old boy who carries condition and doesn't like having his ears touched! He wins most years, including three in 2021, and should win this year because he's well handicapped. A mark of 57 is as low as he's ever been. 09-04-25

runners.name: Little Ted
runners.comment: Two wins at Musselburgh last summer; a player if at the top of his game on reappearance
runners.spotlight: Two wins at Musselburgh (1m1f/1m, good) last summer and he ended the campaign in good heart (denied a clear run at Newcastle when last seen); he's a player if at the top of his game on this reappearance.

runners.name: Annilogs Force
runners.comment: Modest form in 3 point-to-points; cheekpieces on for rules debut and can only be watched
runners.spotlight: Modest form in three point-to-points; cheekpieces on for rules debut and can only be watched.

runners.name: Cordal Boy
runners.comment: Likely all the better for this debut experience though worth a market check
runners.spotlight: Kingston Hill gelding cost 8,000Euros as a 3yo; half-brother to point/3m chase winner Touchwoodexpress; dam unraced half-sister to bumper/3m hurdle winner Cash And New (dam of smart 2m4f/2m5f hurdler/chaser Oscar Rock); likely all the better for this experience though worth a market check.

runners.name: Easy Doyen
runners.comment: Brought down at first here recently; previous form gives little hope
runners.spotlight: Brought down at first here recently; previous form gives little hope.

runners.name: Firstupbestdressed
runners.comment: Policy Maker gelding doesn't make a lot of appeal on paper, probably best watched
runners.spotlight: Policy Maker gelding is a fifth foal; dam third in a bumper, out of 10.5f Flat and 2m-2m5f hurdle/chase winner; percentage call is to watch on debut.

runners.name: Kainsbourg
runners.breeder: Mme F Devin, F Nicholle & H-F Devin
runners.comment: 2m form gives him major claims, slight stamina doubt after latest but the one to beat
runners.spotlight: Dual winner in France (including Group 3 bumper) and some solid runs in maiden hurdles for current yard, notably Limerick second and when chasing home a 10l odds-on winner at Punchestown; forcing tactics employed latest but didn't get home over 2m4f when beaten 20l into fourth; slightly lesser stamina test here could suit and big player in what appears a weaker maiden.

runners.name: Kinturk Nelson
runners.comment: Big prices and ran accordingly in both maiden hurdles last month
runners.spotlight: Big prices and ran accordingly in both maiden hurdles last month.

runners.name: Kir
runners.breeder: Mme Anne - Charlotte Andre, Mme Clotilde Nicolazo De Barmon
runners.comment: Jumping an issue so far, hard to see him making the required improvement to feature
