runners.spotlight: Last fence faller (disputing) on sole point-to-point last season but beaten a fair way in both maiden runs this term, latest when didn't jump well in finishing remote fourth at Down Royal in January; potential improver now upped in trip.

runners.name: Letos
runners.comment: French recruit showed promise over fences at Wexford; back hurdling and can't rule out
runners.spotlight: French recruit second in 2m6f handicap chase at Auteuil in October and made much of running (keen, not helped by loose horse) on Irish debut when fourth in 2m4f Wexford novice handicap chase early this month under amateur rider; back hurdling here, goes on soft and can't rule out.

runners.name: Locked Box
runners.comment: Decent form on good ground early in the season; back from winter break, ground a concern
runners.spotlight: Modest enough form in points but justified market support on rules debut to win Bellewstown bumper last summer (good); solid start over hurdles on similar ground at Gowran in October, looking in need of 2m+; interesting on return but won't want too much rain.

runners.name: Lord Raven
runners.comment: Fair Flat maiden, tailed off only previous attempt hurdling back in September
runners.spotlight: Fair Flat maiden, tailed off only previous attempt hurdling back in September.

runners.name: Mags Nelson
runners.comment: Two midfield finishes in Naas maidens; eligible for a mark after this
runners.spotlight: Point-to-point winner (yielding) with two midfield finishes in Naas maiden hurdles; eligible for a mark after this.

runners.name: Mister Frostie
runners.comment: Faller last time, previous promise on hurdles debut; much more needed though
runners.spotlight: Bumper form modest but some promise on second attempt hurdling in 2m6f Navan maiden last month; disputing when fell four out at Wexford latest; improvement needed.

runners.name: Sky And Sand
runners.comment: Didn't count when midfield on recent hurdles debut at Naas; best watched for now
runners.spotlight: Brother to bumper/hurdles winner Cappucino made the frame in three starts in points for Jonathan Fogarty; didn't count when midfield on hurdles debut in 2m Naas maiden early this month; best watched for now.

runners.name: Sparrow Wings
runners.comment: Well beaten all three maidens this term, easily discounted
runners.spotlight: Well beaten all three maidens this term, easily discounted.

runners.name: Standing Orders
runners.comment: Soundly beaten twice Naas maidens recently; bred to want more time and distance
runners.spotlight: Golden Lariat 6yo whose dam is half-sister to same yard's Irish Grand National winner Lion Na Bearnai; soundly beaten twice Naas maiden hurdles recently; bred to want more time and distance.

runners.name: Takenasred
runners.comment: Mount Nelson gelding, modest form in three bumpers, watch on hurdles debut
runners.spotlight: Mount Nelson gelding is a brother to a bumper winner; well beaten in two bumpers for Jamie Sloan in late 2023; off for over a year and showed a little bit more on debut for Steven Crawford at Down Royal, albeit was still beaten 19l into fourth; probably best watched on hurdles debut.

runners.name: Welluknow
runners.comment: Satisfactory introduction over this trip at Cork last month; may need more time
runners.spotlight: Made a satisfactory introduction when sixth in a 19-runner maiden over this trip at Cork last month; may need more time.

runners.name: Young And Foolish
runners.comment: Newcomer likely best watched
runners.spotlight: First foal; dam bumper and 2m/2m3f hurdle winner, half-sister to winners Strain Of Fame (2m/2m4f hurdle) and Captain Carol (bumper); probably best watched on debut.

runners.name: Baroness Orczy
runners.comment: Has looked to be crying out for this step up in trip; likely improver could play a role
runners.spotlight: Last two maiden runs offered encouragement, each time staying on well over 2m; step up in trip seems sure to suit and could well improve enough to play a role.

runners.name: Im Flattered
runners.comment: Longer trip could suit but ground may not
runners.spotlight: Limited on the Flat; second hurdle run encouraging, heavy ground last time may not have suited; longer trip could suit but ground may not.

runners.name: Jampot Lane
runners.comment: No show on belated debut last May in Tipperary maiden; can only be watched on return
runners.spotlight: No show on belated debut last May in Tipperary maiden; can only be watched on return.

runners.name: Ringcreevy Diamond
runners.comment: Beaten some way out on recent Down Royal debut over this trip; best watched for now
runners.spotlight: Half-sister to 2m4f hurdle winner Mr Social; dam unraced half-sister to winners Keep It Cool (1m-1m6f Flat/2m-2m4f hurdle) and Top Strategy (useful 1m2f Flat/2m-3m jumps); beaten some way out on recent Down Royal debut over this trip; best watched for now.

runners.name: Rutland Rose
runners.comment: Nothing yet of note; hurdles debut here for new yard
runners.spotlight: Half-sister to hurdle winner Raglan Road; dam 1m5f winner; pulled up on only point-to-point a year ago and well held on bumper debut at Limerick in November for Prunella Dobbs; hurdles debut for new yard.

runners.name: Power Of Words
runners.comment: Poet's Word 4yo from the family of Gr 1 Flat winner Coronet, worth a market check on debut
runners.spotlight: Poet's Word 4yo is a fifth foal; half-brother to US Graded stakes-placed 1m-1m3f winner Marwad (RPR 111); dam unraced half-sister to useful 1m2f-1m4f winner UAE Prince, out of half-sister to 1m2f/1m4f Group 1 winner Coronet and St Leger second Midas Touch; worth a market check on debut for top yard.

runners.name: Raleagh Scope
runners.comment: 38,000Euros 3yo, market best guide on debut
runners.spotlight: Telescope 4yo cost 14,000Euros as a yearling and 38,000Euros as a 3yo; second foal; dam bumper and smart 2m-3m hurdle/chase winner, half-sister to 2m3f/2m4f hunter chase winner Shrewd Investment; market best guide on debut.

runners.name: Captain P
runners.comment: Point winner, tailed off on hurdles debut, can only be watched after that
runners.spotlight: Won a point-to-point at Tyrella in January; sent off at 14-1 for his hurdles debut in a Clonmel maiden and finished tailed off; should be capable of better in time but can only be watched after that effort.

2:15.race_name: Race Displays Joseph O'Reilly Hunters Chase

runners.name: Balkito
runners.breeder: M Armand Lefeuvre & M Yoni Seror
runners.comment: Out of form during the autumn points campaign, no encouragement from recent form
runners.spotlight: Out of form in a busy spell during the autumn points campaign; last of six in a hunters' chase at Thurles in January; again in rear at Belharbour; no encouragement from his two most recent starts.

quotes.race: Thurles Racecourse (Q.R.) Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Balkito has been dropped in to his class today. Chasing is his game and Jack got him into a great rhythm. If the handicapper isn't too hard on him he might win another one - Barry Connell, trainer.

runners.name: Big Interest
runners.comment: Has failed to build on a fine Down Royal win in December but remains a promising sort
runners.spotlight: Point winner last season; beat leading hunter chaser Its On The Line on his rules' debut at Down Royal in December on good-to-yielding; much less effective on soft when a moderate fourth behind Ryehill at Naas; lost a shoe when pulled up in the Tetratema at Gowran; found the trip (below 2m4f) inadequate at Down Royal last month; remains a promising sort

runners.name: Go Another One
runners.comment: Winner of 14 races under rules, no success in 12 starts in points since last October
runners.spotlight: Winner of 14 races under rules; veteran has failed to score in 12 starts in point-to-points since last October.

quotes.race: Buy Tickets Online At corkracecourse.ie Hurdle
quotes.quote: Go Another One won this last year when he was well in, he wasn't so well in this year so he's certainly not getting any worse! He is still really enthusiastic and he was probably the last horse to pull up - John McConnell, trainer.

quotes.race: Ladbrokes Live Streaming Hurdle
quotes.quote: He did it well. We had our concerns about the ground but he handled it the finest and quickened down to the last and put the race to bed very quickly. Unfortunately now we're probably going to have to go for a big one with him and step him up in class. He's 11 wins now and was entitled to do that - Ben Harvey, rider

quotes.race: Camida Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: To be honest, I was like Henrietta Knight there ? I didn't watch much of it because this is my star. Sean said they hacked and then they sprinted, which wouldn't have really suited him. But he said he felt classy and it would have been a great education for him, and that's what we came here for, and the ground on the chase track is lovely, so I'm delighted, relieved. I haven't got a plan, but we'll go for a novice chase. It could be in Perth, could be in Ireland, and we'll might end up in Galway or Listowel, and then we'll have a winter's break. We'll see how the summer has gone before we make the spring plan - John McConnell, trainer

quotes.race: EBF Stallions Gold Castle "National Hunt" Novices' Hurdle (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Go Another One has had a good season. We were slightly concerned whether he would stay but he got the 3m well. He likes this summer ground and will now go chasing - Mark Kavanagh, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: BetVictor Michael Purcell Memorial Novice Hurdle (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: Go Another One won well in the end. I wasn't sure about him going right-handed. He's in at Cheltenham and he might go. He's been an absolute star for me - John McConnell, trainer.

quotes.race: Walls & Ceilings International Ltd Novices' Hurdle
quotes.quote: Go Another One has had some issues, but was a very good bumper horse. We've taken him along slowly to feel our way with him. We're not going to aim too high and will take things step by step, but he's a nice horse. He was second in a point-to-point and he's a big horse so I'd say he'd make a chaser. There's a novice hurdle at Bangor coming up we might look at. John C McConnell, trainer

stable_tour.quote: He's a real stable star. We've given him a break and the plan will be to freshen him up for the spring. He's versatile and will have the option of running in a big handicap over hurdles or fences. 23-11-20

runners.name: Hollow Games
runners.comment: Needs to step up on the form of hunters' chase outings at Haydock and Gowran, may do so
runners.spotlight: Unbeaten in two bumpers, useful hurdler-chaser at his best; needs to step up on the form of hunters' chase outings at Haydock and Gowran; chased home prolific winner Winged Leader at Portrush a month ago.

quotes.race: Lawlor's Of Naas Novice Hurdle (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: Hollow Games ran very well because he got stopped in his run a couple of times and he probably should have been second. He'll be a nice horse - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Hollow Games is a nice horse, a big galloper. Davy said he wasn't doing a stroke the whole way round, he just picked up when he gave him a squeeze. He's more of a staying horse - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Irish Injured Jockeys INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: This is a very good horse. He's a lovely staying prospect and it was nice to get that done today. He's still a big green horse, he's 16.3 hands and is going to improve again. He's a staying horse for the future. When you're able to do that, win two bumpers, you're more than likely going to end up being a good horse - Jamie Codd, rider of Hollow Games

quotes.race: Love Food At Rathsallagh Golf Club (Pro/Am) Flat Race
quotes.quote: Our better winter horses are starting to come out. We have a few really nice bumper horses but this lad is right up there. He's very, very good - Jamie Codd, rider

stable_tour.quote: We're going to go down the hunter chase route with him in the hope that the spark will return. He's got some good back form and he's only eight, so hopefully he'll be a force to be reckoned with in that sort of grade. 28-10-24

runners.name: Run Wild Fred
runners.comment: Former Troytown winner, has become regressive, plenty to prove, cheekpieces tried now
runners.spotlight: Very smart in his prime for Gordon Elliott, including winning 2021 Troytown off 145; regressed last year, runner-up in Bandon open last month; plenty to prove, cheekpieces tried now.

quotes.race: Ladbrokes Troytown Handicap Chase (Grade B)
quotes.quote: I think the National Hunt Chase could be written all over Run Wild Fred. Michael [O'Leary] might have different ideas, and it's a long time from here to March, but I think the National Hunt Chase is made for him and I'm a big believer in going for the race you think you can win - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Surehaul Mercedes-Benz Novice Hurdle (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: Run Wild Fred is a grand galloping horse and I thought he won snug enough. We'll see where we go with him, he could go to Cheltenham but there is plenty of good prize-money here at home too - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: John Lynch Carpets Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: He's a grand big honest horse and is a big staying chaser. That's what he is and he'll win his races - Gordon Elliott, trainer of Run Wild Fred

stable_tour.quote: Another of mine who just got a bit tired in the closing stages of the Munster National and needed the run. We'll have a look at the Troytown for him. He'll be fitter for it anyway. 24-10-23

runners.name: Ryehill
runners.comment: Down the field at Cheltenham, every chance on the strength of his Naas win in February
runners.spotlight: Remote fourth to Its On The Line at Punchestown last May; raised his game this season, notably when beating Ontheropes and Its On The Line at Naas (3m1f, soft), with Big Interest fourth; failed to make his presence felt in the St James's Place at Cheltenham, though stayed on late from well off the pace; could be a different proposition now.

quotes.race: QuinnBet Hunters Chase
quotes.quote: Ryehill took a bit of time because he is so big, but he has strengthened up well and seems to keep improving. He's a nice horse to take to Cheltenham, with hopefully an each-way squeak. He likes soft ground and the trip will be no trouble to him - Ross O'Sullivan, trainer

quotes.race: John Thomas McNamara Series Maiden Hunters Chase
quotes.quote: Ryehill is a deceiving horse. He is not a good traveller through a race but the further he goes the better, which is a good sign. He should be alright in those 3m handicap chases - Ross O'Sullivan, trainer.

runners.name: Step Up Son
runners.comment: Outran odds of 100-1 when second at Gowran, flopped on good ground at Downpatrick
runners.spotlight: 2-12 in point-to-points; outran odds of 100-1 when second in the Tetratema at Gowran, with Hollow Games (fifth) among those behind; failed to reproduce that form on better ground in lesser company at Downpatrick.

runners.name: La Malmason
runners.comment: Course winner in December, sights lowered again after Exeter and Cheltenham ventures
runners.spotlight: Took a sharp rise in the ratings for a 2m4f win at this venue in December (Ballybawn Belter third); ran well off her revised mark at Limerick; sights lowered again after runs at Exeter and in a Cheltenham Festival handicap.

quotes.race: Cheltenham Racecourse Food Bank Collection Mares' Handicap Chase (Challenger Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: It is nice to see La Malmason find her feet and hopefully she can go on from here. I suppose she'll be off a mark where she would warrant her place in some of those nice mares' novice chase races. We'll see what the handicapper does and take it from there - Gavin Cromwell, trainer.

quotes.race: Paddy Power Dear Lord I've Left The Immersion On Mares Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: La Malmason is well bred and her work has been very good, we though she might win today. I was left in front a bit soon after she travelled well into the race. She was just doing enough - Keith Donoghue, rider.

stable_tour.quote: She was a little bit disappointing towards the end of last season as she was working well but wasn't showing it on the track. She's come back in and looks great so I'm hopeful there could be a handicap in her on soft ground. 12-11-24

This half-sister to Stage Star made an encouraging start to her hurdling career when taking a maiden at Cork on her debut. Last time out at Punchestown she looked a little unfortunate when second to Sa Fureur. The stewards looked into it and Keith [Donoghue] said he felt they were carried across the track in the closing stages, but the result stood. It was a good effort and as she's clearly progressive I may give her an entry for the Mares' Novices' Hurdle at Cheltenham. She's a fine, big daughter of Walk In The Park and could be quite interesting. She's not a guaranteed runner but I suggest readers keep her on side. 15-02-23

runners.name: Shecouldbeanything
runners.comment: 4-9 over fences, third in Cheltenham G2, seventh in the Irish Grand National yesterday
runners.spotlight: Started well over fences, winning four smallish-field races (at up to 2m4f) between late September and November (on ground ranging from soft to good); struggled in the Drinmore at this venue before finishing 9l third behind Bioluminescence at Limerick; creditable third behind Dinoblue in the Mares' Chase at Cheltenham; beaten over 28 lengths when seventh in the Irish Grand National yesterday.

quotes.race: Mrs Paddy Power Mares' Chase (Registered As The Liberthine Mares' Chase) (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Shecouldbeanything ran a great race again and I'm very happy. She does fall slightly short of those top mares, but she has loads of experience now. I thought she ran above herself and we will probably go to the Irish Grand National now - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Mahon Falls Mares Chase
quotes.quote: Shecouldbeanything is a clever and straightforward mare. She is genuine as you can get and jumps for fun - Sam Ewing, rider

quotes.race: O'Dwyer Steel Dundrum Novice Chase (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: Shecouldbeanything is very tough and very genuine. She won going away at the line. I was after my one early but she finds so much I was never really too worried to be honest - Sam Ewing, rider.

quotes.race: Ballygarry Estate Hotel & Spa Mares Novice Chase
quotes.quote: Shecouldbeanything did it well. She's a tough mare, enjoyed the ground, and she jumped very well - Sam Ewing, rider

quotes.race: Anglo Printers Remembering John H. Kierans Mares Hurdle
quotes.quote: They went a really good gallop, so I had to bide my time and Shecouldbeanything stayed on gamely. She's a solid mare and today showed she will definitely stay further. She's very versatile ground-wise, ran well at Cheltenham on soft and, while she has form on all different types of ground, that nicer surface brings out the best in her - Sam Ewing, jockey.

quotes.race: SP Or Better Guaranteed With Tote Handicap Hurdle (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Shecouldbeanything did it very well. We went a good gallop the whole way and she was probably just in her comfort zone where she was. As soon as we straightened up and I got after her, she picked up fierce well. She's decent and hopefully can keep progressing. She handled that ground fine as well - Jack Kennedy, rider, speaking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: Easyclean Tourist Attraction Mares Hurdle (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Shecouldbeanything went a nice, even gallop and grinded it out really well. She found plenty and made my job a good bit easier - Donagh Meyler, rider

quotes.race: Howden Insurance Brokers Mares Novice Hurdle (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Shecouldbeanything is a good mare. She ran well in Cheltenham, probably did plenty and was keen enough so we said we'd have one run going to the last. She has a great attitude and she will definitely jump a fence. She won a point-to-point and winged from fence to fence so she will be grand.  We'll give her a break now - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Goggin Buckley Mares Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Shecouldbeanything was very good. She was keen and didn't help herself. I held onto her for as long as I could and she quickened away smartly - Jordan Gainford, rider.

stable_tour.quote: She just keeps winning and she's now won three on the bounce. She won decisively at Clonmel on Thursday and we'll probably give her a break when the rain comes and the ground gets too testing. She's going to be a lovely mare to go to war with next spring. 28-10-24

runners.name: Zenta
runners.breeder: E A R L De Cordelles Et Al
runners.comment: Grade 1 juvenile hurdle winner, beginning to get to grips with chasing judged on C&D win
runners.spotlight: Grade 1-winning juvenile hurdler; ran creditably in a pair of big handicap hurdles last spring; failed to show anything like that sort of form on first three attempts chasing; beginning to get to grips with this discipline judged on C&D win in February, achieved at the expense of three stablemates, including favourite and subsequent winner Paggane.

quotes.race: Jewson Anniversary 4-Y-O Juvenile Hurdle (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Zenta was travelling great and winged the last and I landed in front, so I sent her on. I couldn't really peg her back, but I know in future to hold on to her. She's still very green and still learning in front of a big crowd today, so I know a bit more about her now - Mark Walsh, rider.

stable_tour.quote: She was due to run at Cork on Sunday in a mares' beginners' chase, but the meeting was called off. She's a mare who I think might be able to make a name for herself over fences this season. She's been coming along nicely and we're looking forward to getting her started back. 25-11-24

runners.name: Law Ella
runners.comment: Consistent sort before putting a blot on her record on latest, cheekpieces added
runners.spotlight: Has failed to add to Thurles beginners' win of last season; generally solid record this term, including strong-finishing second over 2m6f at Listowel; put a blot on her record when pulled up at Leopardstown early last month; cheekpieces added to usual tongue-tie.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Mares Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Law Ella has plenty of size and scope. She had plenty of schooling done on the all-weather. It didn't quite happen for her over hurdles but she looks a better chaser already and I love the way she jumped - Gavin Cromwell, trainer.

quotes.race: Cosy Roof Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Law Ella can kick on from here hopefully. We're happy to get that done and she is a candidate now for something at Punchestown - Gavin Cromwell, trainer

stable_tour.quote: She won her beginners' chase well at Thurles last season and has finished runner-up in Listed company and in a good handicap at Listowel since. We're not sure where we're going to with her yet but hopefully there's a nice race in her. She doesn't want the ground bottomless but could do with a little bit of ease. 12-11-24

She won her beginners' chase well at Thurles last season and has finished runner-up in Listed company and in a good handicap. We're not sure where we're going with her yet but hopefully there's a nice race in her. She doesn't want the ground bottomless but could do with a little bit of ease. 13-11-24

runners.name: Mousey Brown
runners.comment: Two handicap chase wins were gained in quick succession last June, going may not be ideal
runners.spotlight: Notched up back-to-back handicap chase wins at Kilbeggan and Punchestown last June; pleasing return to action in a Grade 3 mares' hurdle at Punchestown in February; possible excuses when unplaced at Navan last time; four of her six wins have been on good, this going may not be ideal.

quotes.race: Punchestown Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Mousey Brown enjoyed the little bit ease in the ground and she really galloped to the line. She's a hardy mare. The plan is to go to the Midlands National at Kilbeggan. She's a big mare and she seems to be going the right away - Dermot McLoughlin, trainer.

quotes.race: Cooke's Bar & Restaurant Caragh Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Mousey Brown did it well. Paddy said she enjoyed herself. They went a good gallop and it suited her, she stays well. It took a while for her to warm to her jumping, she hasn't run over fences for a while and the fences come up thick and fast here on the bends. She came alive late on and she probably got to the front too soon - Dermot McLoughlin, trainer

quotes.race: visitwexford.ie Mares Opportunity Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Mousey Brown is a nice mare and is improving the whole time. She is settling well now and that was the key to her. She is a big, strong mare. Michael gave her a good ride and she kept going the best - Dermot McLoughlin, trainer.

runners.name: Majestic Force
runners.comment: Winning favourite at Wexford on third chase start, could slot into handicaps effectively
runners.spotlight: Point/maiden hurdle winner; creditable fifth behind Golden Ace in the Mares' Novice Hurdle at Cheltenham last season; solid run behind the useful Spindleberry on chase debut at Cork in December, a late mistake proving costly, and that form was boosted here on Sunday; jumped poorly at Naas; winning favourite at Wexford on third start, could slot into handicaps effectively.

quotes.race: I.N.H. Stallion Owners EBF Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Majestic Force was getting plenty of weight from the second but that was very good for a first run over hurdles. Rachael thinks she will be better in a better race where they go a stride quicker - Robbie Power, assistant trainer.

stable_tour.quote: She won her maiden hurdle nicely at Punchestown but it didn't work out when we dropped her back to two miles after that, although she ran well up to a point. She's a point-to-point winner and will go chasing now over two and a half miles and beyond. 18-11-24

runners.name: Must Be Obeyed
runners.comment: C&D winner two seasons ago, 4lb lower than when fourth here last year, place chance
runners.spotlight: 2-19 over fences; over two years since her chase wins were achieved back-to-back at Punchestown (2m7f) and over C&D; best 2024 run when second in a valuable Punchestown festival handicap; fair fourth over 3m1f at Naas last time; 4lb lower than when fourth in this race last year, place chance.

quotes.race: Tote Always SP Or Better At Punchestown Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Must Be Obeyed was good and tough. I didn't know if she was up to winning that. I knew she would love the ground, staying chasing is what we talked about and the test of stamina really tested her - Tom Gibney, trainer.

runners.name: Ballybawn Belter
runners.comment: Suffered interference at Leopardstown in December, good run at this venue early that month
runners.spotlight: Three-time winner over hurdles; 0-6 over fences; fair third behind La Malmason in a 2m4f mares' handicap here in December; suffered interference from a faller at Leopardstown later that month; best with some ease in the ground; could feature.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Mares Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Ballybawn Belter has been amazing. She was narrow and skinny when Frank (Berry) bought her but she's done well physically. She seems to stay reasonably well but physically she's done very well in the last six to eight months as she wasn't imposing last year. I was contemplating going over fences with her as she jumps a fence really well, but Frank twisted my arm to stay over hurdles. She's a pleasure to train. I'm looking forward to running her over fences - Liz Doyle, trainer, speaking on Racing TV.

quotes.race: Adare Manor Opportunity Series Final Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Ballybawn Belter was suited by the trip and got a lovely clean ride on quickish ground. She might get a bit of a break now and maybe come back for Galway - Liz Doyle, trainer

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Paddy Mullins Mares Handicap Hurdle (Grade B)
quotes.quote: Ballybawn Belter won her bumper here. I thought the good gallop would help her because it's a bit short for her. She jumps very well now. It's a hard race to win - Liz Doyle, trainer.

runners.name: True Testimony
runners.comment: Beaten 24l in fifth behind Zenta here in February, 20lb better off but no sign of progress
runners.spotlight: Yet to win a race; best form over hurdles last season was at this venue, runner-up twice; beaten 24l in fifth behind Zenta here in February; 20lb better off but no sign of progress in two subsequent starts

runners.name: Sea Aster
runners.comment: 2-10 from fences after 3m2f win on good ground at Down Royal nine days ago, up 7lb
runners.spotlight: Won a 2m7f Clonmel beginners' event on good ground last June; Now 2-10 from fences after 3m2f win on good ground at Down Royal nine days ago; up 7lb and this going may not be ideal.

runners.name: Kiltealy Park
runners.comment: Beaten 8l when second at Wexford, 4lb out of the handicap but 5lb claimed, blinkered now
runners.spotlight: Two wins over hurdles at Wexford, successful over fences at Clonmel in December; beaten 8l when second in a recent 2m4f handicap at Wexford; 4lb out of the handicap but 5lb claimed, blinkered now.

quotes.race: Clonmel Racecourse Supporters Club Only 90 Euros To Join Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Kiltealy Park won her maiden hurdle, a handicap and I'd say the ground was a bit quick the last day she ran. We'll look to Christmas now and might step her up a little in trip - Paul Nolan, trainer

runners.name: Cuta Des As
runners.breeder: R Van Haaren &  E Van Haaren
runners.owner: Martin Dodd & Michael Songer & Martin Hill & Terry Dodd
runners.comment: Ordinary form in beginners' chases, 5lb out of the handicap, cheekpieces may help
runners.spotlight: Point/bumper winner; won a maiden hurdle at Punchestown last season before struggling in two Grade 1s; soundly beaten in fourth on chase debut at Cork and has failed to improve; cheekpieces may help on handicap debut, but she is 5lb wrong; risky.

quotes.race: See You At Festival 2024 Mares Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Cuta Des As likes that ground and jumped well when it was needed. She's a nice big mare and one we will enjoy going over fences with in time - Willie Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Bluegrass Horse Feeds Mares INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: Cuta Des As did it the hard way on her own, her ears were pricked the whole way. She quickened well and I'm sure she will have a good career ahead of her over hurdles - Pat Taaffe, rider.

runners.name: Secret She Keeps
runners.comment: No sign of her old form since making a comeback, up against it from 6lb out of handicap
runners.spotlight: Won a Thurles mares' beginners' chase in 2022 for Henry de Bromhead; only four runs since then; no sign of her old form since making a comeback for this stable; up against it from 6lb out of handicap.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Mares Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Secret She Keeps is a lovely mare. She got a bit lost over hurdles and we were keen to go chasing with her. She wants better ground and she could be a lovely mare for the spring - Henry de Bromhead, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: It was great to see her win the other day at Thurles after going so close at Fairyhouse. She's ground-dependent, though, and likes a nice surface. We'll see how the weather unfolds but I wouldn't be surprised if we put her away until the spring. 14-11-22

3:25.race_name: Fairyhouse Racecourse Ladies National Handicap Chase

runners.name: Dreal Deal
runners.owner: Mark Devlin & Nigel Ohare & Philip Smith

prev_owners.owner: Mark Devlin & Philip Smith & Nigel O'Hare & Claire Wylie

runners.comment: Hit form at around this time last year, should be better for his run in the Topham
runners.spotlight: Grade 2 novice hurdle winner in 2021; hit form at around this time last year, winning conditions chases at Down Royal and Wexford; should be better for his run in the Topham on only his second outing after a winter break.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Moscow Flyer Novice Hurdle (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: His preparation wasn't ideal and that's maybe why Dreal Deal drifted. He will probably go for the Supreme but will be entered in the Ballymore as well. That was the dream but he had to go and do that today - Ronan McNally, trainer.

quotes.race: WhatOddsPaddy Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: He has had a busy time of it and will probably have a break now until after Christmas. Things will be getting more difficult for him, but a strongly run 2m should suit him nicely and we will target one in the new year - Ronan McNally, trainer.

quotes.race: Download The BETDAQ App Ladies Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Dreal Deal got a very cool ride from Maxine, she got him settled and jumping beautifully. He's in at Cork on Sunday, depending on what the handicapper does. If he goes there he will come back in the Spring because he is more of a good ground horse - Ronan McNally, trainer

runners.name: So Des Flos
runners.comment: Moderate recent form, should not be ruled out being a dual C&D winner for this rider
runners.spotlight: Moderate recent form; however, should not be ruled out being a dual C&D winner for this rider; now back on the same mark as when beating Klarc Kent (recent Scottish Grand National runner-up) in this race 12 months ago.

stable_tour.quote: Entitled to come on for his first start over fences at Fairyhouse and hopefully he can pick up a beginners chase in the next few weeks. 24-10-23

runners.name: Potters Party
runners.comment: Course 3m1f winner on heavy, solid chance based on Thurles second in January
runners.spotlight: Course 3m1f winner on heavy last season; solid chance based on Thurles second in January when those behind included Secrecies Of Stone, who has shown improved form in the interim.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Potters Party seems to be better over fences and jumped well apart from the last two, he was probably very tired on the ground. He was crying out for a test of stamina and hopefully he can build on that - Robbie Power, assistant trainer

stable_tour.quote: I thought he'd improve for a step up in trip at Fairyhouse and that's exactly what happened. He kept going in tough conditions. Stamina looks his strong suit. We might go back to Fairyhouse for the Porterstown Handicap Chase in early December or a three-mile handicap chase back on the inside track there in a few weeks' time. 20-11-23

runners.name: The Boola Boss
runners.comment: In-form raider, would probably prefer better ground but has to be taken seriously
runners.spotlight: In-form raider whose chase record now stands at an admirable 5-12 following recent wins at Newbury and Chepstow; would probably prefer better ground but has to be taken seriously with Jody Townend booked.

quotes.race: BetVictor A Run For Your Money At Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: The keys to The Boola Boss are a flat track and good ground and, like Becky [Curtis, trainer] said, two [miles] six [furlongs] is probably his perfect trip. Three miles probably stretches him and two and a half [miles] is probably a bit too short so ideal conditions really - Sean Bowen, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports.

quotes.race: William Hill Extra Place Races Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: The Boola Boss has been going really well at home and he's just come into himself. He did it nicely and I'm very pleased. He's quite versatile on ground but I'm not sure I'll keep him going now because he's a big horse and he might not want to be summer racing. He may go out on his break next week  - Rebecca Curtis, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: We found he had a bit of a bad infection the last time he ran, so you can draw a line through that run. He's been declared to run at Doncaster on Thursday in a 2m4½f handicap chase. 10-02-25

runners.name: Bocellis Voice
runners.comment: Best form over fences has been in 2m events at Wexford, lacks a recent outing
runners.spotlight: Best form over fences has been in 2m events on yielding ground at Wexford; lacks a recent outing; others preferred.

runners.name: Routine Excellence
runners.comment: Ran over hurdles last Tuesday, may struggle to reverse recent form with Secrecies Of Stone
runners.spotlight: Won a 2m4f claimer at Bellewstown last August; signs of returning to form when fourth to Secrecies Of Stone in a handicap chase at Leopardstown last month; ran over an inadequate trip in a claiming hurdle at Tramore last Tuesday; third to So Des Flos in this last season.

quotes.race: Jimmy Neville Memorial Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Routine Excellence did it well. I probably got going a bit soon off the bend and he idled a bit. Hopefully he's back on track now - Keith Donoghue, rider.

quotes.race: Gormanlough Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: It looked to be a fair mistake but Routine Excellence didn't lose a terrible lot of ground. He looked well handicapped on his hurdles form and ultimately he was. He's in on Tuesday at Down Royal but he might not get in as he's number eight in the ballot. If he comes out of that okay and he gets in he might run. I'm not sure, we'll see what the handicapper does - Gavin Cromwell, trainer.

quotes.race: Happy Christmas From Naas Racecourse Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Routine Excellence hadn't run since March and he came back to us a different horse. I was happy with him and thought he would go close today - Gavin Cromwell, trainer

stable_tour.quote: He got his biggest win at Thurles last spring and I fancied him to run a big race on his reappearance at Galway last month, but he was only sixth. We're going to put that down to the ground - he probably wants it a bit better than that. Hopefully he can bounce back. 10-11-23

runners.name: Dont Talk
runners.comment: Two wins in January including over 2m1f at this venue, should be better for a recent run
runners.spotlight: Followed up a 2m4f win at Down Royal in January with a 2m1f success at this venue four days later, beating subsequent 8l Gowran winner Champagne Mahler; should be better for a run at Limerick earlier in the month; has 3-8 record at this track.

quotes.race: SBK Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Don't Talk jumped and travelled well and the soft ground seemed to bring out a bit of improvement in him - Karl Thornton, trainer.

quotes.race: Tote+ Pays You More At Tote.ie Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Don't Talk brought me to the front soon enough but I had to go when I did. Hopefully there is a bit more in him, he was just doing the bare minimum in front - Danny Gilligan, rider

runners.name: Secrecies Of Stone
runners.comment: Won readily at Leopardstown last month and may remain competitive off 7lb higher
runners.spotlight: Maiden hurdle winner at Tipperary last summer; weak chase form before taking a small step in the right direction at Clonmel; won readily at Leopardstown last month and may remain competitive off 7lb higher now that he seems to have turned a corner.

quotes.race: O'Driscoll's Irish Whiskey Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Secrecies Of Stone had nice form through the winter and we hoped he would put things right here. He likes a bit of room in his races and he jumped well. With his rating he was entitled to win that - Sean O'Keeffe, rider.

runners.name: Vaureal
runners.comment: Relatively unexposed, fair third at this venue in January on only handicap chase start
runners.spotlight: Well-related sort; long-priced winner of a 2m4f maiden hurdle at Roscommon last August; initial novice chase form seemed ordinary; however, he showed that his 109 handicap mark is just about right with C&D third in January; made a lot of the running before fading into fourth in a beginners' event at Thurles on stable debut.

runners.name: Iks Man
runners.comment: May find this too demanding having gone up 10lb for a breakthrough chase win at Clonmel
runners.spotlight: Point-to-point winner and placed twice over hurdles; weak chase form before a breakthrough win at Clonmel last time; may find this too demanding having gone up 10lb.

quotes.race: Careys Castle Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Ik's Man was placed a few times in auction maiden hurdles a couple of years ago but then got a leg. I thought he would do that over fences originally, but he was on a winnable mark and the lads will get a good kick out of it - Terence O'Brien, trainer.

runners.name: Read To Return
runners.comment: Has been running over hurdles, plenty to prove, trainer/rider combination merits respect
runners.spotlight: Won 2m7f Killarney beginners' chase last season; three of his last four races have been over hurdles, best effort when third over a longer trip at this venue; hard to be confident, having been an unplaced favourite for this event last season; trainer/rider combination merits respect, all the same.

runners.name: Old Soul
runners.breeder: Mme Elza Petit, Mme Hannah Petit & M Benoit De Seissan De Ma
runners.comment: Two years since his only chase win, showed signs of a revival at Limerick; more needed
runners.spotlight: Won a handicap hurdle and beginners' chase two seasons ago; showed signs of a revival at Limerick; more needed.

quotes.race: The Old House, Kill Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Old Soul was entitled to do that. Sean pulled him up quickly the last day which was good. He's not quick, he will probably go over fences quite soon - Liz Doyle, trainer.

runners.name: Rusheen
runners.comment: Good effort at Limerick in December, two more recent runs have been much less encouraging
runners.spotlight: Good effort when 3l second at Limerick in December; two more recent runs have been much less encouraging; first-time cheekpieces.

quotes.race: Jump Into January At Fairyhouse Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Rusheen handles that ground but hopefully will be better on better ground. He's naturally a very good jumper but not quite as good on that ground - James Dullea, trainer.

4:30.race_name: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Novice Handicap Hurdle Series Final (Listed Race)

runners.name: Patter Merchant
runners.breeder: Brittas House Stud And Grenane House
runners.comment: Pertemps Final ninth; bit to find but rider's claim a positive
runners.spotlight: Point/bumper winner who was sent hurdling in only October, winning at first attempt in 2m6f Galway maiden but hasn't won in six attempts since, most recently none too fluent when never landing a blow in midfield in 3m Pertemps Final; bit to find but rider's claim a positive.

stable_tour.quote: This boy is not a bad horse at all. He beat Sounds Victorius when he won his bumper at Leopardstown last Christmas and that form has worked out well. It didn't look a bad maiden hurdle he won at Galway on Sunday and he is well worth a shot at a graded race next. 28-10-24

runners.name: Blaze The Way
runners.owner: Brian Groarke & Tom Groarke & Ms Margaret Mullins

prev_owners.owner: Brian Groarke & Tom Groarke & Ms Margaret Mullins

runners.comment: Proven stamina; definite place claims at least
runners.spotlight: Stamina proven having won 3m1f Navan handicap in December (yielding-to-soft) and subsequently second in 2m4f handicap at same track; solid fourth at Uttoxeter (3m) latest, despite hanging left; place claims.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: I'm delighted with Blaze The Way. He won his bumper and was placed over hurdles. I think he's a stayer and the last day we kind of rode him the wrong way in a better race. I've liked him for a while and I wasn't surprised to see that. We won't go again quickly with him, there might be something at the Thyestes meeting for him. We'll see how he improves from here - Mags Mullins, trainer.

quotes.race: Ballagh INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: Blaze The Way will be a grand horse over a hurdle and has plenty size to jump a fence. He battled well and is a saleable horse - Mags Mullins, trainer.

runners.name: Blue Mosque
runners.comment: Career-best over slightly shorter last time; still improving so one to consider
runners.spotlight: Cork maiden win (2m4f) came on good but handled soft ground well on latest when good second in 2m7f Thurles novice last month; still improving so one to consider on handicap debut.

runners.name: Fishery Lane
runners.comment: 2m4f maiden winner here before no show in Albert Bartlett; Townend's pick on handicap bow
runners.spotlight: Improved jumping under forcing tactics to land 2m4f maiden here in January (soft) but never counted in 3m Albert Bartlett Novices last month, a stiff task; Townend's pick entering handicaps here and one of the least exposed.

quotes.race: Jump Into January Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Fishery Lane is a strong stayer I would say. He will improve on the job regarding his jumping, and I would see him going up in trip rather than dropping back - Paul Townend.

stable_tour.quote: Given the work he did at home here last season, he's one I hope will be able to hold his own at the top level in novice hurdles this season. We'll try to find a maiden hurdle for him shortly and I'm looking forward to getting him out and getting him jumping. He's got lots of potential. 25-11-24

runners.name: Road To Home
runners.comment: Hexham maiden winner; stamina test should suit but opening mark looks on the high side
runners.spotlight: Listowel bumper winner (2m4f) for Eugene O'Sullivan; promise first two hurdle runs before readily landing lesser 2m Hexham maiden last month; good chance he'll improve for this stamina test but opening mark on the high side.

quotes.race: Happy Birthday Margaret Watling Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Road To Home's jumping at speed needs work as at the second-last and the last he was a bit careful. I don't mind that too much, but I wanted to win as easy as I could because we might go to Fairyhouse and Punchestown with him. I think he's a nice horse - Patrick Mullins, rider, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Autoportrait
runners.comment: Navan maiden winner stays 3m and one to consider on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Promise in France and four times for current yard before off the mark last month when making all in 2m4f Navan maiden on soft (third has won since): stays 3m; one to consider on handicap debut.

runners.name: Ayiko
runners.comment: Stays 3m and goes well on soft but bit to do off this opening mark
runners.spotlight: Both wins have come at Ayr on soft ground; bumper last season and most recently on fifth attempt hurdling in ordinary 3m maiden in January; bit to do off this opening mark.

runners.name: Custom Taylor
runners.comment: Stays okay but good bit to find on previous handicap attempt
runners.spotlight: Bumper winner and some solid runs in defeat in maiden hurdles before making all to land odds in ordinary 3m Limerick contest last month (yielding) in first-time visor; in between only midfield in valuable 3m Leopardstown handicap; more needed.

runners.name: Inn At The Park
runners.comment: Beat Ayiko 4.5l in C&D maiden; enters handicap company and don't rule out improvement
runners.spotlight: Beat Ayiko 4.5l in C&D maiden in December (yielding) but well held twice since in novice company, latest when dropping out tamely in Albert Bartlett; enters handicap company and don't rule out improvement.

runners.name: Beaufort Scale
runners.comment: Likes a stamina test but ideally wants better ground
runners.spotlight: Likes a stamina test, winning 3m Kilbeggan maiden last summer and 2m7f Bangor novice handicap in November; soft ground probably didn't suit when last seen in December so legitimate ground concerns here.

quotes.race: Hurley Family Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Beaufort Scale didn't put a foot wrong anywhere today, he jumped brilliant. We went a really good gallop and when I asked him he picked up, and did it well at the line - Sam Ewing, rider

stable_tour.quote: He disappointed at Gowran a few weeks ago but he's better than that. We'll be sending him over fences sooner rather than later. 28-10-24

runners.name: Dont Tell Jack
runners.comment: Bit onepaced on handicap debut over 2m4f last month; greater stamina test here could suit
runners.spotlight: Steady improvement in maidens, notably Punchestown third (2m) but looked a bit onepaced on handicap debut over 2m4f at Naas last month; greater stamina test here could bring improvement.

runners.name: Promontory
runners.comment: Limerick maiden winner should relish likely stamina test here on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Unraced for Willie Mullins; 8yo won at third time of asking for current yard when upped to today's trip in Limerick maiden early this month (good); likely more to come given a good stamina test which he'll get here and seems to handle soft.

runners.name: The Story So Far
runners.comment: Wexford ground may have been too lively; don't rule out now back on softer ground
runners.spotlight: Bumper winner got off the mark hurdling in Cork maiden (beating Autoportrait) over this trip in January; hasn't really gone on from that although ground probably plenty quick enough on recent run in Wexford novice; not one to rule out if ground remains on the soft side.

runners.name: Al Kalila
runners.comment: Ayr maiden win enhanced since; could have more to offer back in handicaps
runners.spotlight: Finally off the mark over timber at sixth attempt when landing 2m5f Ayr maiden in January (second won next time out and is rated 116 in Britain) on soft, despite jumping right; that had come after a 247-day absence so quite possible he'll have more to offer returned to handicaps.

runners.name: Andy Amo
runners.comment: Improver but jumping lacks fluency which could make him vulnerable in this higher grade
runners.spotlight: Improving 6yo since upped in trip, backing up 3m Uttoxeter maiden win by taking 2m7f Bangor handicap last month (good) when making all; jumping still lacks fluency which could make him vulnerable in this higher grade.

quotes.race: Quinnbet Daily Free Bet Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Andy Amo will be a lovely three-mile chaser next season. We wanted to step him up in trip and he's stayed well. We'll stick to hurdles this season, maybe give him a couple of runs and then put him away. It'd be nice if he could win a novice under a penalty and then we could think about something better - Rebecca Curtis, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: We've got lots of really nice horses in the yard this season and he's among them. He seems to stay really nicely and will progress when we go chasing. I'll look for another novice and try to win under a penalty and then look after him for next season. He'll get a trip and handles deep ground but he's not slow. 10-02-25

runners.name: Fairyland Opera
runners.breeder: Mrs T K Cooper & Miss Diana Cooper
runners.owner: Mrs T K Cooper & Miss Diana Cooper
runners.comment: Tramore maiden winner remains on a nice mark with likely more to offer upped in trip
runners.spotlight: Progressive mare twice runner-up in 2m handicaps before nice bit of improvement when upped to 2m6f in Tramore maiden six days ago, readily going clear before last (yielding); good chance she'll get this longer trip too and remains on a nice mark.

quotes.race: Adare Manor Opportunity Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Fairyland Opera absolutely deserved it and she ran unbelievable races at Naas and Navan, bumping into two very good horses. It didn't do her handicap mark any good so we said we'd go back to a maiden. They either stay or they don't and handle Tramore or not but she did both just fine. She's gorgeous. The plan was always to step up in trip and she'll probably have one more run before her holidays - Lorna Fowler, trainer.

runners.name: Goody Four Shoes
runners.comment: Poor recent effort behind Autoportrait at Navan; others preferred on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Pick of maiden form came when fourth in 2m7f Navan contest last month (heavy), poor effort three weeks later however behind Autoportrait at same track; others preferred on handicap debut.

runners.name: Born Bright
runners.comment: Staying-on C&D sixth recently; could improve under a more positive ride
runners.spotlight: Won 2m4f maiden here and scored in handicap company over 2m6f at Thurles last month on good ground; seemed to be ridden to stay trip here on latest when never nearer sixth; cheekpieces now tried, ideally wants better ground.

quotes.race: Adare Manor Opportunity Mares Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: That's fantastic and I'm delighted with Born Bright. She won a point-to-point and my son got to ride her in a few bumpers but she wants good ground and it went soft in Sligo and Listowel. This was a race that really suited and it was local. She'll run away over hurdles now - Claire O'Connell, trainer.

runners.name: The Miracle Man
runners.owner: A Trappe & Declan Trappe & Garry Trappe & James J Gallagher
runners.comment: Up 6lb for C&D win early this month but could be the type to keep improving
runners.spotlight: Won over 2m4f at Sligo earlier in the season and most recently posted career-best in winning over C&D early this month (good-to-yielding); 6lb rise but could be the type to keep improving.

quotes.race: Whistlin' Donkeys @ Fairyhouse Easter Saturday Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: The Miracle Man is a tough horse, he's from that Carrigeen [Kamala] family and they stay. He seems to like that ground. At one stage I was thinking we might let him off but they wouldn't be running on faster than that during the summer so we'll keep him out for a while - Arthur Moore, trainer.

runners.name: Joyeuse
runners.comment: Decent Cheltenham run; back in handicap company and at 2m, could well have more to offer
runners.spotlight: Progressive mare was gaining her second success over hurdles when impressive winner of the valuable William Hill Hurdle at Newbury (2m, soft) in February; big ask nonetheless in 2m4f Grade 1 Close Brothers' Mares Hurdle at Cheltenham and not at all discredited when beaten 13.5l, after hitting the last; back in handicap company and at 2m, could well have more to offer.

quotes.race: William Hill Hurdle (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Joyeuse jumped and travelled well, and you'd have to say she was in the perfect position throughout. This is a great race and local too. That's only the fourth hurdle race of her life, so it's not easy. She can't run in a Cheltenham handicap because she's not had enough runs, so where we go now we'll think about on another day - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

quotes.race: Blackdown Motor Company Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race) (Div I)
quotes.quote: Joyeuse has jumped very well at home on the only occasion that I've schooled her and hopefully she can kick on after that - James Bowen, jockey, speaking on Racing TV.

stable_tour.quote: She's doing well but she had only one run last year, which she won, and might be difficult to place. I'm thinking of that Ascot hurdle for horses who haven't run more than once. 22-10-24

runners.name: Anotherway
runners.comment: Too keen, soundly beaten on yard debut last month and now tongue-tied; bit to prove
runners.spotlight: Won a 2m heavy ground maiden at Punchestown last term for Willie Mullins but well held in valuable handicaps; too keen, soundly beaten on yard debut last month at Leopardstown and now fitted with a tongue-tie; bit to prove.

quotes.race: Get Best Odds Guaranteed At Bet Victor Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Anotherway stayed and galloped to the line but his jumping left a lot to be desired. Maybe it was the heavy ground as he jumped a lot better at Leopardstown. But he did what he was showing us at home today - Willie Mullins, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: A fine horse who came to us from Freddy Head in France. He didn't take his gelding overly well and took a while to recover from it. He's perfect now and I'd say he's a nice horse. 13-11-23

runners.name: Sa Fureur
runners.breeder: The Hon Mrs V M A Tower
runners.comment: Better chaser; recent runs in big handicap hurdles leave him with plenty to find
runners.spotlight: Grade 3 winning novice hurdler is a better chaser, including winning 2m4f Navan Listed handicap in December; tame efforts since in valuable handicap hurdles at Leopardstown and Cheltenham (off a high mark); another with a bit to prove.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Sa Fureur had the bit of luck today. Jack said he showed a good attitude - Gordon Elliot, trainer.

quotes.race: Markaye Contracts Ltd Michael Purcell Memorial Novice Hurdle (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: Sa Fureur was always just getting the better of the other horse. He probably doesn't do a whole lot in front. The ground was lovely for him today and the trip was good too - Jordan Gainford, rider.

quotes.race: Seamus & Annie Hughes Memorial Maiden Hurdle (Div II)
quotes.quote: Sa Fureur was good. He stayed it out well to the line. When he matures, he'll be a much nicer horse - Davy Russell, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He's a versatile horse who is a good bit lower over hurdles compared to his chase mark, so we've entered him in the Coral Cup and the Martin Pipe as well as Ultima, Grand Annual and Plate over fences. I'm not sure yet which direction he will go, but he ran well in the Grand Annual last year when he made a mistake at the second-last. 19-2-25

runners.name: Le Grand Peinture
runners.breeder: Mr Enda Crehan & Mrs Miriam Crehan
runners.comment: Front-running Navan maiden winner face much stiffer task but progressing well
runners.spotlight: Lighly raced 8yo showed promise on yard debut in 2m Leopardstown maiden last month before running away with similar Navan contest under forcing tactics (soft); second has won since and now rated 122; much stiffer task against some seasoned handicappers here but clearly progressing well.

runners.name: Sea Of Sands
runners.comment: Some stiff tasks of late, let down by jumping in recent C&D Grade 2; handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Two Flat wins in Germany; made a winning debut over hurdles at Listowel last September and has been set some stiff enough tasks since, latest when let down by jumping in Grade 2 novice over C&D 13 days ago; makes handicap debut.

runners.name: Gold Dancer
runners.breeder: Scea De Maulepaire & M C De Saint Seine

prev_owners.owner: Ecurie Mrs Lynne Maclennan, Ecurie Herve Guerin Et Al

runners.comment: Highly-tried novice; tame chasing debut when last seen; first handicap, others preferred
runners.spotlight: French 2m2f hurdle winner on heavy; struggled up in class in two runs for this yard and tame chasing debut effort when last seen in November; first handicap hurdle and others preferred.

stable_tour.quote: He's sharp. He's a nice novice hurdler in the making this season and the experience he gained in France will stand to him. 13-11-23

runners.name: Helvic Dream
runners.owner: Mrs Caroline Hendron & Mrs M Cahill
runners.comment: Down Royal second a solid effort; hard to be confident in but can't rule out
runners.spotlight: Group 1 winner in the Tattersalls Gold Cup in 2021; nowhere near as good a hurdler although decent second in quite valuable 2m1f Down Royal handicap in November; too keen in a first-time tongue-tie latest on flat; hard to be confident in but can't rule out.

quotes.race: Navan Ford & Opel Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: I said the other day that if Helvic Dream was in a Group race on the Flat, I'd fancy him, because he was that well in himself. He's still novicey for anything big, so I would have thought we'll try and get another run into him somewhere and then tip along. He will go back on the Flat again this year - Noel Meade, trainer.

quotes.race: Tote, Never Beaten by SP Amateur Riders Derby (Q.R.) Race
quotes.quote: Helvic Dream enjoyed himself and did not do a lot in front but he won comfortably. He used to be very keen but he was very settled there in a messy race. He could be a Supreme Novice horse - Patrick Mullins, rider.

quotes.race: Tattersalls Gold Cup (Group 1)
quotes.quote: Colin (Keane) said he was going to sit a bit closer and have one go at Broome. He felt he went too soon for Helvic Dream the last day and he felt he did again today. He has an electrifying turn of speed but lasted it out. It was a brilliant ride. He's been a pleasure to train and doesn't take a lot of work. There have been plenty of people interesting in buying him but thankfully the owners have kept faith in me as I felt he could win a Group 1 - Noel Meade, trainer.

quotes.race: Novi IT Services International Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: I thought he was good all year but things just haven't gone right for him with one thing and another. I don't know where he will go next but there is the possibility we could travel with him. He'll stick to Stakes races now. He loves soft ground. He wouldn't want fast ground but I think he'll go on good ground - Noel Meade, trainer

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Median Auction Race (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: Gavin [Ryan] gave him a lovely ride but he said it was very easy. They went a good gallop and he did exactly what he said he would. When he pulled him out he said he just had to change his hands and away he went. He loved the ground and quickened up well on it. Colin [Keane] loved this fella from the twice he rode him and Chris [Hayes] said last time he'd improve a lot because he was still green. The reason I claimed off him was because Dermot Weld was claiming 5lb off his runner and we would have been giving his filly 9lb as it was. I'd imagine we'll head to the final of the Foran Equine Irish EBF Auction Series - Noel Meade, trainer of Helvic Dream

quotes.race: Foran Equine Irish EBF Auction Race (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: He hadn't been showing us much at all at home before he ran well on his first start and he got into a little bit of trouble at Galway. Colin [Keane] has loved him all the time - he was pretty confident that he was a pretty decent horse. I'd imagine he'll go for the final of this series and we'll probably give him another run before that. He's thriving all the time. I'd say the ground was an advantage to him. I felt that he mightn't be a real fast ground horse. I bought him off Joanna Morgan and she told me 'you have to buy him' - she was right. He hasn't got a great pedigree but he's a very good looking horse, big and strong - Noel Meade, trainer of Helvic Dream

runners.name: Amanha
runners.breeder: S C E A Haras De Tonnencourt
runners.comment: Recent Navan win endorsed since; 8lb rise for that but should go well
runners.spotlight: Roscommon maiden winner last summer on soft and career-best in 2m Navan mares handicap last month on similar ground when readily beating a subsequent maiden winner; 8lb rise for that but should go well.

runners.name: Jazzy Matty
runners.breeder: J Magnien, C Magnien & B Magnien
runners.comment: Grand Annual winner of obvious appeal here off 17lb lower hurdles mark
runners.spotlight: Two of five career wins have come at Cheltenham Festival; 2023 Fred Winter and in last month's Grand Annual Handicap Chase when battling on well winner here; back hurdling off 17lb lower mark and has to be greatly respected, although would prefer better ground.

quotes.race: Debenhams Johnny Henderson Grand Annual Challenge Cup Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Jazzy Matty has gone from strength to strength since we got him. He really enjoys the way we train, and it's unbelievable to have gone this today. It's been a long couple of weeks before today - we only had one horse coming over and a lot of time and effort has gone into him. Everyone at home in the yard - we've a great team and to get this is unbelievable. To win on the big stage means so much and hopefully showcases that we can get one ready for the big day as well - Cian Collins, trainer.

quotes.race: Boodles Juvenile Handicap Hurdle (Registered As The Fred Winter) (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Jazzy Matty has done well to win as he was stuck out a bit wider than was ideal in a tight race like that, but thankfully it made no difference in the end. There is every chance he will now go to Aintree as i think that course will suit him even better - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's in great form and will run in whatever race he gets into. Hopefully that's the Grand Annual, because I think that race is made for him. He loves Cheltenham and that's a big bonus. He won the Fred Winter in 2023 and ran a cracker at the October meeting this season, when the race totally went against him. 20-2-25

runners.name: Kalix Delabarriere
runners.comment: Progressive novice with likely more to offer on handicap debut; Townend's pick
runners.spotlight: Beat Grade 2 Aintree bumper scorer Seo Lin on Ballinrobe debut last May (good) and steady improvement in three maiden hurdle runs this winter, including plenty keen when second at Navan and most recently settled better in hood/tongue-tie combination to win at Naas in February on heavy; back from a break for handicap debut with likely more to offer (headgear left off) and Townend's pick.

runners.name: Lord Erskine

prev_owners.owner: Exors of the Late Jeremiah Nolan

runners.comment: Veteran with a bit to find on recent form although never one to rule out; likes it soft
runners.spotlight: Veteran dual-purpose performer whose last win came in very valuable 2m handicap at last year's DRF on favoured soft ground off 120; recent runs leave him with a fair bit to find but never one to rule out.

quotes.race: Timeless Sash Windows Handicap Hurdle (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: I was a bit worried about the ground but Darragh (O'Keeffe) said it was no problem. I could never get Lord Erskine into a good race with a light weight and it was the same on the Flat. He'd a proper weight on his back today and there was a good gallop which suited him. His (late) owner Jerry Nolan was a pure gentleman. I rode winners for him and having an owner like him, you couldn't buy them - Harry Rogers, trainer.

quotes.race: Friends Of The Curragh Pollardstown Handicap
quotes.quote: We ran Lord Erskine at Listowel the other day and it just didn't work out. He does want two miles and that ground. I stuck the blinkers on him on Friday morning and that made the difference but he loves that ground and the trip. He's just easy to train and he's very laid-back, that's what's wrong with him, he just does what he wants and doesn't kill himself - Harry Rogers, trainer

quotes.race: Treo Eile Retraining Ireland's Racehorses Handicap
quotes.quote: We had to resort to plan B as Lord Erskine missed the break and had to sacrifice a couple of lengths to get him to the outside, but it worked out thankfully. That is his minimum trip as he is slow, but full of stamina. He was owned by the late Jerry Nolan and I'm delighted for connections - Harry is a big supporter of mine and himself and Miriam work very hard. I'm delighted for them. He is a yard stalwart, loves the track and is as genuine as they come.  - Siobhan Rutledge, rider.

quotes.race: BetVictor Run For Your Money Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: He's a decent horse on his day but he's had problems and it's just taken a long time to get him back. He was a bit keen today and the jumping seemed to wake him up a little bit. He handles that ground well and stays well. Hopefully things stay right with him, it's a long time since he won the Irish Cesarewitch here. He'll keep on going over the winter - Harry Rogers, trainer of Lord Erskine

quotes.race: Ryans Cleaning Event Specialists Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Lord Erskine is a nice horse and hopefully he can get another one. He's in again at Clonmel next week so we'll see how he comes out of this - Harry Rogers, trainer.

quotes.race: Strandhill Caravan Park Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: He's 18 in the ballot at Tipperary but that might bring him up a bit. He'll probably stay over hurdles for a while. He wants a dig in the ground and he wouldn't want it any quicker than that. Hopefully he might end up at Galway and if all goes well he'd scrape into the amateur race - Harry Rogers, trainer

quotes.race: Irish Cesarewitch (Premier Handicap)
quotes.quote: He was weak when we got him but he has progressed very well. They went a decent gallop and that suited him. He's a good horse and we might head for the Naas November Handicap next. He does like a good ease in the ground - Harry Rogers, trainer

quotes.race: John & Terry Moriarty Memorial Handicap
quotes.quote: He wouldn't be in love with the ground but he got away with it. When they get off in front here it seems to be hard to catch them. He's in at Ballinrobe next Thursday over hurdles but he hasn't really taken to hurdles so far. We might be better off keeping him on the Flat and go back over hurdles next year -  Harry Rogers, trainer

quotes.race: Sean Cleary Memorial Handicap
quotes.quote: He was unlucky in Tramore, Rachael Blackmore gave him a good ride but he was just too free. The plan was always to come here and when Pat Smullen is available, it's a help. He done it well and he's in at Navan on Saturday, where if there's any rain, he'll probably take his chance. The handicapper might give him 5lb or 6lb - Harry Rogers, trainer

runners.name: Stormbreaker
runners.comment: Wasn't discredited in Martin Pipe last month but others hold greater appeal
runners.spotlight: Flat winner for previous yard and has won 2m2f Listowel maiden hurdle for current yard; wasn't discredited in Martin Pipe last month but others hold greater appeal.

runners.name: American Money
runners.comment: Recent Naas second augurs well; could go well off a light weight here with rider's claim
runners.spotlight: All three handicap wins have been on soft and seems to be running into form, on evidence of last month's Naas second (2m4f) on favoured ground; could go well off a light weight here with rider's claim.

quotes.race: Adare Manor Opportunity Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: American Money is what he is but he's a good solid horse. He'll probably go chasing at some stage. He's qualified for the final of this series at Punchestown, so that's where we'll target him - Eddie Harty, co-trainer

quotes.race: Bar One Racing "Download The Mobile App" Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: American Money is a nice horse but we have no great plans for him. We'll have to look at the next division up now and he's a nice fun horse. He'll make a nice chaser in time and he will improve - Eddie Harty, joint-trainer.

runners.name: Zillow
runners.comment: Didn't appear to stay 2m4f last time; back to 2m for handicap debut
runners.spotlight: French flat winner has run creditably in four maiden hurdles for Willie Mullins, notably good fourth to stablemate Kopek Des Bordes at Leopardstown; didn't appear to stay 2m4f at same venue last time; back to 2m for handicap debut.

stable_tour.quote: I actually thought he was a lot straighter than he was at Punchestown on Saturday. He did run well for a long way, but got very tired. That should bring him on nicely and we'll look for another maiden hurdle for him now. I think he could mix it between hurdles and the Flat. 25-11-24

runners.name: Serienmond
runners.comment: Won going away at Leopardstown; 10lb rise but could go well off light weight
runners.spotlight: German Flat winner was 0-7 over hurdles for Tony Mullins before scoring on first start for Gavin Cromwell in 2m Leopardstown handicap last month in a first-time hood, short of room at the last but winning going away; up 10lb for that but won with plenty in hand and could go well here off light weight.

quotes.race: Cancer Fund For Children Charity Handicap Hurdle (Div I)
quotes.quote: They went a great gallop which helped Serienmond settle. He's been very keen at home since he came to us, and we've been working hard on just trying to get him to do things right. He jumped well and did everything right. It wasn't a great race on paper so hopefully the handicapper is not too hard on him - Gavin Cromwell, trainer.

runners.name: Stuntman Steve
runners.comment: Point and maiden winner, promise on h'cap debut latest, may need good ground, 5lb wrong
runners.spotlight: Point-to-point and Clonmel maiden hurdle winner, both on good ground; tough tasks in novice hurdles here (20.5f) and at Thurles (2m6f) but was still going okay when falling two out dropped back to 15.5f (good) at the latter venue on handicap debut in January; may need better ground than this and 5lb wrong, although he was runner-up here yesterday.

quotes.race: Connolly's RED MILLS Irish EBF Auction Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: The final hurdle was the winning of the race for Stuntman Steve and thankfully he came up for me. We have him six weeks and while he hadn't been away, we thought he was a nice horse so thought he'd go close - Keith Donoghue, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He had more letters than numbers in his point-to-point form but he's a grand horse. He won at Ballingarry in May and then made a winning start for us in a maiden hurdle at Clonmel last week when the front two pulled 17 lengths clear. I'm not sure where we go from here but he's qualified for the auction final at Punchestown. I suppose a rated novice could be next for him. 12-11-24

He's a grand horse who won his maiden hurdle at Clonmel last week and the front two pulled 17 lengths clear. He's qualified for the auction final at Punchestown and I suppose a rated novice could be next. 13-11-24

5:35.race_name: Hire2K Irish EBF Mares Flat Race

runners.name: Another Girl
runners.comment: Dam Westerner Lady won a bumper and nine of her 13 races over jumps, interesting prospect
runners.spotlight: Second foal; dam Westerner Lady won a bumper and nine of her 13 races over jumps for Willie Mullins, half-sister to useful hurdle/chase winner Only The Bold; potentially interesting newcomer for local stable.

runners.name: Blue Pearl Bay
runners.comment: Showed nothing in a bumper at Tipperary last year, pulled up in a maiden hurdle last month
runners.spotlight: Decent pedigree; showed nothing in a bumper at Tipperary last April and pulled up in a maiden hurdle at Gowran last month.

runners.name: Bossy Bird
runners.comment: First foal; dam unplaced in bumpers and over hurdles, fair staying pedigree
runners.spotlight: First foal; dam unplaced in bumpers and over hurdles, fair staying pedigree.

runners.name: Broomfield Aderra
runners.comment: Won a four-runner Dungarvan mares' maiden on fourth point start, top rider booked
runners.spotlight: Walk In The Park mare, cost 42,000Euros as 3yo; half-sister to four winners, best of them Orrisdale who won a bumper and three races over jumps for Jonjo O'Neill; won a four-runner Dungarvan mares' maiden on fourth point start for leading handler Aidan Fitzgerald; positive jockey booking.

runners.name: Derryville
runners.comment: Solid placed form though flattered by proximity to Bambino Fever at Leopardstown
runners.spotlight: Placed in all four bumpers starts; beaten by wide margins on first two attempts; beaten under 5l when third at Thurles in December; definite chance here even though flattered by proximity to subsequent DRF and Champion Bumper winner Bambino Fever when a 5l runner-up at Punchestown.

runners.name: Doing It In Style
runners.comment: Remote third on debut at Gowran, trainer also runs the more experienced Lau And Shaz
runners.spotlight: Remote third on debut in Gowran race won by a mare who flopped at Cheltenham; form involving runner-up Champagne Venture suggests Derryville could have her measure, though she is less exposed than that rival, trainer also runs Lau And Shaz.

runners.name: Grandala
runners.comment: Good pedigree, second in two points (beaten favourite both times), has joined a top stable
runners.spotlight: Third foal; half-sister to Paul Nicholls-trained Listed bumper winner Larchmont Lass (also successful over hurdles); dam useful hurdle/chase winner; second in two points (beaten favourite both times); has joined a top stable.

runners.name: Hello Jean
runners.comment: Longer trip should suit following staying-on third over 2m, has an edge over Jo's Secret
runners.spotlight: Sister to 2m3f-2m5f hurdle/chase winner Indie Belle; dam useful 2m4f-2m5f hurdle winner; left an impression that she will be suited by this trip when staying on for third on debut in a 2m contest at Leopardstown; had 3.75l to spare over subsequent Cork runner-up Jo's Secret.

runners.name: Jos Secret
runners.comment: Second at Cork, has a bit to find with Hello Jean on previous form, Derek O'Connor booked
runners.spotlight: Second in a point-to-point at Knockmullen House during the autumn campaign; got tired late when fifth at Leopardstown early last month, 3.25l behind third-placed Hello Jean; beaten by a 40-1 chance when favourite at Cork; Derek O'Connor (who rode a recent debut bumper winner for the stable) a noteworthy booking.

runners.name: Kilbuny Supersonic
runners.comment: In rear in a bumper last year, point winner, should be better equipped for this test now
runners.spotlight: Second to subsequent bumper winner Echoing Silence in a maiden point last season; struggled when thrown in at the deep end in a Listed bumper at Limerick; point winner this season, should be better equipped for this test.

runners.name: Lau And Shaz
runners.comment: Placed in three of her four bumper starts, has also run well over hurdles, definite chance
runners.spotlight: Placed in three of her four bumper starts; second to a Willie Mullins-trained odds-on shot at Punchestown last October; beaten 3l in third when odds-on for Naas event won by Carrigmoornaspruce who has shown the form in a good light; respectable fifth in a decent maiden hurdle at Naas; longer trip may suit following second in a 2m Cork bumper three months ago.

runners.name: Nothing Hectic
runners.comment: Best of five runs when second in a mares' contest over this trip at Tipperary last April
runners.spotlight: Best of five bumper outings when second in a mares' contest over this trip at Tipperary last April; held by Doing It In Style on Gowran running.

runners.name: Soldierstown
runners.comment: Dam has a good record at stud, debut point winner, good 7lb claimer aboard, merits respect
runners.spotlight: Half-sister to seven winners including Windsor Avenue (smart bumper and 2m3f-3m hurdle/chase), Ravenhill Road (useful bumper and 2m1f-2m5f hurdle/chase) and Hollymount (bumper and 2m1f/2m4f hurdle); dam 2m-2m7f hurdle winner; made a winning debut in a maiden at Farmaclaffley eight weeks ago; good 7lb claimer aboard, merits respect.

runners.name: Theres Always One
runners.comment: Lost her action early on debut in a maiden hurdle at Downpatrick, safe to rule out
runners.spotlight: Lost her action early on debut in a maiden hurdle at Downpatrick; big price then, safe to rule out.

runners.name: Voodoo Angel
runners.comment: Fair Leopardstown run, closely matched with Jo's Secret and not far behind Hello Jean
runners.spotlight: Half-sister to eight-time winner Emitom; in rear on her only start last season; fair sixth on reappearance at Leopardstown; closely matched with Jo's Secret (fifth) and not far behind third-placed Hello Jean.

runners.name: Zanoosh
runners.comment: Hinted at potential when a remote fourth in a 2m maiden hurdle at this venue in January
runners.spotlight: Ran well for a long way when tenth of 25 in the Goffs Defender Bumper at Punchestown last April; hinted at potential when a remote fourth in a good 2m maiden hurdle at this venue in January
